name: Multiverse: Johnny Quick
description: Knight Models continues the Multiverse line with this expansion. The Multiverse line is a series of expansions that expands both the Batman Miniature Game and the DC Universe Miniature game. This expansion includes a Johnny Quick figure and character sheets.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Commander in Chief
description:
Commander in Chief is a game showing a soldier's rise through the ranks from Private to Commander in Chief.

The game seems to represent the Spanish American War, in fact one portion of the primary Illustration on the game board seems to be an inverse of Fredric Remington's "Grimes Battery", a drawing representing Battery A, 2nd U.S. Artillery. They saw action in Cuba and were involved in the attack on San Juan Hill.

Player count is unknown as is the method of moving players around the track.

There is no clue as to date of publication or publisher.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Emergence Dark Ops
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Emergence Dark Dark Ops, players compete in a Battle Royale: free-for-all format against one another. Players are tasked to retrieve data to their home base to either upgrade abilities for future use or immediately score points and win. Each player is given a secret "target player." Limit your target to the least amount of points, and score massive bonus points, enough to carry you to victory. But be aware that other players will be attempting to sabotage you as well. You won't win Emergence by keeping to yourself. Form soft alliances and timing your betrayal will allow you to gain an advantage, and control the board.

name: Slasher Clash
description:
Movie monsters battle one another to prove which one is supreme!

Slasher Clash is a horror movie-themed game of Supernatural Conflict for three to five Players. Players assume the roles of the monsters, who, in classic genre fashion, hunt and kill Civilians, using Action Cards on specific targets or to set up combos. As Characters complete Objectives, they unlock powerful upgrades to help them become more deadly.

But watch out! Your fellow players likely have their eye on many of the same targets, so you'll have to fight for them!

Each Character has different abilities, a unique upgrade path, and sets up combos in different ways.

The Player that is the first to complete a series of Objectives, or kills the Last Girl, is the winner!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: No Dawn
description:
Hordes of goblins and other terrifying beasts of the land are attempting to lay waste to the city. The various militia inside are mounting a defense in attempt to make one final stand to save the land that they love.

In No Dawn, each player assumes the role of one of these militia, defending the city from the relentless onslaught of goblins, ogres, hill giants, and other creatures who are bent on destroying the final stronghold for mankind. No Dawn is a scenario-driven cooperative game that introduces unique twists to the common mechanisms of worker placement and deck building. Players can partner up on worker spaces to assist in tasks such as recruiting others in the city to the fight, repairing damaged supply lines, and gathering food.

No Dawn introduces a unique threat level mechanism that increases the difficulty of the game as it progresses. This mechanism forces players to make tough decisions about how quickly they want to complete their scenario objectives. Complete the scenario too soon, and players may lose cards that could prove valuable assets for future scenarios.

name: Wer reist mit Knorr Peterli durch die Schweiz?
description:
Simple roll and move game, about a journey through switzerland.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player.
The first playter to reach space 100 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων 9: 7η τέχνη (Quiz Hunt 9: The 7th Art)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole world focusing on Cinema.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece
9.The 7th Art (Cinema)

name: Chimère: Cerf
description: Promotional tile for Chimère C-ER-F

name: CASH
description:
Description from the publisher:

CASH is an attack strategy card game for 2-8 players. It is a highly strategy focused game consisting of 216 uniquely designed cards.

The object of the game is to race to $1 Million while blocking or hindering other players to achieving the same.

CASH is a lot of fun, easy to learn and great for the whole family. However, do not underestimate CASH's unlimited card combinations and strategic options. No two games will ever play out the same AND the game is highly addictive.

name: Disthex
description:
Game Materials:
- A board that constructs by hexagonal grid shaped any size of rhombus. (Begginer game: 7x7, Master game: 11x11)
- Adequate amount of White/Black stones.

Game Objective:
The winner is the first player to connect the opposing sides of the board marked by their colors.

Game Preparation:
Each player has all stones of their color.

Game Play:
Players take turns placing a stone of their color on a unoccupied single cell in the board.
But there is one exception: player can't play on adjacent cells that their opponent previously played on.

Note: The name of Disthex is abbreviation of Distant Hex.
The rule of Disthex was inspired from Hex and Yavalanchor.

name: Yellow Hair
description:
Publisher Description

Indian Skirmish Rules, 1868-1898.

User Summary

A set of skirmish-level historical miniatures wargame rules. These rules are designed to portray late 19th century conflicts in the American West involving American Indians. The rules come in a 32-page saddle-stapled booklet.

name: Basatxu Cup
description:
Mathematical soccer! Amateur rulebook about soccer to play leagues. A couple of 10 side dices are needed to create 1d100 results. Is a simple game where you have 1 million pounds to create a team of soccer and play among other players. There are differenti type of players in the team (goalkepers, defenses, mediums, foward players,...). Also, there are coaches to train specific types of players and you must manage the stadium and its capacity.
Morale (M) and Speed (V) characteristics can be trained specifically in order to increase them.
Matching the attack and defense characteristics of the team, we obtain a result between 0 and 1, taking from there the percentage of balls controlled. Once the nmber of controled balls is determinated, the players calculate to know what the teams do with them:
a) pass to a team mate
b) direct throw
With the direct throws, players calculate the probabilities to score a goal, matching them against the goalkeepers, who may stop the ball.
The player with most scores agaisnt the opponent during the two parts of the match wins the game, but a tie is also possible.
This is the 7th edition of the rules

In Spanish
Fútbol matemático! Reglamento amateur de fútbol para jugar ligas. Es necesario un par de dados de 10 caras para crear porcentajes con 1d100. Se trata de un sencillo juego donde con 1 millón de libras los jugadores se montan su equipo de fútbol para poder participar en ligas. Los equipos se componen de porteros, defensas, medios, delanteros y líberos. Además, hay entrenadores para tipos de jugadores concretos y se gestiona el estadio y su capacidad. Las características de Moral (M) y Velocidad (V) se pueden incrementar con entrenamientos específicos.
Enfrentando las características de ataque y defensa se obtiene un resultado entre 0 y 1, sacando de ahí el porcentaje de control de balón. Una vez sacado el número de balones controlados, se realizan los cálculos para saber qué se hace:
a) pasar a un compañero de equipo
b) chut directo
Con los chuts se sacan las probabilidades de marcar, enfrentando a los porteros, quienes pueden parar.
Gana el partido quien consiga marcar más goles en la portería contraria durante los dos tiempos que tiene el partido, aunque es posible también un empate.
Esta es la 7ª edición de las reglas.

name: Baseball Card Battle
description:
Description from the publisher:

Baseball Card Battle is a dice based, statistics driven board game that uses a person's own baseball card collection to play a realistic game of baseball!

Some game modes are simply ... let's see who rolls best - while other game modes take into account the deep statistics of each player!

Create your own fantasy team with your own cards - or use our included players to battle for victory! We also have exciting Strategy Cards that can be played against your opponent throughout the game! Want to take out a powerful batter? Play your "BRAWL" card to get them ejected from the game!

Multiple modes of play allow for many different game types! Pitcher's Duel, Fast & Furious, Major League, and All-Star modes ... to name a few!

name: MetaX TCG: Green Lantern Booster Set
description:
The Green Lantern Booster utilizes the MetaX game engine, launched in August 2017 with the Justice League Trading Card Game.

Play as Green Lantern or the other Lanterns across the emotional spectrum. Go into battle and win precious Victory Points.

The Green Lantern Booster Set is fully compatible with the Justice League Trading Card Game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Crazy Commute
description:
Crazy Commute is a competitive party game for 3 to 5 players. The rock-paper-scissor mechanics make it a fast-paced and easy to learn game.

Players choose their driver cards to represent them on the play surface and proceed to try to pass each other. When player attempts to pass another player, their target might steal a card from them and allow them to pass...or they might start a duel, requiring both players to play certain cards to win the duel and collect a point. The player who wins 7 duels first wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Racing

name: BattleScars
description:
BattleScars is a fast-paced, high-impact tabletop minis strategy board game. Disputes arise and they need settling! Recruit an Operator, select hot-swappable equipment to adjust during precarious combat situations, make tough choices with tight resource management, and cripple your opponents with devastating damage events. All of that coupled with a dynamic initiative utilized round over round, you’ll measure the advantages and quickly discover some of the disadvantages of shooting first and/or shooting last. A winner will be immediately declared after a player obtains seven victory points. So, test your mettle, and earn your battle ‘Scars!’

—description from the publisher

name: Arm oder reich?
description:
The players move one pawn each arond the game board. Movement is determined by a die. On most spaces the players may buy a commodity or have to pay rent, if the commodity is owned by another player. On the triagular spaces the players lose or win money or have to go to prison for a turn. The game ends after an agreed on time of play or when all commodities are sold. The player with the most money wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 70s Show Super-fan Card Game
description: A fan-made card game, based around the TV Show "That 70s Show". Players use decks representing various characters from the show to recreate episodes represented by cards. These scoring cards have a sequence of characters that must be played to score them, after which the points shown on the cards are added to your total. The first player to reach 21 points wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Survive the Night
description:
Description from the designer:

Survive the Night is a 1-6 player boardgame where the group must use crafting, combat, and strategy to survive the onslaught of either werewolves, vampires, or zombies.

Story cards are introduced at the beginning of the game which allow for multiple decisions and outcomes that change gameplay and sometimes the end goal. Some story cards provide variation in groups creating teams allowing for one individual to be a traitor or just add plot depending on player's decisions.
There are two main locations presented through separate boards where players can search item cards, pool resources and work together to survive. A timer is set designating when The monsters will arrive. Once that is complete more traditional game rounds commence as each player and monster take turns with various actions available to each.

Crafting is available in the form of barricades and health packs. Weapons are found through searching with the more High value ones requiring multiple parts to assemble.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Take That, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Chants of the Fallen
description:
Description from the publisher:

This game is currently being designed by Sebastian Portillo.

name: Shadows in the Void: Sci-Fi Space Combat Miniature Wargame
description:
Shadows in the Void is a unique spacefighter combat miniature wargame based on highly modified core rules of Hind Commander (mainly simplified and streamlined) and inspired by classic ancient Chinese military treatise The Art of War. Unlike most games within the genre, Shadows in the Void focuses on stealth, electronic warfare, and the interactions between spacecraft in your squadron. It certainly is not a “Red Baron in space” ruleset – you won’t see many dogfights during the battles. Why would advanced war machines of the far future use tactics which became obsolete in mid-20th century? Of course, they look very appealing on screen, but not necessarily on the gaming table.

At the moment of release, the miniature range will cover all units from two of the five races, with the remaining ones released gradually in later waves. The miniature scale of choice is 3mm, and the Shadows in the Void range is designed to be compatible with Odział Ósmy PSF 1/600 sci-fi range. The miniatures will be produced in small series, with frequent additions of new versions of earlier units – it’s boring to sell the same miniatures all time, isn’t it?

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Land and Sea War Games
description:
"2 Complete Games in this box 1 Catapult Game 1 Spinner Game"

Two very simple war themed games from the USA in 1941.

Game #1 is a catapult game lasting 4 rounds with scores being added or subtracted from your total based on where your pieces land.

Game #2 is a roll/spin and move game with the goal of being the first to enter the enemy headquarters.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brewin' USA: Boho Rye Promo Card
description: Boho Rye Premium Beer (Bohemian Rye Pilsner) promo card. This card was included in the Kickstarter version of Adam's Apple Games production of Truck Off.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Dust 1947: Recon Mickey III
description:
As the war rages on all fronts the Allies feel the need to have more efficient recon troops: scouts that can get to the enemy before the main assault. These highly trained soldiers needed a new vehicle to do their job safely, and they were rewarded with the Medium Combat Walker Recon Mickey III. This lightly armed walker should not be treated lightly! As its turret was removed, it gained tremendous speed while still mounting a few machine guns for close ground and air defense and a powerful recoiless rifle to deal with any heavier target. The highly trained crew of a Recon Mickey III is very capable of calling in an airstrike or an artillery strike on enemy positions, making it invaluable to any Allied army. The walker is presented here in desert pattern, as used in North Africa and the Middle-East circa 1947.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Heroes of the Arena
description:
Heroes of the Arena is a battle royale themed, hide and seek boardgame. Players pick a Hero and try to survive for as long as possible in a hostile Arena.

In order to win, you have to search and damage opponent heroes with an ancient machine throughout 20 different hideouts. Use the pointing device in the middle of the gameboard to target a hideout and roll the hideout die to determine which hideout you hit. But careful! Hitting your own hero will also reveal and damage him and every move you make may give your opponents the information they need to locate your hero.

Every Hero brings unique abilities and the Arena influences the game with a customizable 40-Card event and items card deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Memory, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Tossers
description:
Description from the publisher:

Tossers is a game where players take turns placing a marked container somewhere, choosing a spot to throw from, making up a tossing rule, and then tossing their beads 1 at a time towards the container. After the beads are tossed, the points are scored and the next player gets to move the container, choose a new spot to throw from, and make up a tossing rule.

name: Damoclès
description:
The Gods are waking up from a long sleep and taking possession of the best fighters of the realm, while waiting to have recovered all their powers. You and your opponent are 2 of these fighters, like 2 Heralds of the Gods.

Damoclès is both a micro-skirmish game and a card game, in a 1vs1 mode.

The first player who inflicts 9 wounds to his opponent wins !

The two players fight one another with a clever combination of action cards. This is a double-guessing system with planning and anticipation. The cards stand for your life in miniature as well.

You may count on a god’s favor to make the difference, unless you trigger their terrible wrath…!

At your turn, choose action cards and play one simultaneously. Cards have a double-direction reading, so do the right choice before you reveal them. Then, resolve the effects. Wounds will cause reorientations and retreats of the figures on the board game.

You lose a card from your deck for each wound. So if you lose 9 cards, you’re defeated !


Entrez dans l'arène de Damoclès.

Damoclès Kézako ?

Les Dieux se réveillent d’un long sommeil et prennent possession des meilleurs combattants du royaume en attendant d’avoir recouvré leur toute puissance pour asseoir leur domination. Votre adversaire et vous-même êtes 2 de ces combattants, 2 Hérauts des Dieux.

C'est à la fois un jeu de micro-escarmouche et un jeu de carte, à 1 contre 1, où 2 joueurs s’affrontent au travers de leur figurine sur une arène (plateau de jeu A3) grâce à une combinaison astucieuse de cartes actions. Les cartes donnent ainsi vie à leur figurine.

Vous pourrez compter sur une faveur d’un Dieu au moment crucial du combat pour faire basculer la balance de votre côté mais méfiez-vous de leur courroux !

Chaque tour, vous choisissez des cartes Actions et en jouez une simultanément. Chaque carte peut se lire dans les 2 sens, à vous de faire le bon choix avant de les révéler. Ensuite, résolvez les effets. Les blessures provoqueront des réorientations et des reculs des figurines sur le plateau …

Chaque blessure vous fait perdre une carte de votre deck. Dès que vous perdez 9 cartes de votre deck, c’est la fin, votre fin !
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Pucks in Deep
description:
Pucks in Deep is a ice hockey themed card game for terrible players

Unlike many of the party games you’ve played before, Pucks in Deep is specifically designed to be as vulgar and disgusting as your beer league teammates.

The game is simple. Each round, one player asks a question from a Puck card and everyone else answers with their funniest Ice card.

Inside each Pucks in Deep box is 460 Ice cards and 90 Puck cards for a practically limitless amount of ice time. A referee card is included in each game box as well, and trust us, it's super satisfying to finally be able to put the ref in the box for a change.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Sports

name: This Belongs in a Museum: Talisman Promo Cards
description:
Set of 5 promo cards.

4 cards of players colors
1 instruction card.

Take the Talisman that matches your Archaeologist. Place it in front of you with the unbroken Talisman side up.

Use the power of the Talisman to grant safe passage for your Archaeologist through an area controlled by any Mummy.

Once you have used the Talisman's ability, flip the card over to show that it's power is not longer available to your Archaeologist.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Feasting Hall: Tales From Valhalla
description:
In this hilarious party game, players are transported to Valhalla, were they play as both gods and mortals. In the feasting hall, the mortals try to impress the gods with their tales of battle, wits and folly!
Each round, one player is a Norse god, and the rest of the players are mortals trying to get the god to choose their tale over the others. The tales are a combination of an Action card, the feat they performed, and a Challenge card, the obstacle they faced. Players guess the type of tale that god would want to hear most and lay the cards before them. The god will read the tales and choose one they wish to hear told aloud. That mortal wins the favor of the god and gets to tell their tale. The player who impresses the gods the most wins! What's your tale?
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Party Game

name: Quattele
description:
The name Quattele is the short form of "Quattro Elementa" - 4 elements, because in this strategy game for 2 - 4 players fire, earth, water and air fight against each other alone or in 2 teams.

The special feature of Quattele is, that each element can only beat one of the other elements and is beaten itself by one. So, for example, water beats fire, but is beaten by earth. Water and air meet as allies.

The rules are straightforward and the moves are basically simple, which is why players can quickly find themselves in the game. However, due to its special set of rules, Quattele offers a high degree of tactical challenge. The players have to attack as well as try to defend the opposing, allied element from the attacks of the opponents.

If you manage to reduce the 10 pieces of the opponent's elements by hitting them to 3 or to occupy the middle of the opponent's starting field, you win the battle of the elements.

—description from the publisher

name: Runes of Ragnarok
description:
Odin, the Allfather, ruler of Asgard, and protector of the Nine Realms, has gone missing. Now, the world tree Yggdrasil is in turmoil. The gods of Asgard fight amongst themselves, vying for the right to rule and to avert the catastrophe.

Runes of Ragnarok is a dice-based elimination game for 2-4 players. It features over 40 custom dice, 4 heroes, and 24 creatures! Take on the role of one of Asgard’s legendary gods, and battle against other players for control of the Nine Realms. Cast the runes, summon mighty creatures, and wield powerful magic as you battle your foes in this free for all game of wits and strategy.

Objective: Be the last Hero standing.

Heroes: Play as one of 4 Heroes in RoR: Thor, Freya, Heimdall, or Sif. Each has a different set of powers and must be ranked up through play to access all of their abilities.

Runes: Roll the Rune Dice each turn. Various combinations of the runes will grant you Focus (the game currency) or any of 12 different spells (in 4 categories). Spells can be used in combat to strengthen your army or attack your Heroes.

Minions: RoR features 24 different creatures (8 types with 3 variants each) which each have their own set of custom dice and combat abilities. Purchase minions with Focus to add them to your Battle Unit. Attack your enemies and prove that you have the strength and might to rule Asgard in Odin's absence!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Spiroz
description:
"A New Twist on Dominoes!"

Description from the back of box (with edits):

Match colors instead of dots in this mind-spinning pattern matching game. But the swirling tiles aren't the only things to make you dizzy. Another twist? EARN POINTS for the tiles you play next to, not for the tile you play. The more high-point tiles you can match in (a) single turn, the more you score. Spiroz is easy to learn, but you'll soon discover that a well-planned strategy wins the game.

Originally released in 2009 as Dizios by Mindware.

name: Wilde Jagd durch Bayern
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Bavaria-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: Neptun und die Fische
description:
Neptune and the fish is played on a playing field 5x5.
Both players have different goals. Black (Neptune) plays with 3 stones and tries to hit either all the white stones, or position himself so that he cannot hit another stone.
A white stone, which is horizontally or vertically adjacent, is hit.

White (the fish) plays with 23 stones and tries to get black in a position where all 3 black stones are in the same row or column. White moves a stone to a free neighboring field, white is not able do remove black stones.

A very original unsymmetrical and pretty fast paced tactical game for 2 persons.

name: Bushido: Uk-Kang
description:
Description from the publisher:

The first of the Dai Bakemono to come to the fore, bigger and stronger than all but the Rinsho Bakemono, Uk-Kang has earned renowned for being fiercely protective of his brethren and it has been noted by the Council of Shadows.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tribal Brutes
description:
Description from the publisher:

Of the many types of Bakemono the Dai-Bakemono make the best shock troopers. Despite their low intelligence which can on occasion force their leaders to change their plans quickly they provide the Bakemono tribes with resilient, hardy and aggressive troops. When their fury is stoked they emit fearsome roars that echo around there deep subterranean caverns and strike fear into the hearts of any who are the subject of their aggression, rushing wildly to smash the foes of the tribes into the dirt. Of the many types of Bakemono the Dai-Bakemono make the best shock troopers. Despite their low intelligence which can on occasion force their leaders to change their plans quickly they provide the Bakemono tribes with resilient, hardy and aggressive troops. When their fury is stoked they emit fearsome roars that echo around there deep subterranean caverns and strike fear into the hearts of any who are the subject of their aggression, rushing wildly to smash the foes of the tribes into the dirt.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Goro
description:
Description from the publisher:

An Onisho forged in battle, beaten and bent over years of combat into a bundle of muscle and murderous energy. Years have taught Goro to anticipate the moves of his opponents, enabling him to time his offense with deadly precision. Knowing exactly when to use multiple crippling strikes or a single brutal blow to finish.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch-Up Game
description: Catch-Up Game is a quiz game by Chris Budde, published by McClean Enterprises. The goal of the game is to answer questions from cards. Which question to read is determined by a die roll. The die have 6 sides: Easy, Hard, All, Choose, Easy and Hard. On a card there is two questions, one easy and one hard. If All is rolled, all players most answer one of the questions, the player selects (easy or hard). If Choose is rolled the player that rolled the die, must choose another player to answer one of the questions. The questions is about personal issues: What is your favorite color? or Name a personal goal.

name: OOF-DAH!
description:
OOF-DAH! is an American Specialty tabletop boardgame for 2-4 players. It has educational content, but the real focus is on fun, competition, and endlessly creative and varied gameplay. The theme is based on organic farming, and the goal is to collect Hunger Tokens by growing organic vegetables on your farm, and feeding local communities. If you play strategically and negotiate successfully with fellow players, or Growers, you can increase your odds of doing well at the Farmer's Market, which dictates crop values and market pricing.
Game-play consists of turn-based die rolls, accompanied by trading between turns. Multiple events may occur on die rolls, allowing for a nonlinear and more engaging style of play. Players, or Growers, must adapt on the fly to ever-changing in-game conditions. A Grower may only score an OOF-DAH! if they grow the right crops on the right cover crops, and if they harvest the correct crops according to the ideal growing season.
Additional scoring opportunities are facilitated by novel features such as 2 Crop Combos, Undercutting, and targeted Marker Token protections. Only the savviest Growers with the keenest sense of what's hot and what's not in the Market, will meet all challenges, earning the right to say, "OOF-DAH!"

name: Die klugen Staatsbürger
description:
User summary:

The players choose a profession (office worker, laborer, physician, farmer, craftsman, trader) and may take the roles of mayor, cashier, city manager, journalist.
The pawns are moved around the board clockwise. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces or event cards make the players earn or lose money. Money is needed to gain achievement token by building muncipal buildings to improve the infrastructure of the city.

When all muncipal buildings are finished, the player with the most achievement token wins the game.

Included on the backside of the game board is the travel game "Österreich-Rundfahrt", where the players have to answer quiz questions about the municipal companies in every city the reach.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Voting

name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-Kan Special Card Pack 1
description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-Kan Special Card Pack 2
description: Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Top Trumps Star Wars: Tseebo Promo Card
description:
A single promo card for the Top Trumps: Star Wars Rebels deck, released in a promotional package for the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austrian.

Stats:
Force: 8
Speed: 7
Fire power:15
Influence: 12
Reliability: 28

Top Trumps Info (translated from German card):
Tseebo (TM) was a close friend of Ezra Bridger's (TM) parents and was working for the "Imperial Office of Information", from where he escaped, carrying confidential files. He was wanted by "the Empire", but saved by Ezra and "the Rebels".

name: Myth of Theuth
description:
When he came to the alphabet, Theuth said: "This art, O king, will make the Egyptians wiser and richer in memory." This is the myth of the invention of writing according to Plato’s Phaidros, which MYTH OF THEUTH takes as base for a playful examination of media theories.

In this fantastic game you will move through ancient Athens, collecting different media in order to complete a mission. You will meet famous people who greatly influenced the development of media and cultural theories. Gotthold Ephraim Lessing shows you the limits of the image, Laura Mulvey takes a delightful gaze on your memorizing abilities, and Marshall McLuhan finally gets his well-deserved massage. Across the 12 stations, you will use smartphones, newspapers, stamps, candy, hand, feet, pairs of eyes, and other means to discover the Myth of Theuth. Whoever manages to finish the mission first – with a combination of strategy, luck, and knowledge – will be worshiped as a divine medium!

MYTH OF THEUTH is designed as a board game, which will be available in three different versions in English and German:


PHAEDRUS, free available version to produce at home, needs approx. 5 to 6 hours;
PLATON, standard version, first edition of 500 pcs.
THEUTH, exclusive version, higher quality of used materials, additional game material (own game pieces, paper, pencils, newspaper articles, post-it notes, candies, LEGO bricks, blindfold, liqueur, envelopes, stamps), limited edition of 100 pcs., signed by artists.

name: Mixed Constructions
description:
Mixed Construction: A sentence that has incompatible elements; the sentence begins one way, with one kind of structure, and then shifts to a different structure.

In this cooperative wordplay game, a team of players works together to create a clue about a person, place or thing given to them from a randomly drawn card. Their partner will be trying to guess what's on their card. Mixed Constructions is a race against the clock where the team works together to maximize the number of correct guesses.

The catch is: players giving the clue can only say one word at a time!
—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Irrgang
description: Each playes has to get his pawn from "Start" to "Ziel". Movement is determined by one die. The players have to get on every space marked with a letter. From there, the rolled number decides the direction of movement.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ekklesia
description:
Ekklesia is a variant of Careers. The players set their own victory conditions. A player may choose to pursue faith, love, joy or a combination of all three. The total number of "points" earned in the 3 categories must total 50. Money is only a means to achieve these goals.

The players move their pawns arrond the board. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces events influence the players movement, gains them money or cause them to spend money. Other spaces cause the players to draw a card and follow the instructions printed there. The players try to fulfill their goal by going through any number of different detours. On finishing a detour, the player gets a movement card, that he may use instead of rolling the die at a time of his own choosing.

The player who gets to his pre-set goal first wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag der Evang. Projektgruppe Hanau, Verlag Wort im Bild

name: Kennziffer 01 zero one
description: The players start at London airport (center space). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to return to London after concluding the four journeys wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Renown
description:
In a world filled with catastrophes, magical mishaps, and big personalities, you have always been lost in the shuffle. Now, yet another disaster has befallen your home, Gloria’s Landing, destroying much of the town in the process. Your chance has finally arrived. It is time to step it up and be more than a follower. It is finally time to gain the renown you’ve always deserved.

Taking on quests, defeating monsters, and fighting your fellow townsfolk, this task won’t be for the feint of heart. Do your best to stay righteous, or give into a life of dishonor. The choice is yours. What will you do to gain renown?

In the Renown card game, you take control of one of 12 unique personalities from the town of Gloria’s Landing. The goal of the game is simple: you want your personality to gain enough Renown to become the next big thing. You’ll gather followers, go on quests, and plot against your competition. The player who reaches twenty Renown first wins.

In this fantasy based card game each turn players will play followers, actions, and use abilities to gain Renown. Afterward they may go on quests where success or failure determines their fate. Play continues around the table, vying for position, until one player reaches their Renown goal.

name: Chronicle of Kings
description:
Chronicle of Kings is set during the Viking age (700-1000) in the Fate of the Norns universe. Players take on a dynasty of Viking rulers who wish to be immortalized in legend.

Victory is achieved by being the bloodline with the most renown, and the game rewards players for memorable play. There are many ways to achieve renown, allowing players to pursue different paths to victory.

Every turn the players perform many actions, which include: quests, military conquests, trade/raid, diplomatic intrigue, etc. Each turn spans several years, meaning that the bloodline will need to plan for marriage and children. Mechanics are designed to tell a vivid and memorable story.

The world is not static, and every turn events occur necessitating that sometimes the player work together to overcome a shared challenge.

The game also features a campaign book, allowing for solitaire play.
categories: Economic, Exploration, Medieval, Mythology, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Worker Placement

name: Air Raid
description:
The idea of the game is to fly the planes across no-man's land, into enemy territory and bomb enemy buildings or ammunition dumps and at the same time protect property within own territory from being destroyed by enemy air raids. The planes start from the first row, move into a formation giving the best advantage, cross no-man's land where they Weill be met by opponents' planes in an attempt to resist the attack. Planes will be shot down and taken from the board, bombs dropped and buildings destroyed. In the end the game will be won by the General of the air.
—description from the rulebook

The game includes fighters which can move straight up to 3 spaces or move less and turn. Bombers can move straight 2 spaces or less and turn.

Supports up to 4 players with 4 sets of planes.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Neighbor of the Beast
description:
Each player is in charge of a different color group of houses in the neighborhood.This game uses territory control and "Take-that!" game mechanics. Every time The Beast is moved to a different house or is annoyed by his neighbors, he gets angrier and angrier. The cards present methods of moving The Beast or rearranging the layout of houses in the neighborhood, and have different anger values for each such method. When The Beast's total anger value reaches the breaking point, he RAGES and destroys all houses adjacent to his.

Each player must manage when and where The Beast rages, thus destroying the houses around him. The ultimate goal is to have more of your opponents' houses destroyed than yours. When The Beast lives in one of your houses, you actually gain points. When The Beast lives next to one of your houses, there's risk of him destroying them in a fit of rage, costing you points. All other houses out of harm's way (not adjacent to The Beast) tally point values as well. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Opale Noir
description:
Opale Noir is a game where you play as precious stones hunters.
Your goal is to acquire a collection of stones among the rarest and most prized of the planet: Alexandrites, Benitoites, Jadeites, Painites.
In this game all the moves are allowed; you will have recourse to the crime, to the magic of the stones (in other words Lithomancy), to the political manipulations of the Metropoles, to negotiation and other subterfuges to reach your goal.

Players with the most Prestige points win the game.

The mining empires can quickly ascend and be of a formidable power, but here all power is more or less an illusion and many empires have only a fear, see their inconsistency unraveled, end up disfigured by some birds of prey until the fragments of their formerly imposing forces eventually turn against them. Bluff, audacity and deterrence are essential compensating factors for the success of such empires.
It would be sage to mention that these empires share their intrinsic apprehension with the clarity, ruthlessly attract players fanatic of the order, suspecting and nosing without intransigence or even players without morals that such parasites survive to them.
Let us mention again the Lithomanian players who under the blindness of their autarkic devellopement bring to their entourage the severe weight of their misdeeds and spells.
zEach puzzle of these great strategic currents offers their pieces, free to each of them to arrange on the woof of an original and inventive strategy.
We are dealing here with a fierce competition for limited resources, whose pecuniary values and interest in terms of objective correspond to a tight and fluctuating timing.
Within this latent tension it is up to the players to contain their disconveniences because expansion and margins of actions are amply dependent on a collaboration of good quality, sometimes forced, if not imposed.
A world where raptors and wolves live under the cover of a lamb will be very sad if the spirits of the stones are displeased by so many lithurgical vacarmes and human activities, mingle with the party, leaving their apparitions to their disappearance that a trail of desolations, whose effects will be crescendo with the power of the players, frequencies of irruption will go along with the frenetic appetite of the players for the inestimable stones.
- The Prestige, A balancing act
This game will still be far too wise if there was this subtle tension of the tightrope walker on his rope, handle this wrist of markers "Useful to do everything" and which at the slightest false step sticks crumpled after crumb at the bottom of a chasm, offers salt and pepper to the most deceitful.
Players will judicieusemet, meticulously, split their markers to see the immobilized on options broken down between the game board, the recruiting board and their personal trays.
- The Prestige, deep strategy
Like a game of chess the order is reversed here, the beginning of the game wide open, the abundance and the adaptability of the choices (however tempered by some pecuniary need
and the always too measured coming of the stones) nourish the naiveté of the player, alas for the most part the net does not close too quickly, the voices of survival is reduced and the actions which there will be no need for an interest in an andean are gradually taking on a disproportionate importance.
The players will end up breathless, until the last final moment, but is it not out of breath that it builds the prestige of a victory?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Trading

name: SMART Microgrid Card Game
description:
In an effort to explain what the Smart Microgrid Applied Research Team (SMART group) does at the British Columbia Institute of Technology, Alan Stewart designed the SMART Microgrid Card Game. It's a fast, easy-to-play "competition" to see who can manage their RESEARCH in order to be the first to build their Microgrid technologies in all three categories: GRID, ENERGY, and PEOPLE, all while trying to deal with DELAYs played by their opponent.

In gamer terms, it's an anti-deck-building fighting game.

name: Johnny Staccato
description:
Board game based on the 1959 / 1960 U.S. TV Detective series.

From the instructions:

Johnny Staccato, a piano player at Waldo's Club is also a private eye with 6 special cases on his books which involve :-
Murder / Arson / Blackmail / False Pretences / Burglary / Hit and Run Road Accident.
He enlists the aid of his friends, each choosing a case to solve. A friendly rivalry exists between them as they each endeavour to collect a set of clues that will solve a case.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:

The object of the game is to be the first to collect a complete set of 8 cards of one particular series which will show the complete crime from start to finish. The first player to do so is the winner.

name: Tank Girl Super Game
description:
Let Tank Girl and the gang help you as you try to collect as much gold as possible before time runs out!

The Tank Girl Super Game is a traditional board game in which Tank Girl and friends help you to collect as much gold as possible before time runs out. Includes an A4 card playing board, four coloured counters, thirteen illustrated game cards, cut-out Gold tokens, a mini die, and game instructions.

name: Halt!
description:
The players start at "Start". The first to reach the parking lot wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. At certain spaces, traffic related events hinder or help the players, as described in the game rules. The game is designed to teach children about traffic signs.

The older Liliput editions show the traffic signs from 1927. In 1934 the game was updated to the new traffic signs. Some of these are pictured with the old arrows still around them, being a combination of old and new.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Achtung! "S-Kurve": Großes Motorrad-Rennen
description:
The game is for 2 players or 2 teams of players. Movement is determined by 3 dice with the numbers 1 to 5. On 2 dice, the 6th side is blank (stud). On the 3rd die, the 6th side is red (called gas station attendant). Each player or team has 5 motorcycles and 5 numbered race tracks. If it's track number is rolled the motorcycle advances 1 space. If the player rolls red, he may move any motorcycle 4 spaces; if all 3 dice show the same number, the motorcycle on the track of this number is moved 4 spaces. The gas stations count for 4 spaces. Each motorcycle arriving at the finish line gets a set number of points, depending on the order of arrival. The player or team with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: To Berlin
description:
English board game from WWI. No rules available or any information about how many players or how the players advance (dice or spinner). Also the squares have different elements (solid red, red cross, and star) that have some kind of game play aspect.

Board says it is part of "Valentine's Series"

name: Ideal Map of Muckden Battlefield
description: Odd game regarding the battle of Muckden. No rules or units exist as far as I know but the map speaks of reserve placement, cavalry, cossacks, railroads, cavalry charges and shots. Towns are noted by numbers and there are names of key General and towns.

name: La Guerre Moderne
description: This is a huge watercolor point to point board game of French battles in WWI that was drawn in 1915. It does not have a title but the internet says its "La Guerre Moderne". The internet also said it was published in 1914 but you can see on the bottom Série 1915 (Series 1915). There appears to be an artist's name in the bottom left corner but it is not readable.

name: NeoParadise: Rampage
description:
NeoParadise: Rampage is a card game set in a science fiction, dark fantasy, post-apocalyptic world where 4 factions slaughter each other for "survival".

Main Features

The 4 groups have different play styles but that's not all. Each faction either adds or changes a rule of the game to their advantage, but that's not all! Each faction also possess a different resource system!
How to win, during the match players will play buildings (one of the 3 card types) to form their "base". This constructions can be damaged and the moment your enemy has no more of them in the field, you win.
We have 2 ways of playing, one in which you play with your deck in 1 pile, and another in which you separate your deck in 2 piles. You can choose from which pile you draw your card each turn. This decreases luck and increases strategy.


Comments from the designer:

A big part of the game is that all factions are broken and fragile at the same time. All of them can win or lose against all of the others in a ridiculous way, specially when you get the hang of it.

In this game we have 3 card types, Units, Buildings and Interventions. Units represent your "troops", Buildings make your base and Interventions are standalone effects. You can't cancel enemy effects in this game, only normal attacks from
Units.

While it's not difficult to learn, specially if you have played other card games, the fact that every faction is so different might make you feel you are learning 4 games at the same time...Might.

Also, when it comes to playing times, the one registered is the standard. But sometimes, specially when you really grasp the game and you get top level luck: you can get a 3 minute match... This happened only once during testing, quite a funny thing it was. And also, if you have no idea whatsoever and get terrible luck it can stretch up to an hour and a half. Only in those circunstances.

name: Mobius Corpse
description:
A creative word and writing game inspired by Exquisite Corpse, and somewhat similar to Eat Poop You Cat, but with creative writing as the underpinnings instead.

Each player writes a story fragment of some agreed-to size. They can either agree to a specific theme, voice, or tense, or they can have no such agreement at all. Then one player, known as the moderator, tells each player who to send his story fragment to. Each player will send his fragment to two different players, one with the subject "first" and the other with the subject "last". After a player receives a "first" and a "last" from other players, he must write a transition that connects the two story fragments together. The completed work is sent back to the moderator with the subject "transition", and the moderator puts together the complete story, linking fragment to transition to fragment to transition, and so on. The result is a story that loops, and is usually quite disconnected.

name: Battalions
description:
Battalions is a card game for 2-4 players which uses two packs of 52 standard playing cards.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which players are trying to manoeuvre cards from a battalion pool in front of them and in to their hand (deployment). When any player has succeeded in deploying 5 cards (i.e. have 5 cards in their hand) the game ends and the players go to war. The cards are counted and scored and the player with the highest total has defeated the other players and won the game (War).

—description from the publisher

name: Bushido: Ayako Ito
description:
Many have failed to notice the snake like qualities of Ayako so beguiled by her beauty, the Ito could probably have married into a greater clan before her transformation. A Shisai of the highest order, when she combines strength with her sisters she can become nigh-unstoppable.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Satoshi
description:
He is beast of a man revered by the Ito ashigaru for his size and strength. Some jokingly claim he must have been stolen from the Minimoto, but never within earshot of Satoshi. His sheer determination have seen him survive where others would submit.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kenzo Ito
description:
Brave, strong and incredibly mobile Kenzo is the perfect soldier. Orochi’s touch has improved Kenzo’s ability to take the fight to the opponent and he does so with no care for his own safety. He strikes fast and more often than not he strikes first.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Naoko
description:
Naoko was one of the first to be blessed by Orochi when he was stirred from his slumber by the actions of Itsunagi. No one is sure where the transformation will take her next, but her size and the blinding venom she spits terrifies the hardiest of opponents.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kazuhiko
description:
Kazuhiko has taken the first steps to joining the followers of Orochi and he will do whatever it takes to prove his devotion. He gives his all to support those touched by Orochi and ensure their safety.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Takeji
description:
Takeji is renowned for his bravery and steadfastness; born to a higher status he could have achieved great heights as a samurai. As it is he is an important member of the Ito’s small force of ashigaru, his qualities have however been noted by his superiors.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kaihime Ito
description:
Orochi found Kaihime a worthy recipient of her gifts and bestowed upon this deadly samurai archer the means to carry out her will. Her keen eye and swift arm sew dead across the battlefield. Her arrows find their way through even the toughest Minimoto armour and if the cold Ito steel doesn’t finish her unlucky targets, Orochi’s blood soon devourers them from inside, leaving those praying for a swift end.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Masunagi Ito
description:
Little is known of Itsunagi Ito’s enforcer. The “Red Death” as he is known in Okyo, named so for the mask that never leaves his face. Some whisper that Orochi’s gift has warped and distorted his face. What is clear is that his mind is definitely twisted. The apparent satisfaction he makes from cleaving his foes in half, or the calmness in battle reflects the actions of one who is teetering close to madness. Rumours and conjecture aside what is undisputable is that Masunagi Ito is a fearsome and brutal warrior on the field of battle.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Jade Mamba Guard
description:
The Shisai and Samurai of the Ito clan feel no fear, even in the heart of enemy territories, when they are escorted by the Jade Mamba Guard. Their loyalty to the rulers of Izu is total and unquestionable. Their number made up of the faithful of Orochi and a strict selection process ensures that only the best remain and are allowed to take on the honor of guarding the Ito elite. Although the training is a closely guarded secret it is whispered that the final test for the recruit is to put his or her hand into a basket containing the deadly Jade Mamba, if the prospect’s loyalty is not total they are bitten and left to die in excruciating agony.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hitoshi
description:
A seasoned veteran of many conflicts and a loyal servant of the Ito clan. On the battlefield Hitoshi skilfully wields the sasumata to immobilise his enemies, pinning them to the spot after knocking them from their feet with a deft spin of his pole arm, enabling his comrades to close and finish them with little difficulty. Although the Ito clan were laughed at by other clans for their development and implementation of the sasumata, now in open war many are made to reconsider their opinions as the effectiveness of this unusual weapon cannot be denied.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yatsumata
description:
It’s unclear if this huge snake is a priestess of Orochi warped by the Kami into its image or simply a monster from the jungles of Shimagamo. In battle Yatsumata moves with frightening speed and direction as if guided by an unseen hand. In combat each head can deliver a muscle wasting venom through foot long fangs as hard as iron, downing even the toughest warriors as they are reduced to a whimpering mess. Two heads leave the unholy beast with few natural blind spots, adding to its already strong survivability and resilience gifted by its speed and thick scales.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Saburo
description:
Orochi’s gift presents differently in all her worthy followers, it might be a reflection of an individual’s persona or of Orochi’s intentions for them, subtly crafting the recipient into a tool in the service of their god. If Saburo were a tool it would be a scalpel, fashioned of Minimoto steel. This cool and calm servant of the Ito was once a temple bushi, and as all who demonstrate their devotion was chosen to receive the gift. The physical training that is integral to the training of the Orochi temple bushi was only further enhanced after his transformation into a hebimiman. Now the frightening warrior of the Ito emerges from the shadows to dispatch the enemies of the Ito, disappearing just as fast leaving his foes shocked and with no target for retaliation.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Tamotsu
description:
Where the Prefecture have embraced the new advancements of gunpowder weapons the Ito have always preferred to concentrate their martial pursuits on the more traditional weaponry, specifically the short bow which their archers wield to great effect. Their archers are swift and deadly in the terrain of Izu, and their slightly smaller bows allow for maximum movement in the jungles. Tamotsu is a gifted scout, trail finder and an integral part of the Ito’s war efforts.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Taisei
description:
Deep in the cold, moist temples to Orochi where the greatest nightmares lurk, Taisei waits, conserving his energy only for the bidding of the one true Kami. His physical prowess making him an impressive specimen of the Hebi, his great strength allowing him to wield the no-dachi with frightening agility, fearsome power or crushing an enemy beneath muscled coils, immobilised and helpless to the mercy of the merciless.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Okyo Archer
description:
The ashigaru in the Okyo garrisons are massing in preparation for the battles to come. Whether armed with the Okyo naginata, a slightly smaller version of the standard weapon due to the confines of the terrain, or the Ito short bow they are ready to combat the enemies of the snake. The versatile archers make excellent skirmishers, lightly passing through the densest undergrowth before raining death upon the enemy with cold Izu steel.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Child of Orochi
description:
The Children of Orochi serve in his temples, young Ito pledged to their father, they give everything including their souls to the Great Coiled One, in the hope that he will bestow them with his favour and change their imperfect forms which they are cursed to wear until they proven themselves worthy. So devoted to him that his chosen are able to use their bodies as conduits of his power, further extending his react and the power of Shisai.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Jirou
description:
The Ito are not known for their courage like the stoic Bear or fearsome Dragon, however that is not to say that their troops are not filled will a sense of pride and purpose when urged on, under the Ito Mon. Jirou flies the standard with honor inspiring his comrades against those who oppose the Snake.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Okyo Ashigaru
description:
Ashigaru are the mainstay of the houses of Jwar, making up the bulk of all the major and minor clans’ military forces. As one would expect they personify the teachings and martial practices of their lords. The Bear are strong and tough, the Dragon, drilled and brave and the Snake cowardly but cunning. Using their numbers to their advantage when fighting as a unit they are a formidable foe.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kyou
description:
Whilst the female Shisai perform rituals and tend to Orochi's shrines, the male initiates are the martial arm of the faithful. Instead of blessings of transformation and the ability to channel the Will of Orochi; he has been gifted a serpent companion. Even if Kyou finds himself debilitated his escort fights on unaffected. He also empowers other Shisai around him increasing their commitment to the cause.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Ito Clan Special Card Pack 1
description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create very a focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are three types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event and Terrain Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the factions strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Ito Clan Special Card Pack 2
description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits
description:
Breggsit Island: A Battle of Twits is a 3 to 6 player game where you play politicians using creative bribery, or inventive blackmail to manipulate ordinary peeps of Breggsit Island and gain their support. Draw cards from the deck to construct the perfect most hilarious bribe or the most devious cunning and poignant blackmail to suit your target and ward off any counter bribes from the competition.

This adorable hilarious Board Game satirizes the ridiculous nature of modern politics and campaigning. Enjoy rich original artwork, easy to learn, enjoyable game play and hilarious in game mechanics.

—description from the publisher

name: UFM: Football Highlights
description:
UFM: Football Highlights is the first game of the series of board games about the football (soccer) club management.

It's about the best moments of football matches.

You are the manager of one of the two underdog (mediocre) clubs which eager to be real glory hunters.

In the game, you have to determine the formation of footballers on the field, give instructions to players, strengthen the team by newcomers, learn and use new formations. There are referees, red cards, injuries, penalties, substitutions and everything is like in real football.

You have to rise from mediocre team to the winner of the first UFM trophy - Underdogs Cup.

Game components are divided into 5 envelopes. In each of those is the card of the referee appointed for the upcoming match, new or additional components, as well as brief rules on how to use them. The scenario and rules will become more complicated with the growth of your experience. In the final you have to fight for the Underdogs Cup.

In first envelope you get team with 15 players and the most popular formation 4-4-2. Each player has attack and defend skills. There are also cards "match events" and referee card. Every referee has own preferences. First one is loyal. There are in the game different referees: strict, very strict, unfair, undecided, etc.

You don't need to play full match. Instead of it you have to play 3 attacks, named "highlights", in every time of match. "Highlight" is finished when goal scored or team lost the ball. All footballers lay face down in starting formation and attacking manager choose one of them and open his card. Defending manager choose one of his players and open his card in front of attacking player. Then they roll dices (d10) and add result to attack and defend accordingly to their players. After each "highlight" you have to open "match event" card. And make all actions from it. Every effect of "match events" depends on the referee of the match.

In the next envelopes you get "team instructions" cards which helps to affect actions at the field and to decrease random.

After completing the scenario with Underdogs Cup, you will get more freedom to act. You can open the last envelope with additional formations, referees, and game currency. For this money you can buy your own players. There will be also stickers to improve skills of your players and tournament cards for playing your own tournaments.

Underdog - the weakest of two or more rivals. Literally meaning is "lower dog". The term arose by the end of the XIX century in the US during the dog fights. Often losing dog usually lies next to the paws of the winner or literally under it. The more surprising thing was its unexpected victory over a strong opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Polemos Napoleonic Companion
description: This supplement to the Polemos Napoleonic rules adds more scenarios, army generators, a campaign system including a sample campaign scenario and map. It also includes a period glossary and orders of battle for the various armies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Oodles of Utils
description:
Oodles of Utils is a tabletop boardgame that has been developed to encourage players to have fun while discussing 'tribal priorities' chosen blindly at the start of the game. These tribes each prioritises two of the four points (Money, Health, fun and Goodwill) and are then rewarded at the end of the game for having 'lived' according to their 'tribes' priorities.

The game is competitive and cooperative, which creates a warm atmosphere and brings out the best in players.

The game is a two sided board, where players throw the dice and move around the board along the path. When players throw doubles they may move forward or backwards. There are 3 levels of play, from 13+ (younger with assistance). The game takes approximately 2 hrs, depending on how much discussions people have. The game player numbers are three to six. Five players are optimal.

The goal of the game is to earn priority points by making decisions based on your tribal priorities. Lower value points may be traded with other players, thus creating an opportunity to cooperation with other players for a win/win outcome.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pinocchio Mini
description:
Pinocchio Mini: True Or False is a storytelling game that helps you to get to know your friends and family better. You might discover a lot of funny things about them you didn’t know about!

600 different topics to stimulate the storyteller to tell infinite life stories.

The active player chooses 1 topic to share his/her relevant experience (true story) or to make up a story (lie story), then place the corresponding True/Lie card face down on the table. After telling the story, other players can pay 1 Angel token to ask a question to check the authenticity, then guess the story is true or lie. Who guesses wrong will stack up a nose token on his/her Pinocchio head. To increase to excitement if half or more players have guessed correctly, the storyteller has to stack a nose token also.

Game continues until all players finish to tell a story, the shortest nose Pinocchio will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Bushido: Harukichi
description:
A seasoned and cunning tactician in all affairs. His razor sharp mind and unflinching resolve make Harukichi an exceptional businessman and leader. Those in his gumi display an unshakable faith in his decisions and follow his orders without question or pause. Those who follow the Five Fortunes believe that you make your own luck and this is particularly true in Harukichi’s case. It appears to his enemies that should Harukichi will it his followers are able to achieve the most unlikely feats, whilst their own trip, stumble and flail wildly.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: GooaAAAal!: Junior Pack
description:
GooaAAAal! Junior Pack is a soccer dice game made for 2 players (it can actually be played with more players as soon as each player has got 4 dice)
It comes with twice 4 dice, each having 6 faces (1 BALL, 1 GOALKEEPER, 2 FANS, 1 MISSED SHOT and 1 PENALTY)

The one who scores more goals wins

There are 2 main ways to score.
during a 3 throws period Draw a line between the players. One player rolls his dice and decide wether he can/want to place BALL and GOALKEEPER on the line. The opponent does the same. The one having more BALLS than the opponent has GOALKEEPER at the end of the period scores the equivalent number of points. Some faces provide support (FAN), some other not (MISSED SHOT) and some may give an extra chance to score (PENALTY)

during a PENALTY KICK OUT The quickest to roll, obtain the 4 faces PENALTY, assemble them properly, and show them up shouting GooaAAAal! wins. Either he scores 1 point or stops the ball !!

A game is traditionally played in 2 periods, with extra time of 3 throws if needed.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Sports
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Majestik
description:
Each player commands a different team of acrobats. All teams work together in the great artistic performance of human columns. In this performance, acrobats climb over each other to form columns with up to 10 artists "performers".

Players can built simultaneously up to five of these human columns. Although the columns are built together, teams compete with each other for the public recognition that comes in the form of applause.

An act (one game round) ends when at least two columns are completed. At this point the audience applauds enthusiastically.
Obviously these applauses are directed to the teams whose acrobats have participated the most on the completed columns. Then these artists leave the scene to get some rest.

Acrobats that participate in the incomplete columns remain on the scene and also receive applause for their teams; after all supporting artists also have their importance in the show.
The whole show lasts for three acts. In the end of the third act the "grand finale" takes place. Each player scores its last applause points and some bonus points are awarded too.

The player, whose team has most impressed the audience during tonight’s presentation (gathered the most applause points) will be the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Les aventuriers
description: Your adventurer must find a path into jungle. If he finds a treasure, hide it. at the end of the game, the adventurer with the most points wins the game.

name: European War Game Series: The French Army
description:
A sequel to the Parker Bros. Great European War Game, this is a standalone "shoot 'em up" game where the targets are soldiers and officers of the WWI French Army. The cardboard soldiers are 6" high; the mounted officers just over 7" high and the cloth flag on pole rises to 8".

The most interesting feature of this game is the muzzle-loading cannon used for shooting. The hollow wooden barrel, 4.75" long, has a spring-loaded knob at the breech connected to a wooden pusher inside the barrel. Wooden bullets are loaded at the muzzle and ejected when the knob is released.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Wargame, World War I

name: Omegaland
description:
Omegaland is a game built around a tarot deck themed after a Mad Max type of world.

Omegaland situates tarot in a dystopian world where resources are scarce and violence is rampant. Society has been brought to its knees but humanity and hope manage to shine through in this intense 78-card tarot deck. With fascinating back stories in the 52-page booklet, urban warriors give their unique perspectives on the Fool’s journey through the Omegaland landscape.

Omegaland also includes game instructions for a strategic trick-taking game by Karen Boginski. Deck includes six additional cards with gameplay hints, goals, powers, and scoring guidelines.

—description from the publisher

name: Crazy Trains: The Game of Loco-Motion!
description:
An exciting new family board game where everyone can enjoy the thrill of riding the rails!

You're riding the rails on a four-car train headed to New York City. Be the first to safely guide your train into the Big Apple...and you WIN!

But it won't be EASY! Along the way, you'll face many challenges including Competitor Trains and Curly the Conductor who's going to make this the...Craziest Trip Ever!

Curly's special Conductor Die must be rolled in addition to your dice of Coal, each roll bringing you closer OR farther away from your final destination.

With your skills as an "Engineer" and a little luck, you'll be unstoppable in your RACE to NYC!
So hop aboard and Conduct your way to Fun!

—description from the designer

name: In the Loop
description:
"Getting the necessary signatures to build the elevated train took both cash and guile." -- Charles Yerkes, Chicago, 1894

It is the 1880’s, and Chicago rises like a phoenix from the ashes of the Great Fire. Rail is king in this city on the grow. As a power broker, your pockets are lined by train companies competing to build the new elevated rail system, “The Loop.” In this game, players work together to build the loop while hiding which line they work for, because everyone is scheming for a big piece of this corruption pie.
In the Loop is a 2-4 player game of puzzle building, tactical planning, and secret motives.

Objective: Line your pockets by connecting lines and working to make your line the best. You earn money in two ways: during gameplay, you earn money by connecting lines to route cards.
