Ser el primero en conseguir 2 fichas de título honorífico “Honoris Beer”. Para ello habrá que tener suerte en las tiradas del dado y elegir bien en cada jugada a quién se le dificulta la obtención y posesión de recursos para que no consiga estas fichas de título.

PREPARACIÓN DE LA PARTIDA:

1. Cada jugador elige un color (morado, naranja, amarillo o marrón) y coloca su ficha en su zona de mesa.

2. Se baraja el mazo de las 40 cartas de personajes y se coloca bocabajo en el centro de la mesa.

3. También junto al mazo se colocarán los recursos de vasos de cerveza y los recursos de barriles, así como el dado amarillo de veinte caras con numeración del 1 al 20 y las fichas de título “Honoris Beer”.

name: Bushido: Tetsuso
description:
There comes a time after many cycles when a Korusea has spent so long living a life on the waves that he starts to become more comfortable on the gentle rocking of a ship than the solid earth of land. Tetsuso has been touched by the Kami of the sea and turned into a monster of shell and claw, a formidable adversary capable of snapping bone and steel alike.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Asami, Sea Witch
description:
She is a daughter of the waves, a sister to the sea. She speaks with mists of the waters, able to command their presence to confuse and daze. Her siren sound is music and death knell to all but the most hardy and resolute. In battle she calls forth water for the environment to wash away toxins, extinguish flame, calm the mind or as a hammer to batter foes. She brings great flexibility just like the water from which she was born.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Duri
description:
He is almost as good a shot as he boasts and with his two “ladies” by his side, a threat to even the most nimble monk or heavily armour samurai, making him a legend amongst the Jung. The tale of how he lost his leg a source of much amusement amongst his peers.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mars Open: Subscriber promo
description:
This promo card for Mars Open was mailed to subscribers of the Bellwether Games newsletter.

Its an unfolded "ball" card.

Card back has the normal game markings but says "Subscriber".

From the card:

"Instructions -

1. Fold each corner on the dotted line as indicated. (Adjacent corners will be folded opposite directions.)
2. Rotate the "ball" so the open side faces you.
3. Flick away!!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Bushido: Ryota
description:
Ryota is the perfect pirate. He is a shock troop of unparalleled ability, his transformation into a Great White has only added to his impact. Years spent leading the charge whether it be onto naval vessels or merchant junks has refined Ryota’s skills into a well honed tool that the Jung prize highly. Once he has charged through the defense’s of his enemies he has the energy to hold the ground until his allies catch up.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yori, The Whale Hunter
description:
The legend of Yori is known across the Jung, spread mainly by the man himself. When deep in his cups he will tell any that will stop to listen to him, boasts from catching whales of unfathomable size to wild and fantastical sea creatures. The truth is Yori is no better with the harpoon than anyone else, however he has learnt to be resourceful in battle. He always has sake on hand and uses it to bolster his own and others' confidence when combat ensues.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Jung Pirates Special Card Pack 1
description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want.

These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kami of Reflection
description:
The Kami of Reflection is a beautiful if alien spirit. The icy tendrils that form its mortal realisation are hard as diamond but brittle as glass. As it moves the light from Amaratsu flows through its body, deflecting the energy of friend or enemy to prevent rituals and prayers alike.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Minor Kami of Water & Air
description:
The Kami can no longer sit by and watch the Balance be thrown further from its natural alignment. Whilst the Temple benefit greatly from the advantages these Kami grant their forces, the stirring of the elements is a further sign of how much work is to be done.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Ying-Jian
description:
Ying-Jian is the eldest of the three brothers and naturally Shuohuang and Shenzhiqi look to him for leadership. At a nod from Ying-Jian the three operate in unison. He has always been an able swordsman however years of being on the run, hunted down, have worn away at his honour as much as his constitution. He has developed skills and techniques not taught in any koryu but earned doing whatever it takes to survive.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Shenzhiqi
description:
Shenzhiqi is the youngest of the three and in honesty without his brothers he would have fallen or been captured moons ago. That said he is as important to them as they are to him, together they push each other to greater feats and when fighting alongside each other they become a seemingly unstoppable force. Where Ying-Jian has foregone some of the niceties of their upbringing Shenzhiqi has somehow managed to maintained his moral compass.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Shuohuang
description:
Shuohuang is considered one of the greatest swordsmen in the empire, he has surpassed all kenjutsu masters who ever taught him and any samurai with any skill with a blade will know his name. He is a living legend. Like his brothers though Shuohuang is tired from being chased across the empire, only his sheer doggedness and determination to live motivates him to go on. Many would like the scalp of Shuohuang, none have succeeded yet.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Baichi
description:
Baichi lives to support the brothers. Where others may have slunk off into the night he has been steadfast in his loyalty and devotion. He is vital for their cause and the brother’s know it, many a time he has allowed them to achieve unexpected feats on the battlefield. His importance is such that even his master Shenzhiqi will throw his body on the line in order to protect him and keep the supply lines open.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Star-Struck City
description:
The Star-Struck City sets players in the sunken ruins of Casa-Omnicidi, now called Perditus; a Primavantor city of incredible wealth recently risen from the seabed. Treasure and danger alike await your warbands, as they travel through the waterlogged city in search of the shards of the meteor that struck down the once-mighty port city and drove it beneath the waves.

Star-Struck City is a skirmish game, designed around playing with small warbands of 5-15 models on a 4′ x 4′ table loaded with terrain. Warband members advance, gaining new skills, equipment, and injuries as they survive the rigors of battle in this deadly locale. Climb up buildings and run between rooftops, leap down to ambush enemies from above, hire war machines and epic heroes from the Kings of War armies, and build your warband’s reputation as the fiercest and toughest fighters in all of Mantica.

The rules are based heavily on Kings of War, so players of the full-size wargame should feel right at home. It’s heavily inspired by other skirmish games such as Mordheim, but with the ease-of-play the Kings of War rules provide so gameplay is quick and decisive.

As the surviving veterans of The Star-Struck City have said: Perditus now only offers riches or death. What will you find?

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien Poltergeist
description:
In the year 2240, corporate raiders have moved from the wall street to space. The two most infamous corporate raiders, the ruthless Conny Black and the guileful Rothchildes are on the front lines of this new war.

Overview
Two players take control of rival alien crews in a constant struggle to rule the grid. As the leader of a crew, you will increase your reputation and damage your opponent’s in three key ways:
1) Controlling the grid by converting it to your crew’s color
2) Using remote exploits to damage your opponent’s system
3) Hacking into your opponent’s mainframe and stealing valuable data

Objective
There are a limited amount of REP tokens in the general supply. The player with the most REP when the token supply runs out wins!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Storytelling, Take That

name: Heroes of Pterro
description:
Glory or ruin—what do the cards hold for you?

Will you be heroes or villains? The choice is yours!

Using cards similar to a traditional Tarot deck, players vie to form parties of adventurers and complete quests while preventing others from doing the same!

Heroes of Pterro is an Adventuring Party Card Game for 3 to 5 players, ideal for 30 minutes of fast-paced fun and competition.

—description from the publisher

name: Goliadopoly
description: Themed version of Monopoly based around Goliad, Tx
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ball Busters: Golf
description:
This is a trivia card game with a golf theme. The deck of question cards is passed around the table with each player answering a question until there is an incorrect response. The deck then moves to the right with another player attempting to provide the answers. The first contestant to get three correct answers in a row is declared the winner.

Sample Card:

Question: The World Golf Hall of Fame is located in what Florida city?

Answer: St. Augustine

Includes cards, rules, and a storage box.

name: Earth: Endgame
description:
Scientist have discovered the fact that the sun will emit a solar burst, that will burn the earth crust and everything on it. The exact timing of the solar burst is not known, so the worlds 7 factions will franticly prepare for the coming doom by digging a base below earth where people can live until the earth yet again is habitable.

Each faction will build ”rooms” with special functionality (base cards), research technologies to improve their chances for survival (Tech cards) , and play action-cards to affect their own or other factions progress. An important part of the game is the centralized trading of resources between players.

—description of the publisher
mechanics: Trading, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Welt 97: Expansion Set
description:
Expansion for Welt 97

Contains randomly chosen

3 cardboard strips
2 sticker strips
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Multiplying Like Rabbits
description:
It's mating season, and these rabbits are getting out of control!

A quick and easy 18 Card Micro-Game, you and your opponent square off trying to be the first to empty their hands of proliferating rabbit cards.

Each player is dealt 9 random cards, some female and some male rabbits. Cards must be played in order that they appear in your hand, top to bottom. Simultaneously you play your card..
2 Males: they stay in the pile
2 Females: they stay in the pile
1 Male 1 Female: They Mate!! The player who played the lower numbered card must take the entire pile of played rabbit cards!

Play continues in this fashion until one players hand is empty and is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Toi-Toi, die Grabenhopser
description:
The game board is divided in half by a moat. Each side is the home side of a player with a house of 3x3 spaces. The goal of the game is to get one's own pawns into the house of the opposing player. The pawns marked with a letter (T, o, i) have to get on the spaces with the same letters.

Movement is 1 space diagonal forward or backward. Inside the houses movement is allowed in any direction. Movement over the moat is only possible by jumping over an own pawn (without letter) which has been positioned inside the moat as a bridge. These "bridge-pawns" may only leave the moat, when all other friendly pawns have crossed over.

name: Dragoonium
description:
A fantasy themed set matching card game similar to rummy.

Players try to collect the most gold by playing sets of matching cards during their turns. Each player plays as one of 9 Champions(colors), each one has different abilities that effect game play, and what cards are used to create the deck. Each hand follows a simple draw-play-discard pattern until someone runs out of cards, at which point gold (score) is counted.

—description from the publisher

name: Stellar Express
description:
The objective of Stellar Express is to gain the most victory points by completing missions. The game ends once a set amount of victory points is achieved during game play. Collect missions at star bases and transport resources from those star bases to planets. Reach the planets before you run out of fuel. Expand your fuel and other ship’s needs by hiring crew and purchasing ship modifications. Every round of turns triggers the orbit of the planets. Calculate the distance in your head, creating strategies to get to your destination in time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Corruption
description:
Each player will play as a corporation fostering particular political priorities such as Healthcare, Finance, Military, Foreign Affairs and Education. Each Bill will either benifit you or hinder your opponent. Use your vast wealth and influence to bend politicians to your will. Buy, bribe, cheat, steal and undermine your opponents as you try to gain the most profits. Using influence and lobbying powers,  players will compete to influence the passing of bill. The winner is the corporation to have the most money at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: G.O.L.E.M.
description:
End of the 19th century, ownership of every inch of land or mountain on Earth has been defined with astonishing accuracy by the four superpowers of the world: the English empire, the French Third Republic, the Prussian/German empire and the powerful United States.
Nationalism is the dominant ideology and every country is constantly looking for that economical or scientific competitive advantage that would shift the balance of power in their favour.
In this climate, Mars becomes the new frontier. The journey to Mars is however long and demanding. Also, the planet is not suitable for human life. Therefore the brightest minds of Earth concluded that if humans cannot be transferred to Mars, some new special robotic machine will prepare the ground for them.

And so GOLEMs (Gear Operated Looting and Exploring Machines) appear.
Their mission: to explore the Red planet, extract its resources and build structures suitable for human colonisation. Once deployed, GOLEMs will follow their programed mission: extract resources, improve their design, build colonies and destroy enemies indefinitely until one day their creators will land on the red planet and turn them off.
Until then, GOLEMs are the only Lords of planet Mars…

G.O.L.E.M. is a steampunk themed, card driven, battle and colonisation game featuring a modular map, high quality miniatures and superior artwork.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Castle Crush! The Card Game
description: In Castle Crush! The Card Game, which is based on Castle Crush!, players build their own castles and take pleasure in demolishing the castles of others.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Maccabees
description:
Save the sacred jug of pure oil and win!

In the month of Kislev, after the Greecs captured the Temple, all the oils for the lighting the Tempel Menorah were defiled and only one small jug of oil remained.
Three Greecs with drawn swords are attempting to reach it and defile it too!
Who will save the last jug of oil!

A card game requring concentration and speed - and a bit of luck!

name: The Epic Battle of Alesia
description: Alesia allows gamers to refight the classic battle at Alesia in 52 BC. Julius Caesar vs Vercengetorix of the Gauls. Using a large 40" x 30" game board and 300+ counters this game is a playable monster with less than 10 pages of rules and playable in an evening of gaming.

name: Malifaux: An Oni's Wrath – Asami Box Set
description:
Asami has experienced more pain in her relatively few years than most people are capable of enduring in a lifetime. As a child, she saw faint lights which she knew came from Beyond. To guard her from judgment, her father kept her isolated. Asami grew lonely and yearned for the day she would have a family of her own.

Following an attack on her family shrine, she lost not only her father but also her fertility, and with it, the hope of creating her own family. Mortally wounded, Asami let the Amanjaku inside her soul, bestowing her with the bestial power of the oni – power which escalated as she let the demon even deeper within her, lured on by its promise to grant her a child. The exchange was a dark pact; the ravenous maw splitting the back of her head is both a constant reminder of her own insatiable hunger for the life she lost and the cruel mark of her oni manipulator.

The Ten Thunders have recruited Asami into their number, hoping to use her demonic strength for themselves, but whether they will be able to control her is another matter entirely.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing six 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards and Upgrade Cards. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Asami Tanaka
Amanjaku
Ohaguro Bettari
3 Yokai

Stat Cards

Asami Tanaka
Amanjaku
Ohaguro Bettari
3 Yokai
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Fermented River Monks
description:
The Fermented River Monks are jolly fellows high on life (and copious amounts of alcohol) that also happen to be members of the Tri-Chi clan, where the Brewmaster happens to be a VIG (Very Important Gremlin) in.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Fuhatsu
description:
Fuhatsu was a great warrior before the accident... Now he is a rage filled madman with a huge Gatling Gun that can't even keep his pants up. Basically, Fuhatsu is a very hard to take down firebase and has potential for insane firepower, though he has no melee presence whatsoever.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Jorogumo
description:
Jorogumo is a mysterious giant Spider like man creature and a minion for the Ten Thunders faction. Fast on his multiple arachnid legs, he also can put out an awesome amount of damage and he has a top-notch resilience stat as well. This all sounds too good to be true, well not if you look at the hefty fee it will cost you to hire him.

Ten Thunder Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards. Will require some preparation and assembly.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Tinz Herbalist
description: Whether you're at a party, at the park or the beach, in a bar or a cafe or even just at home,Tinz is the perfect companion for 2 or more players. Games typically last 10-15 minutes so in bigger groups it's winner stays on. The system in Tinz is one of the most simple to learn and teach. Pick up a card and then play a card, if you have two matching cards then play the two. Once you play a card it is known as a sold card. You collect the sell value and the first player to reach 4,000G's is the winner, simple right? However everything changes because every single turn you also turn over an Action card. This is where the fun really starts! Will it be the cops busting you? A hydroponics upgrade for increased weed sell value, that sees players bidding against each other. Or the arrival of a rival gang that forces players to cooperate. Tinz Herbalist is pure fun in a tin!

name: Malifaux: Komainu
description:
Taking a more active role than their historical counterparts, these stone guardian statues, often taking the form of a dog, can be found defending Ten Thunders interests throughout Malifaux. Although they firmly believe that the best form of defense is a good offense, tearing apart the soul of anyone they deem a threat to their charges!

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Komainu

Stat Cards

2 Komainu
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Monks of Low River
description:
Where the Ten Thunders originated from is a mystery to the residents of Malifaux. The crime family's origins within the Three Kingdoms back Earthside are shrouded in mystery, couched in legend, and sprinkled with lies. The Ten Thunders' membership is almost exclusively comprised of residents of the Three Kingdoms, any of whom would give their lives for the family rather than reveal its secrets - the Guild knows this from practice. Even the Ten Thunders' locally hired agents - of which there are few - do not know how their employers have been able to reach across the Breach, establishing an extensive crime network in the City.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Monks of Low River

Stat Cards

3 Monks of Low River
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Monks of High River
description:
Acolytes of the oldest temple in the Five Rivers Valley, the monks of High River are also the most feared. Trained in a wide range of both agonizing and lethal combat skills, the monks are adept at violence and its application. Legends abound of individual monks facing down a dozen men, or turning the tide of a battle single handedly. They are seen by some as demons of pure rage; a reputation the monks use to their advantage, covering their faces with steel masks to conceal their humanity.

The monks of High River cannot be swayed to a cause with promises of power, wealth, or honor. They do not concern themselves with material rewards, only with the perfection of their art. That their chosen art is pain and death means they can be swayed with the promise of deadly opponents against which to hone their skills. Those who request the monks' assistance do so knowing they are unleashing living weapons onto their enemies, and must hope those enemies prove worthy of the monks' attentions.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Monks of High River

Stat Cards

3 Monks of High River
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Luftkampf
description: There is only a game board and a piece of the box top. This is a roll or spin and move along a track, meeting obstacles along the way.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Barbaou
description:
Theme
The players have 5 minutes in order to win (there is a timer). Players are divers who try to defeat a giant monster: Barbaou.

Goal.
During the game, you will have to collect a maximum of cards. Be carefull, Barbaou will keep an eye on you. At the end of the game, all the cards collected by the players will give them points (set collection) and all the cards remaining on the board will give points to Barbaou. If you want to win, you must have more points than Barbaou.

Game-play
All the players are divers from the same team (cooperative game). During his turn, a player has to move (2 action points) and collect a card (animal or garbage). The board (35 cards : animals, waste, gyres, etc.) is quickly disappearing. All your actions will have consequences: if you collect an animal, Barbaou will get away from you. If you take some waste, Barbaou will get closer to you.

End of the game
The game will stop if the timer is finished, if one of the divers can't move or if Barbaou captures one of the divers. If you have more points than Barbaou, you win the game !
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Buto Ijo dan Timun Mas
description: We have only the Buto Ijo dan Timun Mas title at this time.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Spello
description:
"An exciting word game to improve spelling skills"

This is an educational board game for elementary school children. It is designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 players.

Three sets of cards (Letter, Spellbound, and Bonus) are placed face down and the players roll dice to move around the board. The contestant must then draw a card matching his or her current space on the board. Letter cards are relatively simple words while Bonus cards are more difficult to spell. Spellbound cards are simple vocabulary questions that also require proper spelling. A variable number of points are scored depending on the difficulty of the word.

Total points awarded are recorded on an erasable score card. A round ends when the card is filled up. A session may consist of multiple rounds.

Includes board, cards, pawns, dice, marker, and score chart. The rules are printed on the inside of the box lid.

name: Mataram
description: The Mataram board game revolves around the kingdom of Mataram, one of the ancient kingdoms that stood as the very foundation of Indonesia. Mataram is also known as one of the few countries in the old world that unites two major religions at the same time, with Syiwa Buddhism and Hindu living harmoniously and prospering. Temple of Borobudur and Temple of Prambanan were only a few samples of the Mataram golden era.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Uptime
description:
In the dystopian future era of Uptime, a struggle for power means struggle for information. The five factions on this time battle each other to dominate access to the data network. The one who gets "uptime" by connecting their transceiver tower to the satellites will take control over the world.

Can you do that?

name: MatematiKart
description:
Welcome to the MatematiKart Tournament !!
Every year, the fastest animals in the world get together for a karting race. The Cheetah, the Gazelle, the Coyote and the Hare employ all of the irwit, intelligence and agility trying to be come the champion this year so they take home the fabled Best Driver Cup. Who might be this year’s winner?

In this game children compete in a race where they will have to apply their sum skills.
Every turn they will:

Select 2 dice (there are 2D6, 2D10, 2D20)
Throw them and sum/subtract the results
Use special cards if they wish (they allow to turn , +/- movement, attack with coconuts, place bananas on the way)
Move their car, trying not to crash


The game has 3 levels of difficulty:
Level 1: for children that count with one hand.
Level 2: For children that count with both hands
Level 3: For children that count with 2 digit numbers

This didactic material allow students to develop:
– The ability to mentally perform ADDITIONS and SUBTRACTIONS between numbers with one or two ciphers.
– Logical thinking
– The ability to evaluate risks.
– Strategic thinking.

COMPONENTS
1 RaceTrackBoard
27 ItemCards
4 Kart Tokens
8 Banana Tokens
1 ProximityRuler
1 ResultsSheet
1 Rulebook

MatematiKart is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way.
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows forengaging and entertaininglearning.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Racing

name: The Tricky Turtles
description:
Once upon a time, there were two very tricky turtles who organized a great race to find out which of the two was the fastest, but how to make a good competition if both do not stop cheating? The PROBABILITIES may be on your side.

This game can be use in 2 ways:

A) INTERACTIVE STORY
The objective of the interactive story is to introduce the child to the concept of PROBABILITY. Reading the story and completing all of the activities included on it is mandatory before moving onto the TWO TURTLES RACE. This is required in order for the child to get acquainted with probabilities, and therefore is capable of making decisions based on them. We recommend that the parents or teacher of the child guides them during the reading of the story and the activities included in it.

B) TWO TURTLES RACE (this is the game):
This is a game in which only two participants will use practically the concepts learnt in the interactive story. They will develop their abilities of decision making based on probabilities, logical thinking, resource management, and strategic thinking.

There are 3 kind of dice in the game:
a) 3 faces in each of the 2 colors
b) 2 faces of one color and 4 of the other
c) all faces of one color

In a turn the kid is allow to roll an “a” dice, and he must advance the turtle of the corresponding color. But he is also allowed to spend coins to buy a b or c dice, which is used and returned.
They gain more coins by stepping in some spaces of the track.
The firs turtle to cross the finish line is the winner.

COMPONENTS
• 1 storybook.
• 3 trackboardpieces.
• 1 finish line boardpiece.
• 5 dice
• 2 turtle tokens.
• 12 turtlecoins.
• 2 “cheatsheet”.
• manual.
THIS DIDACTIC MATERIAL ALLOWS STUDENTS TO DEVELOP:
• Making decisions based on probabilities
• Logical Thinking
• Resource management
• Strategic Thinking.
Probabilities are a topic that is present in our everyday lives, and which is very importantwhen it comes to making decisions. However, it is very common that children have difficulty grasping the concept when it is introduced in school.
Tricky Turtles explains in simple and accessible terms what probabilities are, and it gives children the opportunity of experimenting with them in a fun and practical way.
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which makes it a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

ABOUT LANGLEY
This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows forengaging and entertaininglearning.

name: Treasure Times!!
description:
The pirate crew has split: everyone wants to be the first to find the Treasures of the evil Captain Barbasucia. Will you be able to become the richest Pirate of the Seven Seas?

This game has 2 steps.
Step one: Kids take turns taking a treasure card from the deck, which features a multiplication on the back, and the result on the pother face. The kid must read the multiplication out loud and say the result. If correct the card is placed on the board where there is a space for each result.

Step 2: Once all cards in play are on the board (it is possible to decide which tables will be on the game) the game begins. Kids will take turns discovering treasures. That means they must point at a treasure card and mention a multiplication that will allow that result. If correct the kid collects the card. The player with most cards wins.

LEARN THE MULTIPLICATION TABLES IN AN EFFECTIVE AND FUN WAY!
Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which makes it a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.
There is no way to solve multiplications more efficiently and easily than through the memorization of tables. Because of this, learning said multiplication tables is a milestone in every student’s learning process. It becomes a basic and necessary tool to solve different kinds of everyday problems, and it is the basis upon which other more complex mathematical skills are built, such as divisions, fractions, and proportions.
The main objective of this material is to help the student memorize the multiplication tables in an efficient and fun way. However, the student should be introduced to the concept of multiplication before beginning the exercises concerning tables. All concepts related to multiplication can be studied at the Langley Math Learning Centers.

COMPONENTS
• 1 Island game board.
• 8 map card with multiplication tables from two to nine.
• 80 treasure tiles (ten per each multiplication table from two to nine).
• 80 Map Fragment cards (ten per each multiplication table from two to nine).
• 1 Hourglass.
• This manual.
This didactic material allows students to develop:
• Mastery of the multiplication tables from two to nine.
• Memorization skills.
• Focus and Concentration.
• The ability to work under pressure.

ABOUT LANGLEY
This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

name: Cuncuna Friends 1
description:
THE CUNCUNA FRIENDS 1 teaches numbers 1 to 50

“CUNCUNA” means caterpillar. It is a word that comes from Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, one of the biggest native South American peoples in Chile. Cuncuna Friends is about a group of very friendly and playful cuncunas. Each one is very different, but they all are eager to meet you and play with you!
Cuncuna Friend Includes more than seven different game modes
The game comes with 50 plastic pieces which allows kids to 1-5 caterpillar. There are 5 color of pieces (1-10/11-20/21-30/31-40/41-50). Children can just play with the pieces trying to place them in numerical order, or they can play one of the games.

A game description:
Each player is deal 5 pieces at the beginning of the game. On their turn they must pick a new piece from a bag, and if it can form a secuence with one of the pieces he has he can put them together and place it in the middle of the table. They can also try to match a piece with one that’s in the table.
The first kid to get rid of all their pieces win.
This games teaches: Numerical Sequence 1 – 50, Successor and predecessor, Patterns, Logical thinking

COMPONENTS
• 25 plastic double links ( divided in five colored groups, with 5 pieces in each group)
• 30 circular nodes (in five different colors, 6 units per color)
• 5 cuncuna brochures
• One small canvas bag
• This rulebook

ABOUT LANGLEY
CUNCUNA FRIENDS can be used to carry out a wide variety of different didactic activities, depending on the needs of each student, the amount of participants, and the specific pedagogic objectives of the teacher. Detailed descriptions of possible activities are included in this document, so as to give the tutors in charge of the game tools to address the needs of their particular group. However, once the participants have become acquainted with the material and the activities available, it is encouraged that they are allowed to choose themselves what tasks to carry out, or even create their own.
Since one of the fundamental pillars of the Langley Math Learning System is self-learning, the teacher or tutor must only act as a facilitator, choosing the most appropriate task considering their skills and needs, explaining it and giving examples if required. The students must be protagonist of their own learning process at all times, and they must have the opportunity to identify their own mistakes and self-correct. To carry out all tasks, this product includes supporting material which must be available should they need them.

This game is part of a group of games created to encourage kids to self-learn mathematics in a didactic way. Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

name: Cuncuna Friends 2
description:
THE CUNCUNA FRIENDS 1 teaches numbers 51 to 100

“CUNCUNA” means caterpillar. It is a word that comes from Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, one of the biggest native South American peoples in Chile. Cuncuna Friends is about a group of very friendly and playful cuncunas. Each one is very different, but they all are eager to meet you and play with you!

Cuncuna Friend Includes more than seven different game modes
The game comes with 50 plastic pieces which allows kids to 1-5 caterpillar. There are 5 color of pieces (51-60 / 61-70 / 71-80 / 81-90 / 91-100). Children can just play with the pieces trying to place them in numerical order, or they can play one of the games.

A game description:
Each player is deal 5 pieces at the beginning of the game. On their turn they must pick a new piece from a bag, and if it can form a secuence with one of the pieces he has he can put them together and place it in the middle of the table. They can also try to match a piece with one that’s in the table.
The first kid to get rid of all their pieces win.
This games teaches: Numerical Sequence 51 - 100, Successor and predecessor, Patterns, Logical thinking

Unlike other products, the Langley Didactic Material has been designed primarily for teaching purposes, which make sit a fun and captivating tool. It is not a game created to teach math, but a didactic tool that allows for engaging and entertaining learning.

name: Plan 9 from Outer Space: The Deckbuilding Game
description:
You and up to 3 of your friends will have to utilize your stupid (STUPID!) minds to battle flying saucers over Hollywood who have resurrected a trio of ghouls in this deck building game based on Edward D. Wood Jr.'s infamous "Plan 9 from Outer Space"!

"Plan 9 from Outer Space: The Deckbuilding Game" is a co-operative deck builder for 1 to 4 players that lovingly adapts "the worst movie of all time" into the card game it was never meant to be!

Players must acquire cards featuring the film's heroes -- to battle the invading aliens who are bent on the destruction of humanity! Fight their trio of bizarre ghoul soldiers -- Inspector Clay, Vampira, and a guy who looks like Dracula -- but also kind of like a dentist in multiple locations from the film.

Players must defeat the alien onslaught before time runs out and they destroy humanity!
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Figura
description:
A tile-placing game with hidden goals and a shared tile pool.

34 goal cards
24 hexagonal tiles (12 black & 12 white)

Both players add tiles to a shared playing surface trying of create their goal shape using both white and black tiles. The goal cards can be rotated to match the direction that the tiles are placed.

When the shared tile pool runs out tiles from the exterior edge can be moved to new positions.

The winner is the first person to create the image on their goal card.

name: Death By Cantaloupe
description:
Death by Cantaloupe
Ideal for 2-4 players.

Goal: Be the first player to reach exactly 100 points using any combination fruits/points

Card Types: (1) PENALTY cards are the Cantaloupe cards and MUST be cleared by penalized player before putting down points towards goal (2) Crazy Coconut cards can wipe out penalty cards immediately (3) Fruit cards each have point values of 5, 10, and 15 and are used to reach the 100-point goal or clear a penalty card
To Start: Shuffle all cards. Deal each player 6 cards and put the remaining cards face down in a draw pile. EACH PLAYER WILL ALWAYS KEEP 6 CARDS IN THEIR HAND.

Game Play: Player 1 draws a card and makes a decision to either (1) put down a point card face up to add towards the 100-point goal OR (2) put down a PENALTY Death by Cantaloupe card on another player OR (3) discard and play nothing. Player 1 will still have 6 cards in hand when turn is over and it is the next player’s turn to draw a card and play. At the end of each turn, the player will always have 6 cards in their hand. The first player to have EXACTLY 100-points face up in front of them wins. If the draw pile runs out, shuffle the discard pile and turn over to start a new draw pile.

Exception to Drawing a Card: If a player has a PENALTY Death by Cantaloupe card played on them, the combination of fruit cards MUST be placed down (one turn at a time) to clear the penalty. The fruit combination can be from the player’s hand of cards or from their existing points pile (therefore reducing their point total). IF A FRUIT CARD IS MOVED FROM THE FACE UP POINT TOTAL IN FRONT OF A PLAYER, THEY DO NOT DRAW A CARD AND THEIR TURN IS OVER. The player still has 6 cards in their hand.
Death by Cantaloupe PENALTY: There are 6 penalty cards that have 2-fruit combinations and 6 penalty cards that have 3-fruit combinations. Penalty cards must be face up with each card that clears it next to it. When the penalty is cleared all cards go into the discard pile. Only 1 card per turn can be played and NO point cards toward the 100-point goal can be played by the penalized player until the penalty is cleared.
Crazy Coconut: The Crazy Coconut instantly wipes out a penalty cantaloupe card. The Death by Cantaloupe card and the Crazy Coconut cards (and any point cards already put down towards the penalty) go into the discard pile. The player will still have 6 cards in their hand when turn is over.

name: AssassinCon: Dan King Promo Pack
description:
Contents:
12 movement cards
1 target card
1 assassin pawn with stand

Remove all orange cards from the base game and replace with these Dan King promo cards. Play as normal.
—description from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Defend Neo Tokyo
description:
You’re at the controls of a six-story combat Mech! But will it be enough to save Neo Tokyo from the giant Monsters?

In this cooperative board game for up to five players, you build a Mech out of unique parts to create a deadly combat machine! Then take the controls and head into Neo Tokyo to battle Giant Monsters – but watch out for the citizens caught in the crossfire.

Featuring five-player cooperative battles, you and your friends will work to create the most effective Mechs you can from the parts you have on hand, then defend Neo Tokyo from the gigantic horrors that attack it. If you can work together with your teammates, choose the best strategy, and effectively manage your Mech’s power supply and repairs, Neo Tokyo may just survive. If you can’t, then it’s Game Over, man.

---------Game Overview-----------
Players build their Mechs using the three types of parts (Chassis, Arms, Legs). Each part has a Tile and a set of cards associated with it. The tiles are combined to form the Mech while the cards are assembled to form the player's Command Deck.
Several Monsters are then placed onto the board which represents the city of Neo Tokyo. Citizen cards are also added to the city, and represent the people in Neo Tokyo that the players must defend.
The Monsters then attack, using an Event Deck which indicates which of the two attacked printed on the Monster Stat cards the Monster will resolve. If the Monster in alone in its City Space, it generally attacks the Citizens and the City itself. If there is a Mech in the space with it, a Monster will attack the Mech instead. This is important because when the Monsters destroy a City space or enough Citizens, the destruction track is raised. If the Destruction Track reaches the final space, the players lose the game!
After the Monsters attack, the players will then use their Command Cards or Tile Actions to engage the Monsters, usually generating a random amount of damage that is applied to the Monster. Each attack raises a Monster Attack Track, which triggers another Monster Attack Phase when filled.
Once the Monsters are all defeated, the Boss Monster appears. This is a bigger and tougher Monster that the players must defeat in order to win.
If they can do this before the Destruction Track is filled, they successfully Defend Neo Tokyo
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Check Maze
description:
User summary
Check Maze is a three-dimensional maze game that is similar to a “3D Quoridor”.

The games involves a high degree of strategy and puzzle solving due to four soma cube puzzles that are to be used as walls or pathways.

When it is a player’s turn, they place blocks and makes moves with the ultimate goal of making it impossible for the opposing player to make any more moves.

As an abstract game, the publisher does not identify an illustrator.

Publisher's summary
「立体的なコリドール」のようなイメージの立体迷路ゲームです。
ソーマキューブパズル４個を壁や道として使うので、戦略性とパズル性の高いゲームになっています。
自分のターンになったら、「ブロックを置く」と「駒を動かす」の両方を行い、相手を動けなくしたら勝ちです。

name: Lighthouse
description:
An abstract strategy game for two players, that comes as a downloadable papercraft model set to print and build.

The game consists of 2 sets of stackable pieces, designated with blue or red markings, and a 7x7 gridded board. The game begins with only 3 pieces of each colour on the board. Players then take turns to either move, or add a piece. There are three different game pieces players can use, each with unique rules and behaviours. Pieces move along the grid 1 square at a time, and can land on top of one another, forming stacks up to 3 pieces in height. Generally, only units on top of stacks can move, meaning players can block their opponent by landing on top of their pieces.

Each player aims to win by moving one of their pieces into the other player's target square on the board, marked with a coloured target symbol.

—description from the description

name: Robot Arena
description:
In the near future discarded robots are being bought up to take part in brutal arena battles. Which robot will win and be allowed to call itself the champion of the Robot Arena?

Every player controls a robot in an arena battle. You gain points by damaging other robots, or by claiming the center of the arena.

At the start of the game each player receives their own character board and fifteen tokens to distribute among their robot's body parts (head, left and right arms, left and right legs). During a players turn, that player can take up to two actions out. Actions include movement, repairing, and attacks. Attacks include shoving, which moves the target a number of spaces, as well as melee and ranged attacks. Most attacks result in a limb point check, for instance when punching the point value of the strongest arm of the attacking robot is compared to the targeted limb of the defending robot and a higher value on the attacking part leads to the defending robot losing one hit point in the targeted limb.

Doing damage to opponent robots, as well as holding the center area of the board gives points. The first robot to gain 24 points wins.

name: Kerno
description:
In Kerno each player starts with a hand of five cards and eight cards are placed face up on the table. The cards show between two and six dice (for instance a one, a three and a five) as well as a point value (for instance 7). Each player also receives 20 tokens for bidding.

Players take turns rolling six dice. After the dice have been rolled, they are auctioned off. The highest bidder pays tokens to the player who rolled the dice (or the bank if the highest bidder was the rolling player). The highest bidder has a chance to re-roll dice, and then chooses cards from their hand and/or table which match (some of) their dice. These cards are placed face up in front of the player.

Once the player is done, the player refills their hand up to five cards, and the table is refilled up to eight cards. The turn then passes to the next player.

If, at the end of a turn, a player has five cards face up in front of them, the game ends. End score is calculated by combining the point values of the face up cards of each player and the remaining tokens they have. The player with the highest point total is the winner.

name: Ogdenopoly 2
description:
A monopoly clone based on the city of Ogden, Utah.

Box front states:

Made by Entertainment Enterprises
A JA Company
Sponsored by Mountain Bell
Suggested Price $10.00

name: ULTRA
description:
ULTRA is a 2-6 player dice and cards game in which players compete to be the last standing robot in the arena. The game is composed by 3 stages in which you have to build your very own robot, build the arena and filled with traps and last but not least....fight!

On your turn, you have to choose at least one of three available actions: move, attack or push your enemy against walls and traps to deal damages!

The game takes from 30 to 40 minutes per game, with simple and easy to learn rules. ULTRA is a fast-paced game and was designed primarily as a party game that can be enjoyed both from non-boardgames players and hardcore players (we all need a party game in our library!).

ULTRA can be played as a single match or, if you have multiple players, tournaments can be arranged!

Unlike others Robot/Wargaming boardgames ULTRA has unique features that you won't see in other boardgames.

We made up a tailored draft mode that allows you to build your robot relying not only in lucky but also in strategy.

You have to build your own Arena and fill it with different traps, each game won't be the same!

Dead players can still play! As a dead player you can perform one out of three actions to change the course of the game!

As mentioned before, after building you robot through the draft, you have to build the arena by just placing the tiles on table following just one simple rule: each tile has to be connected with at least two squares. Then traps will be randomly picked up and placed by each player wherever they want. Now it's time for players to put the robots into the arena and that's it! You're ready to fight!!

During your turn you have to perform at least 1 action from 3 available:

Attack: Use your main weapon to deal damage to the enemies by rolling dice
Move: Use your movement points to move around the arena
Push: Use your movement points to push enemies against walls or move them into traps. If you kill an enemy you will receive 1 Gear Point but, if you have all your Gear Points, you won't over-exceed them.


You're dead? Don't leave! Because you can still have a role in the game! As a "dead player" you have to perform 1 action between moving a trap to a free square in the arena or swapping a trap in the arena with another one not in the arena. Revenge time!

Easy, simple and funny! That's it!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Swip Swap Heroes
description:
In Swip Swap Heroes: The King of Baffleburgh has gone to the beach for a Holiday, but the tide has taken him by surprise, and he is now stranded on a tiny island, he even lost one of his slippers to the tide! Luckily for him that he brought his distress beacon. Beep.. Beep.. The Beacon’s signal went wide and far, and even a spaceship way out there received the emergency call. Now Heroes from all parts of the world are heading to the signal to be the first to escort the King out of the dreadful waters. Swip Swap Heroes: is a casual Tile based board building game, where the aim of the game is, to be the Hero that leads the lost King, back to safety. It might sound easy enough, but you will have to battle Trambambolins, Selfie Sticks, Monsters, other Heroes and much more in order to accomplish glory and fame in the kingdom of Baffleburgh.
In the Tile-laying game Swip Swap Heroes: There are monsters, utility and mechanical tiles to build with, and four Teams to choose from: the Space Monkeys from outer space, The deep diver Nemo and his Octopus, The Pirate Sisters and the Nerdy Adventureres, they all bring a set of unique Tiles to the game. Each player controls a Team of two Heroes. These Teams compete against each other by setting traps, pushing each other over the edge and manipulate the sea by placing Tiles.
In Swip Swap Heroes: your goal is to be the first Hero that brings the King back to safety, by getting to him, and carrying him back to your Team Island, or by holding the King when the enough Sand Tiles have been placed. The King starts in the center of the board (5x5 Tile Layout), and the four Team Islands are placed in each corner.
Each player has 3 dice in their own color, which are used to determine who goes first, and for resolving battles. In Swip Swap Heroes:, each game starts with building the Sea, 20 of the 70 adventure Tiles are evenly handed out between each player. The first player starts by placing the first Tile face down, then the player to his left places a Tile, and so on. When all twenty Tiles are laid down, the race against the tide begins. You have to remember where you placed the helpful Tiles that you have planned to move on and evade your own traps!
On your turn, you have two Heroes that you can act with, each of them can choose between two actions: move or build. When moving on a Tile, it is revealed and resolved. Entering traps or getting pushed over the edge by another player sends your Hero back to your Team Island, where your Hero will be ready again on your next turn. When encountering another Hero, a battle begins, each Hero rolls their dice against each other, the one with the greatest outcome wins, and the opponent falls into the Sea. When you win a battle against another Hero or monster, you earn Fame, Fame are one time use dice that you can collect and choose to use in need. Mechanical Tiles can help you move quickly into the center and the more the board is getting reveal the more strategic it becomes, should you move or build on top of your opponents path and send him into a trap or maybe you should let him get the King and then push him into the Sea?

The tide rises every time a Sand Tile is placed on top of certain used Tiles such as a Treasure Tile, When the last Sand Tile is placed in the sea the tide has fully risen and the Hero carrying the King at the end of that turn wins the game. Swip Swap Heroes: is a game that you grow into, the more you play, the more familiar you become with the Tiles and their combinations, it is a ever changing Sea, with new strategies and challenges in every game, enjoy and have fun.

Description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Malifaux: Ama No Zako
description:
Ama No Zako, a legend from an ancient Japanese text with a frightful temper and working as an Outcast. She is a demon goddess, who is strong on her own but becomes even more powerful when buffed up enough to land her massive attacks successfully. With the ability to cause misery and destruction around her, you do not want to cross her path due to her having the power to kill you instantly.

Outcasts represent the lowest caste in Malifaux as unfortunate souls who are able to beat out a merger existence as a petty crook or hired gun. A small few demonstrate talents or skills of note that allow them to climb from the gutter and exert their will upon the landscape of Malifaux intrigue.

Outcast/Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Ama No Zako

Stat Cards

Ama No Zako
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Tengu
description:
The legends of the Three Kingdoms say that the Tengu were men, once. Their pride in life cursed them to exist after death as demons, bound to protect the forests and mountains they once claimed to own. Hybrids of man and bird, the Tengu are incredibly swift, aggressive, and very territorial. More than one man has fallen victim to their razor talons for daring to despoil the Tengu's hunting grounds with mining, logging, or simply existing where one should not be. The sight of a Tengu is seen as presaging rebellion and war, the earth itself rising up against the enemy.

Despite their fearsome appearance and reputation, the Tengu are not entirely hostile. There are even rumors that they help train the Torakage, explaining the latter's swiftness and stealth. The villages that lie within a Tengu's domain have long since learned to treat the land with respect, and tradition dictates a gift is left for the Tengu at the changing of each season. In return, these people know they will be watched over as carefully as the land itself.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Tengu

Stat Cards

3 Tengu
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Obsidian Oni
description:
Obsidian Oni are fearsome creatures to behold. Their skin is the shimmering black obsidian of their namesake, and they wield heavy, spiked clubs in combat. It is said that they are children of the volcano; they erupted into the world amidst flames and smoke. And where they walk, the flames of battle follow.

Those who know the old magics of the Three Kingdoms can call the Obsidian Oni into service, binding them through ritual and sacrifice to a singular purpose. Those who are weak willed are sometimes consumed by the very Oni they seek to call. But if the need is great enough, they are worth the risk for their prowess in combat.

Obsidian Oni march across the battlefield, shrugging off arrows and calling down flames from the heavens on those who stand in their way. Men flee before them, and death is left in their wake.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Obsidian Oni

Stat Cards

3 Obsidian Oni
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Wandering River Monks
description:
The temple of the Wandering River is the second oldest temple in the Five Rivers Valley. The monks dedicate themselves to speed and agility. They dart in and out of combat, landing unseen blows on their enemies before disappearing in a gust of wind. Indeed, they have an unnatural control over the winds themselves, knocking down their opponents with mighty bursts or using them to speed an escape.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Wandering River Monks

Stat Cards

3 Wandering River Monks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Terracotta Warriors
description:
"I take it that is your latest assignment in Shaanxi was a success?" Lucius stared at McCabe from behind the gleaming mask.

"I have friends in high placed who connected me with some... rarer findings that should prove useful to you, Secretary Mattheson." At the relic hunter's nod, three warriors of living clay strode into Lucius' office. They had dusty boots of worn earth, sightless eyes, tight buns if muddied hair, and they sneered from haughtily features. The Secretary drank it all in with subtle amusement betrayed only by a dark chuckle.

"And what do these puppets do?" Lucius purred. Without warning, McCabe lashed his whip at one of the clay statues. Impossibly, the Terracotta Warrior caught the weapon mid-strike. Before Lucius' eyes the clay began to morph and bubble like an infectious virus until a perfect leather replica whip sprouted from its hand.

Lucius twirled his spidery fingers in evident delight. "Bring me more."

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality Plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Terracotta Warriors

Stat Cards

3 Terracotta Warriors
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Yokai
description:
What the Yokai lack in intelligence, they make up in sheer brutality. Considered among the lowest of the Oni, these simian creatures love nothing more than a blood-drenched frenzy during which they might boast their considerable fighting skills. Wielding their magical kama, sharp sickles imbued with soul-rending curses from beyond, Yokai leap into battle with unhallowed frenzy, relishing each new opportunity to tear apart the enemy into a gory mist. Their ape-like call is rightly feared by many as a sign of coming doom.

Despite their fighting prowess, such simple creatures are also fickle; they do not have the willpower to remain eternally in the mortal realm. As the fight comes to an end and the Yokai sense that their own strength ebbs, they allow themselves to transcend back to Beyond from whence they came. Still, better that these foul creatures disappear than turn their burning wrath upon erstwhile allies once there is nothing else left to kill.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality Plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Yokai

Stat Cards

3 Yokai
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Yasunori
description:
The oldest legends from the Three Kingdoms say that Yasunori was once a kabuki actor without peer. He could captivate his audiences with a voice that boomed louder than thunder or movements that whirled more gracefully than a swirling stream. His performance was so perfect that it was almost divine... inhuman, even.

One night after a particularly mesmerizing show, the audience begged him to take off his mask so they could see the true face of the man underneath. Yasunori complied, but the crowd could not accept the truth behind the demonic visage of the Oni staring back at them. They turned on the actor they had cheered but a moment earlier, chasing him into the forest with drawn weapons and powerful curses.

Memories of that painful night still haunt Yasunori, and his own shame burns inside him hotter than molten iron. Riding upon his fearsome longma, a winged steed he tricked into serving as his mount, the Oni now wreaks vengeance upon those whom he had once dedicated his whole life to pleasing.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

Yasunori

Stat Cards

Yasunori
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Tanuki
description:
Tanuki are small, racoon-like sprits. They are playful by nature, if a bit mischievous. They tend to know a handful of magical tricks of debatable usefulness, such as the ability to immediately switch location with a nearby teapot (and only a teapot).

Tanuki have an intense (some would say unreasonable) love of alcohol, but they are too impatient to brew it themselves. They usually attempt to steal their booze from unaware, but if pressed, they can easily conjure up a magical (though, tragically, non-alcoholic) elixir that is highly sought after by non-Tanuki.

It was this love of alcohol that led to Tanuki first arriving in Malifaux: a group of them had hidden within a shipment of sake the Ten Thunders were shipping through the Second breach. When the crate was opened, the drunken Tanuki scattered.

After initially considering Tanuki to be nothing more than pests, the Brewmaster reluctantly established a relationship with the little creatures. They make for excellent spies... provided that he only gives them their promised moonshine after the assignment is complete.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high-quality Plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Tanuki

Stat Cards

3 Tanuki
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Shadow Emissary
description:
The Shadow Emissary was once the Shadow Effigy, a puppet created by the Swamp Hag Zoraida to infiltrate the Ten Thunders. The puppet performed his duties perfectly, during his time working infiltrating the Ten Thunders he started to feel his bonds to the Swamp Hag weaken as his loyalty and allegiance to his new brothers grew. After the Cataclysm he emerged as the Shadow emissary, in a form drawn from the hearts and sprits of the Three Kingdoms; a Dragon, stern and regal, speaking with a voice of wind and thunder. Let his mother see him now, and tremble!

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing a 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards and Upgrades.

Set Contains:

Models

1 Shadow Emissary

Stat Cards

1 Shadow Emissary
8 Shadow Emissary upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Sun Quiang
description:
Sun Quiang is a famed healer from the Three Kingdoms. He is an expert in the arts of medicine, and his talents were sought from across the land by the sick and the dying.

The Guild arrested his son on false charges of treason and the sale of illegal weapons. Desperate, Sun Quiang sought the aid of the dreaded Ten Thunders, who agreed to raid the prison where his son was held, so long as Sun Quiang agreed to serve them. They kept their word, and the Thunders whisked Sun Quiang to Malifaux, where he now plies his trade aiding their injured warriors and keeping their Rail Workers on the lines far longer than human stamina should allow.

Secretly, he curses his new masters, but Sun Quiang is a man of his word. He has resigned himself to his fate. The only line that he will not cross is to do harm. He has sworn himself to heal the sick and the dying, and he does so regardless of who they are. The Thunders allow this, so long as he remains useful.

Henchman Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic, Stat Cards and Upgrade Cards.

Set Contains:

Models

1 Sun Quiang

Stat Cards

1 Sun Quiang
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Crime Bosses
description:
The Katanaka family sits at the centre of the Ten Thunders like a bloated spider perched in the middle of a complicated web. Though it employs many agents drawn from many within the organization are held by members of the Katanaka family. Blood, after all, is thicker than water.

Each Katanaka Crime Boss is responsible for dozens of agents, often a mixture of Ten Thunders Brothers, Lotus Eaters, Torakage, Snipers, and more. They keep order through fear and intimidation, but when necessary, they have no qualms with resorting to brute force. To assist them in battle, they rely upon strength-enhancing vapours to push their capabilities beyond the limits of mortal men.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniature made of high-quality Plastic.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Ten Thunder Crime Bosses

Stat Cards

2 Ten Thunder Crime Bosses
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Tennis Odyssey
description:
Tennis Odyssey is a simulation of life as a touring professional tennis player. You will be required to maintain your fitness and form by managing your schedule and training to give yourself the best chance of winning matches and scoring important rankings points. Your world ranking tracks the progress of your career. Tennis Odyssey is designed to be realistic, and as with real life, it will be grind before glory. Persevere though, and you could be the next world number 1 and grand slam champion.

All matches are decided with just 2 rolls of a die, allowing entire seasons to be played in under an hour. All players are rated for each surface. You will face tougher opposition as tournaments progress and as you move up from lower level tournaments through to grand slams. Players accrue form and wear points according to the result of each match, but must be careful to schedule weeks off to rest as wear increases the probability of injury. Injuries reduce your condition which ultimately triggers the end of your career. Top performers will earn induction into the Tennis Odyssey hall of fame.

name: Porsta
description:
If 2 players are playing, each gets 3 colors. If there are 3 players, each get 2 colors. The goal of the game is to get as long as possible chains of token of each color on joined spaces on the game board by placing one token per turn. When all token are placed, points for the longest chains are awarded.

Also included are 6 big token to play "Tiddledy-Winks", using the box as the target.

This game was produced about 1940.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: Fußballspiel
description:
Each player has 11 pawns (10 field players and one goal keeper). Movement is determined by 2 dice. The results can be split up among the pawns. The pawns may move with or without the ball. The ball can only be moved in tandem with a pawn. It can't be shot away or to another pawn. There are special rules for "offside", "corner" and "penalty".

After an agreed on playing time the player who gets the most goals wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Oh Cluck!
description:
Oh Cluck! is a Multiplayer card game where players assemble a Coop of Roosters, and challenge other players in light combat, amassing a basket of eggs. Game play supports 2-6 players.

Oh Cluck! utilizes 2 decks; the Rooster Deck, and the Actions Deck.

The Rooster Deck is dealt out to players to build their coop of roosters, that act as the "Avatar" of the player. Unless card specifies otherwise, each player has a single rooster active at a given time. Each Rooster is worth a set amount of Eggs.

The Action deck consists of Attack, Dodge, Counter, Special, and Party Fowl card types, that allow players to interact with each other in an attempt to be the last Rooster standing.

When a rooster is defeated, their eggs are added to the basket of the player that defeated them, and the rooster is replaced with another rooster from the coop. Play continues until there is only 1 player with rooster(s) left, or at the end of a turn, a player has amassed 1 dozen eggs.

Oh Cluck uses light hearted slapstick humor, and mildly violent combat, reminescent of Looney Tunes, Tom and Jerry, etc...

—description from the publisher

name: Nun dreh schon!
description: Objective: The first player moving his 4 meeples into the target zone wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. The players need a '6' to move the turntable in the direction of their choice. The target zone can be reached by passing the turntable. Meeples may not jump over any other meeples and can't be thrown out.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Apocketalypse
description:
The Apocketalypse has arrived! A zombie outbreak has happened right in your town.
Its time to scavenge for gear and hope you do not run into to many zombies!
Will you be the last and only survivor of the Apocketalypse?

Apocketalypse is a quick and fun dice elimination game, with a few cards thrown in for good measure. Each player selects a random character that has a skill that will hopefully keep them alive, such as extra dice or rerolls.

Each turn players scavenge and are dealt a random card that is either gear or a zombie. You then roll a number of attack and zombie dice, based on the characters skill and what gear or zombie card they scavenged. If you’re lucky and roll well you heal or escape from the zombies, if you’re roll isn’t so lucky zombies will take a bite or two and you’ll loose your health tokens.

The last player with health is declared the Survivor of the Apocketalypse and wins!

The whole game fits nice and neatly into your pocket so you can take it anywhere you go!

name: Master Thief: Innovation Exhibition
description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive, second expansion for Master Thief and was available as an add-on to the base game during the Kickstarter campaign.

The KS Exclusive consists of 24 cards, including an entirely new category of items! This pack is meant to provide game-breaking fun for those who back us on Kickstarter. Once the Kickstarter has ended, and these packs have been released, they WILL NOT be printed again!
—description from the publisher

Card breakdown:
14 Museum cards [8 Items, 2 Charmed (foil), 2 Cursed (foil), 2 Security]
8 Thief cards [3 Action, 4 Reaction, 1 Utility]
2 Calling cards
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

description: 26 is a competitive, fun, team-based card game. Players will divide into two or more teams. After determining which team will go first, one team will draw a letter card and the other will draw a topic card. The team holding the topic card announces the topic and the team with the letter card has 26 seconds to name as many topics as possible that start with the letter on their card. Then, the team holding the topic card draws a letter card and does the same thing. The team with more topics wins that round. The first team to win six topic cards wins the game!

name: The National Cricket Game
description:
A simple roll and move game where a two players play against each other to score the most runs before losing all 10 batsmen in cricket.

To score a player rolls a die to see where the bowler has pitched the ball. A roll of 3 will automatically dismiss the batsman as bowled. Other numbers show the player has hit the ball to various parts of the playing field. A second roll of the die is then required to move the struck ball to its field location. This may result in a score (as runs) or dismissal in various ways (caught, run out, stumped or L.B.W).

The batting team continues to amass a score until all 10 wickets have fallen. This is their final score which then the other player must try to surpass to win the game

The game board appears to be have been slightly modified over time with at least 3 versions showing minor changes is the players outfit, their fielding positions and postures, the title and the grandstand in the background. The national logo was also absent in the later versions, with just Made in Australia printed on the board

Originally copyrighted 1913. The later versions were most likely produced around the 1920s and the 1930s based on the cricketers outfits.

name: DrinkQuizition
description:
Tired of hanging out with people who are distracted by their phones?

Once you’ve reached adulthood, meeting up with friends becomes extra challenging. It’s hard to get everyone’s schedule to synchronize.
