When you finally get the chance to meet, it’s best to savor the moment and just enjoy each other’s company. But even this has been made difficult by people’s addiction to their screens. We all tend to frequently check our phone on impulse.

The Trivia Drinking Card Game by DrinkQuizition create fun moments, gadget-free!

The best new card game from DRNK Games, DrinkQuizition brings memorable times to people by marrying together our love for beer and trivia. Pop a bottle and get ready to prove your superior knowledge in pop culture, history, entertainment and more! Your phone will never cross your mind as you get engrossed in the fun game and friendly banter.

No person is too drunk to understand our easy-to-follow card game. Simply pick a card from the top of the deck then answer the indicated question. You get to keep the card if your answer is correct, and you’ll have to drink for every mistake. The person with the most cards wins the game! Our DrinkQuizition cards are divided into the “Common Knowledge” and “Trivia” deck, each with 30 questions.

Our game comes with fun twists! Every time you get an answer wrong, someone else can steal your card by calling out the correct answer. You may also use the “Bonus Questions” to save yourself. The caveat is that you will have to take two drinks if you get it wrong.

Here are more reasons to love our drinking card game:

✅ A fresh new take on game nights
✅ Appeals to the thinking person
✅ Learning experience through the “Fun Facts” feature
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: La chasse au fantôme
description:
The tomb of the manor of the Eimpfildster is haunted. The hunters must catch the ghost before the end of the 12 chimes of midnight. The ghost mustn't get caught.

Content:
a board
rules
a 12-sided die
1 blue hunter and his 4 blue detectors
1 red hunter and his 4 red detectors
For the ghost: a marking sheet, a pen and the hiding screen with the coordinates

Setting:
If there are two players, one of them plays the two hunters.
The ghost is not represented by a token. Thanks to the coordinates on the hiding screen, the player will discreetly indicate the moves of the ghost on the marking sheet.

The game:
Each turn corresponds to a bell chime. The ghost plays first. Then, the two hunters play together without any given order. The turn is over.
At the end of the 12th chime, if the ghost didn't get caught, he wins.
The ghost gets caught when a hunter and the ghost are on the same square.

The role of the ghost:
Each turn, he has to move to a square adjoining the one he is on. If he moves to a square where a detector is, it immediately disappears.
The ghost moves to a square with a red detector. It disappears and cannot be used anymore. The hunters know where the ghost is.
The ghost can delay the effect of a blue detector and a red detector for one turn, once in the game.
He can do it when he moves to a square with a detector or when a hunter puts a detector on the square of the ghost.

The role of the hunters:
Each turn, they can:
- either move to an adjoining square
- or put a detector of their own colour on an adjoining square
- or, but only once in the game, take back one of their detectors from an adjoining square.
Caution! If a hunter moves to a square with a detector, it disappears and can no longer be used.


Le tombeau du manoir des Eimpfildster est hanté. Les chasseurs de fantômes doivent capturer le fantôme avant les 12 coups de minuit. Le fantôme ne doit pas se faire attraper.

name: Litscapes
description:
(Re-)Discover the exploratory joys of some classic literary adventures through this card game. Players build a hand of descriptive elements from a constantly cycling pool to recreate iconic scenes - focused around landscape description featured in the works. These in turn are used to strategically claim chapters from a random set that match the environmental types of the scenes they have developed, before their opponents.

The closer the match of the words played to the actual text, the higher the score - but beware of claiming too many chapters with fuzzy 'not-quite-right' elements, for the scoring system favours those whose scenes require the least edits.

The game features basic and advanced scoring rules, to allow players of all ages to enjoy the (dare we say, educational) game.

The first text featured in this gaming system is: R.L.Stevenson's Treasure Island.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Klaus Störtebeker und die Hansa
description:
This game depicts a battle between the Hanseatic League Fleet and the Pirates of "Victual Brothers" around the island of Heligoland.

The game has 24 units comprising two fleets with the same mix of units in both fleets. The fleets are differentiated by the color of their hulls and different Flagships. The ships are of different sizes represented by the number of their masts.

A ship can take (destroy) an enemy ship of the same or smaller size and can move a number of points on the map based on its size (big ships move less than the smaller ones). If a ship has other ships on points surrounding it, it is considered protected and cannot be taken.

The units are flats and appear to be hand painted. The Flagship of the Hanseatic league is the "Colorful Cow" and the pirate's Flagship is called the "Sea Wolf". Both Flagships move and attack with a range of 1 but can take out all ships including each other. Victory is determined in multiple ways related to which ships have been lost.

A truly amazing game from the late 1930s.

name: Goblins of Rainbow Gulch
description:
The Lord Emperor High Goblin King Bombash the Cruel and Terrible 11,097th king of the Goblins of Rainbow Gulch is dead, who will take his place?

You are currently one of six Den Chiefs who could be named as the next King. Gather resources as you travel from den to den to sway your Goblin kin to your side. Sway goblins of the same profession to solidify your position. Or diversify among the different dens and professions in an attempt to get the majority of Goblins to cast their vote for you come the next full moon, a fortnight from now. Don’t forget Goblins who have been swayed to your side can aide you on your election campaign, when they are awake at least that is.

In this true Euro-style board game, take actions and get the votes to become the goblin king. Outsmart your opponents, and win over the goblin people to get the crown and call yourself the goblin king. It will take all your wit and a bit of luck. Control the resources, block your opponents, and craft the ultimate strategy. The game is made complete with the unique board with a light-hearted goblin nature.

Components

1x Game Board
1x Ten-Sided Dice – D10
24x Goblin Leader Meeples – 4 per Color
54x Goblin Villager Meeples – 9 per Color
13x Peackcock Tokens
24x Tasty Resource Tokens
24x Shiny Resource Tokens
24x Pointy Resource Tokens
1x Daytime / Nightime Tracker Token
1x First Player Rock
5x Banner Mini Cards

From the publisher's website
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Polaris: The Race though Space
description:
A simple roll and move game where the object is to race through space to be the first to reach Polaris, the Pole star.

Two versions exist of the game. The earlier version (1925) has the players starting from the sun and travelling a path of small stars through the solar system from closest to most furthermost planet (Neptune at that time) before continuing through the major zodiac constellations.

The later version (1953) takes a slightly different course starting at Earth, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter and Venus then continuing the same path as the 1925 version stopping also at Pluto. In both cases landing on a red star along the path may lead to a penalty or bonus.

The graphics between both version also has considerable differences, with the later version showing rockets along the course and the early version having hangers for the biplane playing pieces. The boards were informative for the players by having facts on all the celestial bodies known at that time

name: Sabrina the Teenage Witch Board Game
description:
Help Sabrina in her quest to become a fully fledged witch. Collect your friends and Aunts before entering the other realm and coming face to face with your evil twin Katrina. But beware, Salem is up to his tricks and may cause problems along the way.

Each player takes the part of Sabrina, who must travel through three zones before entering the Other realm. The board is divided into four realms. 46 picture tokens are placed randomly on the spaces in the realms at the start of the game. On their turn, a player must roll the six sided die and then decide which direction to move through the realms. The aim is to collect tokens, the winning of which is determined by the roll of a 20 sided die each time a counter is landed on. There is also a deck of Salem cards that are drawn when a player lands on a cat token. These cards have actions that can be good or bad.

Winner is the first player to collect 8 tokens, 2 from each realm, finishing on the Other realm in the centre of the board.

name: 20,000 Leagues under the Sea
description:
Each player captains a ship trying to trade and sail back to port with valuable cargoes of gold, diamonds, rubies, silk, bananas and potatoes. Facing treacherous seas and avoiding Captain Nemo in the Nautilus, as well as a giant octopus, who could drag you down to the watery depths where you will have to stay until you can escape.

This is an interactive cassette adventure game played on a grid map. The cassette must be played from start to finish through the game without pausing or stopping. When somebody is talking on the cassette, play stops while the players listen to the instructions. Otherwise the players roll the die and move in turn. On the map grid there are octopus squares that the players must avoid while trying to reach the Aleutian Islands where they can collect different types of cargo. The player then has to return the cargo to their home port to earn points depending on the type of cargo. The Nautilus is also moving around the board based on instructions spoken by Captain Nemo on the cassette. If this lands on or passes over a players ship, that ship has to return to the home port.

The winner is the player to accumulate the highest cargo value when the cassette ends.

name: Beaufort-Opoly
description:
The quirky game is a local take on the popular Hasbro Monopoly game and uses downtown Beaufort landmarks, such as the bridges and historic homes, as well as local businesses as playing cards and spaces.

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there.

The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Stock Holding

name: Wiener Takes All
description:
Welcome to the sausage festival! In Wiener Takes All, you are competing with each other to flirt with a handsome buffet line of vendors to get them to serve their wieners. Whoever scores the most inches of victory wins the game!

First, you'll build a character by choosing 4 Traits. Then you'll take turns flirting with the guys. Your turn is divided into 3 parts: Peek, Pick, and Play. Peek at a face down card - you can peek at a Guy to see is he's easy to flirt with, or you can peek at a Wiener to see if it's worth it. Next, pick the Guy you're going to flirt with. It can be a different Guy than the one you peeked at. Finally, play by rolling the dice. If your roll is high enough, congratulations! You get the Wiener! Guys who like your character's Traits have easier rolls for you, so peek and pick carefully!

The game is over when there are no Wieners left to grab. Only your highest Wiener gets scored. All other Wieners are worth +1 inch regardless of their size. Whoever has the most total inches of victory wins!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Follow-On
description:
Easy, fast, exciting 2-6 players Age 6 to adult.

Win by discarding your cards first.
Place them in the centre of the table when you can.
Better still place them on your opponents stacks and watch their faces.

The game consists of 6 sets of cards numbered 1-20.
Place all the cards on the table face down and shuffle the cards. Each player takes an equal two stacks and places them face down in front of them.
Each player takes one card from a stack and places it face up in the centre of the table. If it is a 1 he places it down. He then takes the next card. If it is a 2 he places it over the 1. He keeps drawing cards until he can no longer follow a number. The first card he cannot place he puts down on his own face up deck. This ends his turn.
The next player now takes a turn but as well as the cards in the centre he can also add to an opponents stack. As long as you can add to a stack you continue your go.
The winner is the first player to run out of cards.

name: Smashhh un juego de tenis
description:
This is a boardgame of tennis for 2 or 4 players.

All the strokes and movements of a real game are represented in the game. Mechanics is with cards and a dice. It is played with the rules of real tennis.
There are serve, defense and attack cards.

Juego de tenis para 2 o 4 personas.

En el juego estan representados todos los golpes y movimientos de un juego real. La mecanica es con cartas y un dado. Se juega con las reglas del tenis real.
Hay cartas de saque, defensa y ataque.

name: Giftmas at Dungeon Abbey
description:
It is Giftmas at Dungeon Abbey. A time for giving. A time for receiving. A time for getting what you want, even if it bally well means murder.

As they have done every year since time immemorial, the D'ungeon family are engaging in the wonderful Giftmas tradition of gift-giving. Will it be a cake, or a puppy, or a steel mantrap? Parcels are grasped, to and fro, as the vile family members vie for whatever feels like the best present. Will you get what you want? And why does this really heavy, round one smell of burning?

In each round of the game you'll take the role of the various eccentric and unpleasant family members. You'll score points if you end up with the gifts you wanted. But look out! Some of these presents are gigantic bombs! Hell's bells!

Play revolves around swapping cards representing gifts and character identities with other players, and choosing the right moment to turn your cards face-up. If a player starts their turn with all of their cards face-up, then the round is over and we see who has gained the best gifts to determine a winner for that round. The first player to win three rounds is the winner of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Kaolan: The Battle Strategy Card Game
description:
Take control of powerful beasts and give them power, then use them to attack your enemies.

Kaolan is an exciting trading card battle game. It can be played in four ways: Match Play (single pack), Tournament Play (multiple packs), Power Play (head-to-head), or Single Play (solitaire). All versions use a Master Deck of 60 original cards.

There are four kinds of cards: Character Cards, Power Cards, Special Ability Cards, and Opportunity Cards. Booster Cards are also available. The object of the game is to defeat all your opponent's Character Cards by gaining powers and special abilities. Two players challenge each other to a duel with dice until no challengers are left standing.

The object of the game is to clear your opponent’s battlefield of all Character Cards. A battlefield consists of one Leader and up to three Guards. When a player’s Character Cards on the battlefield have been eliminated, that player is out of the game. The last remaining player is the winner.

Play begins by shuffling the cards of the Master Deck. Deal four cards. Arrange these cards on the table so that there is one in front of three cards. Next, deal four cards to each player. The remaining cards become the Draw Pile. If the Draw Pile is empty, shuffle the Discard pile and create a new Draw pile. Turns the four cards on the table face up.

On each turn, do one of the following options: place a Character Card on the board, draw a card from the Draw Pile, add a Power Card to any Character Card, add a Special Ability to any Character Card, play an Opportunity Card, initiate a Challenge, or pass.

With the use of dice, players challenge each other to battles. A player is eliminated if all their Character Cards have been defeated. The last remaining player is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: UFO Tumble
description:
In a crazy experiment that went haywire, scientists accidently opened the portal to four parallel universe! Meanwhile, four different UFOs from the four different multiverse was split due to fraction of space! Scientists now fight anxiously to piece the UFOs back together in order to avoid cosmic chaos.

UFOS宇宙迷航 (USO Tumble) is an abstract, tile-placing board game. Unlike typical games, it features an unique mechanism: a board that can be turned and rotated, where tiles will fall or not fall depending on their corresponding colors, and re-arranging the module as it goes.

The board is a 5x5 grid, with four different colors on each side representing the four universes. Tiles with colors matching the bottom side will gain anti-gravity, which means they will not fall downwards and can be placed anywhere. The tiles are magnetic, allowing players to shift the tiles freely on the board throughout the game.

Come challenge your ability of spatial cognition and prediction, outsmart your opponents and win by piecing together as much UFOs as you can!

name: AceHole
description:
AceHole is a remix of the most popular card game for drinking on college campuses: Asshole.
Despite its popularity, the game asshole was never formalized with written instructions or rules.
AceHole fixes all that!
What makes our game so much different and (and better) than all of the games that are being played every day across the country in countless colleges and universities (since the beginning of time)?

We have compiled all of your favorite rules and many new ones from all across the United States. We came up with over 100 drinking rules.
No more memorization! All the rules will be laid in front of you on our cards!
We have included a beautifully designed 54 card custom playing card deck.
All cards are from the 54-card deck and rule cards are printed on 100% ALCOHOL PROOF PVC! NO MORE PARTY FOULS!


—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Scrabble: Big Eszett (ß)
description: The capital German letter eszett (ß) as promo tile since it was added to the German language 2017. (The lower case already existed.)

name: Fievel au Far-West
description: Based on the animated movie An American Tail: Fievel Goes West, this game is a twist on the classic Game of Goose[/thing] with physical challenges between players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Snails on the Wall
description: The Snails on the Wall game is a simple roll and move game where players move their piece along the playing board wall according to the roll of a die. The first to reach the top is declared the winner

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar: Twirl and Toss
description: A child's game from Briarpatch. Players take turns tossing pieces of plushy fruit onto the leaves and caterpillar (small hook and loop circles) as it twirls on a motorized base. The first to stick all of their fruit wins the game.

name: Eine Herde wilder Pferde
description:
The herd of horses is spread out across the whole paddock. But when they are collected for riding, all the horses come to the gate at top speed.

An exciting game to support quickness and hand-eye coordination.

Every player gets a set of identical cards, which look like Domino stones and show one or two horses in different colors.

The paddock cards form a draw pile. Once a paddock card is flipped, all players try to arrange their cards in the form of the shown paddock card as quickly as possible.

The quickest player wins the paddock card. When the draw pile with the paddock cards runs out, the player with the most paddock cards is the winner of the game.
—user summary (English)

Die Pferdeherde hat sich über die ganze Koppel verteilt. Doch wenn sie zum Reiten abgeholt werden, kommen alle Pferde ganz schnell ans Gatter.

Ein spannendes Ablegespiel, bei dem neben Schnelligkeit auch die Augen-Hand-Koordination gefördert wird.

Jeder Spieler erhält einen identischen Satz an Pferdekarten, die wie Dominosteine aufgebaut sind und 1 oder 2 Pferde in unterschiedlichen Farben aufweisen.

Vom Stapel mit den Koppelkarten wird eine Karte aufgedeckt und alle Spieler versuchen gleichzeitig, die Koppel so schnell wie möglich nachzubauen.

Der jeweils schnellste Spieler bekommt die Koppelkarte als Belohnung. Wer am Ende die meisten Koppelkarten gewonnen hat, gewinnt auch das Spiel.
—user summary (German)

name: ATK! The Board Game
description:
ATK! The Board Game is a 2 player 3v3 MOBA Style Board Game. Assemble your team of 3 Elemental Heroes. Each Hero has a spinnable base that is used for the attack mechanism. Your team is also equipped with 2 towers and a base. These structures have a health system that is easy to keep track of with a counting system built in.

Your goal is to destroy your opponent's base while protecting your own. Any time you defeat enemy Heroes you earn specialty cards that can assist you to victory. These cards include damage boosters for single attacks, respawn delays to assign to your opponent's hero, and much more.

Battling structures is simple, choose your Hero, flip upside down and spin the spinner. Reference your Hero Cards to add a value or action to your spin's outcome. If it's an attack, subtract that amount to the structure's health. Deplete all health on a tower and it is removed from play giving you a clear path to the base. When attacking an enemy Hero, flip both Heroes over and spin. Higher number wins without elemental influence.

Strategically maneuver your way into your opponent's base area and destroy their base. Upon doing so, claim the title of the ATK! Champion. Reset and Play Again!

—description from the designer

name: Subrogator Cave
description:
"Voter Beware" (Subrogātor Cave, in Latin) is a political dice rolling game about Food Truck politics. Bernie Salad, Hilaire, Gervais Juanson, and Donny Sausage all wish to become President of the Food Truck Association, the political position which controls all of the menus on local food trucks. In this game, one to four players will take turns rolling four dice and assigning them to each candidate, who in turn will utilize the die assigned them based on its value.

Possible actions include buying influence, buying votes, enhancing your influence with a funding PAC, or delivering a nasty Dirty Trick to an opponent's campaign, lowering their stature with PACs and potentially hurting their ability to compete. At the end of each turn, a Scandal may erupt which damages a candidate's reputation with the voting blocs that they buy votes from.

This is a unique, one to four-player political game that takes between 20-40 minutes to play, and with simple-to-understand rules but truly difficult decisions each turn, it's perfect for a coffee shop or lunch hour either by yourself or with friends.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil

name: ワードチェス (Word Chess)
description:
User summary
Word Chess (ワードチェス) (Wa-do Chesu) is a brain game that can be described as the combination between a word puzzle and Chess.

To move, you say a word that begins with the same letter as the letter written on the piece. You can then move your piece the same amount of spaces as there are letters in the word you chose.

If you are able to land your piece precisely onto the space of your opponent’s piece, you can then remove your opponent’s piece from the board. The first person to remove their opponent’s king from the board wins the game.

Because this game requires you to think of various words, it requires both intellectual strength as well as the recognition of counter measures.

Publisher's summary
ワードパズルとチェスが混ざったようなイメージの頭脳ゲームです。
文字の駒は、その文字から始まる言葉を言うことによって、その文字数だけマスを進めます。相手の文字をピタリと使って言葉を言えたら、
その相手駒を盤上から取り除け、相手の王を取ったら勝ちです。
言葉を色々と考えるので、知育効果だけではなく認知症対策の効果もあると思われます。
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: つみきメイズ (Tumiki Maze)
description:
User summary
Tumiki Maze (つみきメイズ) (Tsumiki Meizu) is a two-player 3D stacking maze game. Although the rules are simple enough, there’s plenty to think about in this brainy balance game: where to place your next wooden block and where to move your pieces.

On your turn, choose two wood blocks and place them on the board. Then chose one of your pieces and try to move it to the highest place possible. If you cause the stack to fall over, you lose.

Publisher's summary
つみき感覚で楽しむ立体迷路ゲームです。
シンプルなルールながら、木材の置き方や駒の移動先など、色々と考える頭脳的バランスゲームです。
自分の番になったら、木材を2個選んでボード上に置き、自分の駒を1個選んで少しでも高い位置に移動させ、崩したら負けです。

name: Cube Words
description:
Cube Words is a print&play word game for 2 players. Earn points by forming words using adjacent letters. First player to earn exactly 30 points is the winner.

In his turn, each player can form a 3+ letters word using orthogonally adjacent letters and earn points according to the number of letters. Longer words are considerably more valuable than short words.

After forming a word, each player can use a cube to block a chosen letter. This letter can not be used by the other player.

Each player can only pass through the 20 points mark if he has formad at least one 6+ letters word.

To make things a little more difficult, the winner is the player who reachs exactly 30 points. If you earn more than 30 points, you begin to reduce your scoring!

The game was designed for the 2017 9-Card Nanogame P&P Design Contest.

THE COMPONENTS

All you need to play Cube Words is:

- The cards fronts and backs (one A4 sheet for each)
- 8 cubes, in 2 different colors (4 for each player)

name: HEXO: Card Game
description:
HEXO: Card Game will improve your visual acuity and spatial perception in a dynamic, fun and easy to learn card game based on technical drawing. The game has the features to be the ideal quick game to compete with friends, family, colleagues, couple... In which you'll cannot play just one game, you'll ask for a rematch!

On HEXO: Card Game you'll be challenged to find which of the 18 shapes of your 6 unique cards matches* with the active figure card. Who will be the fastest? Matches happens when one of the shapes of the card played coincides with one of the sides of the active figure. When no shapes matches, the move is wrong and a penalty will be applied.

If it's a match, you score one point! Place the card played by the dark side back on your zone and a new round begins.
In the following rounds you won't be able to score extra points with dark cards, but you can still play them to prevent other players from gaining points!

The first player who turns over 4 of his shape cards will be the winner of HEXO: Card Game!

Are you ready for a rematch?

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Red Aurora
description:
Red Aurora is a single-player game offering the player to relive the dramatic historical events of October 1917 in Petrograd as a member of the Military Revolutionary Committee attempting to overthrow the Russian Provisional Government. The game is played on two maps of Petrograd showing historically precise locations of stationed regiments, officer schools, bridges, important buildings and the Winter Palace itself. The player will take control of soldiers, Baltic Fleet sailors and Red Guards attempting to overcome the government forces consisting of Junkers, cossacks and Shock infantry.

Over the course of the game, the player prepares the coup organizing Red Guards, agitates garrisoned regiments, gathers revolutionary forces to prevent the government from bringing more troops into Petrograd and arresting the player. The revolutionary patrols seize crucial points in Petrograd, like train stations, communication centres and power plants, facing opposition from the government that tries to uphold the control of the city. The conflict escalates with the revolutionary forces encircling the Winter Palace and finally assaulting and seizing it during the dark October night.
The game includes 58 historical events, played in variable chronology, and with 60 minutes of playtime offers excellent replayability. Will the Provisional Government be able to retain the control of Petrograd or will the shot from Aurora usher in a new era in the history of Russia?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Eagle Attack!: Market Garden to Arnhem, Sep44
description:
This is a very simple (but not simplistic) and fast point-to-point ... the boggy Netherlands terrain made roads even more important, especially for armor/panzer ... regiment/brigade game about Market Garden. 8 one-day turns.

Rules are all of 3 pages. Excellent intro to military/naval history boardgames for family and friends (over the holidays, etc.) Already really popular at the club here in Oslo.

If Fog of War is used, German (hidden until engaged) strength can be Strong/historical, Weak, and Very Weak - Monty's Fantasy - with the games length ... the requirement to open a road/route up to Arnhem ... shortened accordingly. The probability of each of those German strengths can be indicated by Dutch Resistance warning of panzers coming into the area ... or not.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Sweet Temptations
description:
A basic roll-and-move game with trivia found in a centerfold of the April 3rd, 1990 edition of Family Circle Magazine. Players provide dice, pawns and a quantity of small chocolate candies referred to as "Chocolate Chunks" or "cc's".

The goal of the game is to be the first to reach Finish square without any cc's. Spaces on the board can add or subtract cc's. Some spaces allow you to answer chocolate related trivia questions found in the back of the magazine to discard extra cc's.

name: 空飛ぶチーズ (Flying Cheese)
description:
User summary
空飛ぶチーズ Flying Cheese is a reimplemented version of Flying Cheese from 2011 by the same designer. In this game, the players use their catapults to launch cheese sponge dice into the cubicles in the box and receive corresponding tiles. The player who has gained the highest score from the points on the tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the original game, players gained points from the numbers showing on the dice they land. In the new game, players gain their points from the tiles they collect, making it more a game of skill than luck.

Publisher's summary
カタパルトで、チーズに見立てたスポンジのサイコロを箱に向かって飛ばします。箱に入ったら、チーズが入った所にあるタイルを獲得できます。
タイルにはポイントがあり、ゲーム終了時にポイントを最も獲得したプレイヤーが勝利します。

name: Border Tensions
description:
The summoner has brought forth factions from distant worlds to use as pawns in our game. Take your choice of Dragons, Robots, Wild West or Zombies as you take on your opponents. Use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows and you’ll win the game.

New factions are coming soon for expanded gameplay up to 8 players!

The most basic ruleset of the game works mainly like a matching game that can be played by anyone with the ability to add to 10. Advanced rules turn this basic game into a battle of wits with chess-like decision making and strategy in nearly every card pull. Rules are available for head-to-head 2 player games, free-for-all games of 3 and up and team games. Optional rules can also be applied that change up game play and strategies

name: Border Tensions: Zombies vs Wild West
description:
A city taken over by Zombies and an old Wild West town find themselves side by side in a new land, forced into a battle for survival at their border. Together, you and your opponent use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows, and you’ll win the game.

Zombies and Wild West core game of Border Tensions for 2 players. Can be combined with other core sets for multiplayer options.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Border Tensions: Dragons vs Robots
description:
A royal kingdom of Dragons and an army of Robots find themselves side by side in a new land, forced into a battle for survival at their border. Together, you and your opponent use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows, and you’ll win the game.

Dragons vs Robots core set for 2 players. Combinable with other core sets for multiplayer.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Achtung Panzer!: Fast Play WWII Rules for N Scale
description: Company to task force combat in the World War II era. Designed for 9 mm, 10 mm & 1/144 scale models with no paperwork. Figure ratio is 1:4, ground scale is 2" = 100 yards and 15 minute turns. 20 page rule book plus 13 chart, misc. pages in spiral bound rule book. No minor country stats or scenarios provided

name: Treasure Road
description:
Treasure Road is a light game for casual gamers. It features computer game design elements such as yellow boxes, coins and pixel graphics.

Players try to collect all of their coins on the board before the other players do.

Gameplay: the player draws three cards that can have three actions: move, spin an adjacent tile, spin any tile on the game board. The player moves his/her character on the board to get all of his/her coins while blocking the ways of the other players.

At the same time, an automated villain tries to steal the collected coins from the players.

Action boxes enable players to perform special actions that help the player, or that hinder opponents.

The player who collects all of his/her coins first wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Maze, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Pull Your Card: Hip Hop Edition
description:
A multiple choice trivia card game. The first deck is dedicated to Hip Hop.

Each deck includes Pick any Player, Reverse, and Skip cards.

Other expansion packs consist of Reggae, Pop, Movies, TV, etc.

—description from the designer

name: Cooped Up
description:
The King is throwing a surprise birthday brunch for the Queen and needs your help. As one of the kingdom's greatest chicken farmers it is up to you to supply the eggs. Unfortunately not all eggs are perfect for her favorite dish.

The game is playable with two to five players. Play time is about 30 minutes.

Players collect sets of chicken cards in order to draw random egg tokens from the Coop bag, but beware; some of the eggs are rotten and can end your turn when drawn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Set Collection, Take That

name: World Tank Battles
description:
This is a simple game of WWII tank combat in order to make good use of World Tank Museum, a series of miniature tanks produced by Kaiyodo.
Game components are one rulebook, one double-sided map, eighty tactical cards, fourteen mission cards, twenty seven tank cards and cardboard counters. World Tank Museum miniatures (or any other miniature tanks) substitute for cardboard counters.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: World Tank Battles 2
description:
This is a simple game of the battle between JGSDF tanks and gigantic monsters in order to make good use of World Tank Museum, a series of miniature tanks produced by Kaiyodo.
Game components are one rulebook, one double-sided map, eighty tactical cards, fourteen mission cards, twenty seven tank cards and cardboard counters. World Tank Museum miniatures (or any other miniature tanks) substitute for cardboard counters.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: DeckPerception
description:
DeckPerception is a fun and interactive tabletop game in the classic tradition. Players use their powers of perception and deduction to make predictive guesses about their card--which they can't see but the other players can.

For 3-4 players age 12 and up. Game play is 15-20 minutes. Game includes special DeckPerception cards, card holders, score sheets, pencil, and rules, packaged in an attractive and sturdy box. A great game for families, middle school and high school students, and adults (while enjoying adult beverages or otherwise).

Game Play

Game play is simple, highly interactive, and fun. Players are dealt one card each, which are placed in card holders so they can't see them but the other players can. Using the other players' cards, guesses, and reactions as clues, players use their skills of perception and deduction to predict the rank, the range, and eventually the number of their unseen card over several rounds of guessing. Guesses are marked on the included score sheets, which facilitate game play. At the end of the hand players look at their cards and receive points for correct guesses. The player with the most points after four hands wins.

—description from the publisher

name: BUICK!
description:
From the introduction in the rule book:

"This game is designed to be a tactical simulation of small scale gang warfare actions involving the car in what must be considered to be the first use of mechanised troops in a fast moving tactical situation."

The game features rules for table-top skirmishes between 1920s gangsters in America, armed with a variety of weapons and driving a variety of vehicles.

name: Trivia on the Go Music
description:
Trivia Cards about Music.

1000 Questions.

Sister Deck to Trivia on the Go America. Decks can be combined.

name: Cerditos Glotones
description: You can not stop laughing with this game. Grab all the fruits and vegetables you can from the feeder before the shift passes, but do it with your gluttony pig snout and listen to how the feeder sounds when you try. Guaranteed fun!

name: Zooloretto: Zwei Wertungsvarianten für Zooloretto Junior und Mini
description:
Two variants for scoring Zooloretto Junior and Mini.
A different way to calculate the score of the game with a brand new table.
Released as the Designer's annual Christmas card.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Borgo Dell'Oca
description:
A nice walk in the ancient little town, between workers, games and duties. King is waiting for you, will you be able to be in time at his presence?
Roll the dice.... and find it out!
Move your pawn along the path by the result of the dice and, the read the instruction on the stop where you land. You could move faster, re-roll or go back to the start depending on where you land. The first who will reach the end of the path, wins.

name: Pulgas locas 4 en raya!
description: Super fun game 4 in magnetic stripes. Line up 4 fleas of your color, if you can ... you'll see how they change!

name: Jewels: Ruffiano
description:
Promo card for Jewels.

You can reveal a new event. You can pay 3 to choose a card from the discard pile and put it in the city where you are.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Trading

name: Space
description:
Create your own board, making it longer or shorter depending on the time you have to play, you must also pass different tests to go forward or backward in your intergalactic journey. Beware of the attack of the drones of the planet Zum!

Crea tu propio tablero, haciéndolo más largo o más corto dependiendo del tiempo que tengas para jugar, además deberás pasar distintas pruebas para ir avanzando o retrocediendo en tu viaje intergaláctico. ¡Cuidado con el ataque de los drones del planeta Zum!

name: ¡Que se cae!
description:
Place your chips without dropping them

Coloca tus fichas sin que se caigan

name: El dentista loco
description: Each player, in turn, hits a tooth. But, attention! your opponent can hit one of your healthy teeth. Will the next one feel good or bad? When a player gets 6 healthy teeth to create the perfect smile, he must press on the WIN ear so that the patient sticks his tongue out, thus preventing the opponent from continuing to hit. When the language has dropped the player wins the game.

name: Rock'N Tour: El rock es cultura
description: Trivia game about rock music in Mexico and around the world.

name: Superfriends: Magnetic Target Game
description:
Use the magnetic wand to pick up the balls and try to drop them in place in the holes below. The person who scores the highest points wins the game. To replay, simply turn game over and collect balls in side holder.

—description from the box

name: Polowanie na śniadanie
description: Polowanie na śniadanie ("Breakfast Hunting") is a 2-4 players game with Tom & Jerry characters. Jerry has to collect seven pieces of cheese before he is captured by Tom and his cat fellows. Players move their pawns on the board and whoever captures his breakfast first is the winner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Debris: Loot, Build, Brawl
description:
You’re an engineer, and your ability to build and repair bots shines through, turning toasters into gladiators. Business is booming, and you need to get rid of the inconvenient competition.

--

Debris is a fast-paced, crafting & brawling card game for 2 players.

Each player starts with a companion and a handful of debris cards. Each turn, players use debris for building,trading, and assigning tasks to their roster of bots.

Through the Maintenance & Business phases of a turn, players use cards from their hand to acquire packaged bots from the Market, build them, deceive their opponent, and stay alive. Once built, bots are used to draw more cards and get an edge on the competition. They have perks and defects that will affect their efficiency, as well as how they interact with the other components in play.

Each model of bot comes in different versions, ranging from questionably operational to unexpectedly potent. Packaged bots are only revealed once built, so it’s up to players to make the best from their luck and memory.

The goal of each player is to seize all of his opponent’s cards, emptying his hand. A player wins the game when his opponent doesn’t have any cards in his hand at the end of a turn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Sylaby do zabawy
description:
An educational board game learning to divide the words into syllables.

There are two types of cards in this game: the word cards the player keeps in the hand and the ladybug cards to draw from the pile. If the number of the ladybugs matches with the syllables number of the word from the card in the hand the player discards the word card. The player who discards all the cards from his hand wins.

Official Polish desciption:

Gra kształcąca słuch fonemowy (umiejętność analizy i syntezy sylabowej wyrazów) oraz koordynację wzrokowo - słuchowo - ruchową, koncentrację słuchową - umiejętności bardzo ważne w nauce czytania i pisania. Uczy również przestrzegania ustalonych zasad. Z tej gry mogą korzystać nie tylko logopedzi, pedagodzy i terapeuci ale także rodzice , którzy chcą czas wspólnie spędzony z dzieckiem przeznaczyć zabawy o charakterze edukacyjnym.

Zawartość pudełka: 55 kart biedronek, 55 kart ilustracji, plansza, 5 pionków, kostka, instrukcja.

name: La nouvelle donne
description:
This is a corporate card game from "Electricité De France".
It was designed in 2007 in order to explain the opening of the french power market to foreign competition.
The goal of the game is to gather a 8-card collection by asking question to the other players.

name: Thingamajig
description:
A family card game where players race to build certain layouts of cards. Each round, players draw a new Widget card which gives them a specific layout to build. They then take turns playing cards to their machine, trying to match the layout on their Widget card.

The game employs mechanics of both luck and tactical thinking, as players must play a card on their turn, meaning that poor planning can mean they are forced to make the game harder for themselves by adding a card in the wrong place.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Weevils
description:
Weevils is a quick, cooperative card game for 2 to 4 players, ages 10 and up. Players work together to grow a beautiful garden in time for the Summer Festival. But watch out for the Weevils... they’ll eat your precious plants!

Each round, players will take turns drawing, playing cards to the Garden or Compost pile, and discarding from the deck to complete the Growth requirements for Plants. Whenever Weevils are revealed, they are played to the Garden and will eat Growth cards and Plants on every turn, minimizing your chance for victory.

Complete five Plants in the Garden and win, but if the deck runs out, the game ends in defeat!

name: Park Smarts Adventures: Yellowstone
description:
Park Smarts Adventures: Yellowstone is designed to be educational and teach the players about the highways and features in Yellowstone National Park.

The game requires players to move "magnetic maneuvering pieces" around a magnetic board (with 2 sides, one for summer, and one for winter) which illustrates the sites and features of Yellowstone National Park. The goal of the game is to visit the ten most popular features of the park first. Whoever visits all the sites first wins.

Features include Old Faithful, Inspiration Point, Lamar Valley, The Chocolate Pots, and more.

The summer game pieces include: bicycle, motor home, sport utility vehicle, convertible, and jeep. The winter game pieces include: snowmobile, snowshoes, skis, sled, and snow coach.

Movement of the game pieces is determined by dice rolls.

There are 3 sections of learning question cards (15 questions in each) and a mystery deck of cards.

Information cards include the following:

About the Animals & Plants - Blue
Fun Things to Do - Purple
Fun Facts to Know - Green
Mystery Cards - Red

name: Esferamide
description:
An strategy game where you have to put all your balls in the holed board building a piramidal structure. In your turn you can put a ball in a valid spot, push a non blocked ball of your colour one position (displacing others along the way) or pass your turn.
If you push a ball outside the piramid or to an invalid position, it will be captured by the player who did the push.

Un juego de estrategia donde el objetivo es colocar todas tus bolas de color en un tablero agujereado. En tu turno puedes colocar una bola en una posición válida, empujar una bola de tu color (pudiendo desplazar otras en linea)o pasar tu turno. Si alguna bola cae fuera de la pirámide o en una posición inválida, resultará capturada por el jugador que empujó la primera bola.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement

name: Hero: Prepare Your Champion
description:
A dragon has invaded your kingdom with a promise for disaster. The common people crave for a mighty, brave and legendary hero in this time of need. And you... are part of the common people. So, you should go find some true heroes and prepare them for battle!

Hero is a cooperative and semi-cooperative game where players take the roles of common people with different trades who must prepare a hero. By using transparent cards, players can actually see how their hero looks like and how their stats change.

From a fierce minotaur paladin with golden bracers armed with a flaming great-axe and mounted in a t-rex with a scorpion tail, to a circus goblin with a bionic arm, equipped with a butter knife and a mop, leading a pink chicken army.

Players will take actions and manage resources to recruit and provide supplies to the greatest heroes while the dragon destroys their kingdom.

If there are no cards left in the kingdom deck, the players lose. If the dragon is killed, the players win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sähkönary
description:
This game is similiar to Pictionary/Charades as players try to make their team gues what word they are trying to explane. The explaining is done either by drawing or by miming.

In the game there is a stack of cards. Each card hase 4 words on them. The words are organized in different categories. Electricity (thus the name Electronary), marketing, work and free time.
The game board also has different squers with the same traits. Teams move by rolling dice and the player in turn has to explane the word from the categorie thir pawn stops at. If the team ques the right word in 1,5 minutes they get to throw again and continue. If not the next team goes on.
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gran Forseti
description:
Game about strategic politics and roles.
You must play as your role, but be careful, your identity could be discovered. You must vote for law cards and act consequently if they are approved.
The player who manages to reach its objective will be declared "Gran Forseti" and the winner.

From the Spanish publisher:
Interpreta a tu personaje, pero ten cuidado, tu identidad no debe ser descubierta. Crea leyes, participa en votaciones, construye monumentos y edificios representativos, mantén alianzas con otros jugadores y desarrolla tu mejor estrategia para convertirte en el Gran Forseti. Juega en la ambientación que más te guste y no olvides diseñar el mundo según tus preferencias. Gran Forseti es un juego donde a veces tendrás que elegir entre "ganar" o "disfrutar". Ganar no siempre es la mejor opción y menos en política.
Designer: Óscar Cuadrado Mendoza

name: Park Smarts Adventures: Grand Canyon
description:
Park Smarts Adventures: Grand Canyon is designed to be educational and teach the players about the highways and features in the Grand Canyon National Park.

The game requires players to move "magnetic maneuvering pieces" around a magnetic board (with 2 sides) which illustrates the sites and features of Grand Canyon National Park on both the North Rim and South Rim. The goal of the game is to visit the ten most popular features of the park first. Whoever visits all the sites first wins.

The game pieces include: bicycle, motor home, sport utility vehicle, convertible, and jeep.

Movement of the game pieces is determined by dice rolls.

There are 3 sections of learning question cards (15 questions in each) and a mystery deck of cards.

Information cards include the following:

About the Animals & Plants - Blue
Fun Things to Do - Purple
Fun Facts to Know - Green
Mystery Cards - Red


—description from the publisher

name: Sly
description:
The Triade de Diamants, three identical diamonds, having broken the laws of nature, have become a marvel gracing the greatest museums on earth. Until now...

Jack Sly is a diamond thief attempting to become a legend by collecting all three diamonds. Gregory Lestrade III, descendant of Scotland Yard's Inspector Lestrade, is determined to create his own legacy, by bringing the master thief to justice.

In Sly, a puzzle card game for 1-2 players, Sly sneaks across the cards representing three museums, endeavoring to manipulate them to his advantage, uses the tricks of the trade to snatch the diamonds, and attempts to escape before the police can catch up with him. Will you get away, or wind up imprisoned? If you can't take the heat, you're not Jack Sly.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Anna's Roundtable: Fire Emblem Board Game – Siege mode expansion
description:
New game mode introducing asymmetric 1v1 gameplay.

One player creates a party of 5 units, selecting 1 unit as their "Lord" unit, while the other player takes control of an army of generic units, having up to 8 generic units deployed at any given time. (Out of a total of 18 different generic unit options.)

The match ends once the defending player's Lord unit is defeated, and the two players switch sides.

The player who defeats the most generic units as the defender wins!

Total gameplay time lasts around 30 to 45 minutes.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Dados de baloncesto
description:
Basketball dice.
Play basketball with 4 dice. You can throw your dice 3 times and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need results with the color of your team, and one die with double or triple basket symbol. After 3 throws, your turn is over.
You must take notes of the scoring.
After a number of rounds, the player who scores most points will be the winner.






























Juega al baloncesto con 4 dados
Con toda la emoción del baloncesto. Canastas, triples, faltas y tiros libres.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestras propias ligas. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

name: Dados de golf
description:
Golf dice.
Play golf with 5 dice.
One die shows the hole objective. You can throw your dice and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need to reach the distance shown on the objective die, and a blue or green flag depending of the objective. When you reach the objective, you compare your number of throws with the par of the hole and score points consequently.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores less points will be the winner.






























Juega un partido de golf con 5 dados
Con toda la emoción de un partido de golf. Lanzamientos, distancias, hoyos, pares, birdies y bogeys.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestros propios partidos. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

name: Hollywood Haiku: a Game of Film Trivia and Bad Poetry – Classics
description:
Movie trivia with an element of area control - the sooner you answer the better! Correct answers always rewarded. Clues to over 1,100 films. For 2-6 players/teams. Three different versions geared to film fans of different ages: Classics, Silver Screen, and Millenium.

Mechanics: Read clues to the other players. Each clue is written as a haiku. Players write answers on white boards – once the white board is placed on the game board there’s no changing your answer. The quicker you can answer correctly the better off you are. Place markers on one of the seven Hollywood stars on the board, each representing a different film category (each version includes action/adventure, comedy, drama, sci-fi, horror & suspense, fantasy; and one other that differs in each version). Or ,draw Bonus Objective cards for a chance to earn even more points for reaching goals such as having the most markers in a given category or for having markers in all the categories.
Game ends as soon as any player places 17 markers. Players get one point for each marker placed, and additional points for accomplishing Bonus Objectives.

—description from the designer

name: Trumpolicy
description:
WHAT KIND OF A SOCIETY DO YOU WANT?

Enjoy a friendly board game while having stimulating conversation on the most relevant issues of the day. The game may be played with individual competitors or as two competing teams (2 or 3 players per team). Players or teams roll the dice to move around the board to try to secure a set of social policies with assigned values.

Gameplay: Each player starts with 100 political chits and earns more when they visit the White House. They may also use their political chits by placing a deposit on those policies they wish to prevent others from securing. The team format is set up as Democratic versus Republican policies, with each team having to secure the requisite value of their party’s policies (blue versus red squares) in order to win the game. As players move around the board they may draw Twitter cards which may adjust their political chit totals or send them to different policy squares or to the media scrum or senate hearings squares which might impede their progress.

Objective: The first player or team to secure the requisite value of policies wins the game.

Dare to play this game with your family and friends and find out what they really think!

—description from the publisher

name: La Guerre-Eclair
description:
This hidden set-up war game is an unusual WWII adaptation of the classic L'Attaque. What makes it most unusual is that the rules are dated 11/44, which means it must have been one of the first French games published after the liberation.

This is a more complex game than L'Attaque or its successor Stratego. Its name translates as "The Lightning War" (or Blitzkrieg), and this is reflected in the mix of pieces.

Whereas L'Attaque and its successor Stratego simply used numerically ranked pieces, this game includes a host of WWII-era innovations as well, with pieces representing parachutists, bombers, anti-aircraft guns, delayed-action bombs, flying bombs and a tanker-truck that must survive to keep the bombers flying. Missing from the mix is any kind of armored unit, but there are "magnetic fences" that somehow disable the engines of aeroplanes.

Movement and combat is much more flexible than in the basic L'Attaque. Pieces may move in any direction, including diagonally, and may attack any piece orthogonally adjacent. To win, players must capture both the opponent's flag and its "secret plan".

name: Neuro Match
description:
Pairs of cards are laid out on the table. One card in each pair shows a body movement/gesture and a phrase, the other one a letter or number. Some of these pairs are open, some are concealed after everyone had a look at them. During the game, additional pairs are added.
Players take turns flipping open cards from a personal pile of cards. When a letter or number appears that is in one of the pairs, everyone has to either do the gesture or say the phrase or both (depending on the agreed difficulty level) on the matching card. The last player to do this has to take all the open cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

name: Cube Conundrum
description:
Cube Conundrum is a simple-to-learn game that can be played in about 10-15 minutes but is designed to be extremely flexible and provide a different game every time, depending on how you set up the board.

Players use action cards to move their cubes from start to finish along a hexagonal path. The cards send each cube forward or backward one space on every turn. Depending on the cards in your hand, you may have no choice but to help your fellow players. However, chances are good they'll be repaying you in the future.

Every card affects every player on every turn. Choose Wisely!

The hexagonal path includes advanced/harder gameplay options for those looking for a longer game with some twists and turns. While strategy does play a role in this game, there is an equal element of luck-of-the-draw as well.

—description from the publisher

name: Road Hog: Rule the Road – Road Rage promo card expansion
description: Four card promotion expansion to Road Rage. This pack includes one red, blue, green, and yellow card each. The promo packs were distributed at BGG.Con 2017 and a fifth packing card specifies copy number out of 75.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Realm of Desires
description:
Realm of Desires is a strategic turn-based board game for 2-4 players set in a fantasy medieval era where an epic war happen due to the clash between 4 races over their desires.

No Dice, No Luck. Your strategy can overcome any obstacle and turn any potential disadvantage to an advantage in this game.

Modular battlefield will make each game unique and filled with its challenges to command and conquer the other races.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: The Finest Guild Of Real Gentleorcs
description:
Insulting at the highest level!

Have you always wanted to fool the elves, witches, orcs and magicians of their unconstructive mindset? Use your non-existent tact and inexhaustible creativity to verbally humiliate your companions as efficiently as possible. With each new game, new unique combinations of insults are created that you can hand out to your comrades. But beware, because your companions also have some quick-witted insults that they would love to hand over to you.

The game is being played by players drafting cards from a common pool, creating their humiliation as a phrase. A grammatically correct sentence, no matter if it makes sense or not, can be used against an opponent to shame him publically, giving him penalty points. Some races are offended and thus humilated more by specific words than others. Once a player has accumulated 30 points or more through insults of the other players, he is eliminated from the game, though there are a couple of proposed house rule which allow for different ways to play this game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Fours
description:
Fours is a modern interpretation of the ancient Sumerian game The Royal Game of Ur. While inspired by that game, the rules have been simplified allowing for an easy-to-learn game that still has elements of chance with a need for strategy.

Like the original game, Fours is a race to move checkers through a course. Opponents can knock each other off the course, but there are 'safe' spaces. The 'fours' theme is evident throughout the game - dice yield a result of 1, 2, 3, or 4. Safe spaces occur every 4 spaces. Each player has four checkers to run through the course. A roll of 4 allows a player an extra roll.

One of the most unique design elements of the game is the portability. The game 'board' is actually a fabric game mat with a rubberized backing. This allows it to conveniently fold and pack into a small pouch easily carried in a purse, backpack, or briefcase. Unlike modern recreations of the game, a large, bulky wooden board is not required.

name: Dystopolis
description:
Dystopolis is a strategic board game taking place in a not-so-distant future where the free market has run amok and resulted in a decadent society. Each player represents a ruthless investor in the megacity Dystopolis. The aim is to outmanoeuvre the rivals through clever investments and by maximizing the profit from companies. Money can also be used to shamelessly bribe others into obedience. Action cards can be used to remove competing investments or to take over threatening companies - as long as the voting succeeds.

The game mechanics is a combination of area control, stock holding and economic negotiation through bribes and bidding. The strategy in Dystopolis is centered around the placement of company tiles and investment tokens. The players add company tiles to the modular game board during each round. To claim ownership the players then need to invest money in the companies. The companies establish connections to each other. More connections to other companies increases the revenue, but also makes the company more vulnerable to attacks. A player with limited influence in an area can compensate for this by saving pleny of money for bribes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Game Design
description:
Game Design is a tableau building game about designing a game. Players need to build their own game project of their best. Designing schedule, collecting ideas and demonstrating their games to the game enthusiasts.

This game consists of three rounds,and each round is with three turns. For the beginning of every round, players get four idea cards and do card drafting. In each turn, you and your opponents choose a flowchart tile and do the possible actions: (1) play a new idea card from your hand to expand your design, (2) collect resource from your design where your personal meeple is located, or (3)demonstrate part of your design(mechanic, theme or art) and get feedback, which mean your scores.

Every part of your game design shows the fame and the possibilities of your project. The game ends when all flowchart tiles are played. The winner belongs to who has the highest scores and will have the chance to publish the design.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Malifaux: Hans
description:
Overview from Walifaux wiki

Hans is a Sniper for a hire, a Mercenary who will work for anyone willing to pay his fees.

Mobility

Lawls no.

Hans as a Walk of 3 and is completely unable to declare a charge. Deploy him in a good position, because he's unlikely to move very far from that spot over the course of a game.

Offense

Hans has a Sniper Rifle with a respectable Sh of 6, a decent damage spread of 2/3/5, and an insane range of 18 inches. When he focuses, the range of his Sniper Rifle increases to 36 inches(!), allowing him to reach out and touch someone almost across the entire board. Furthermore, due to his excellent sniping skills, Hans does not randomize when shooting into melee. Pinpoint precision is a virtue.

He also comes equipped with Goggles, which allow him to ignore any pulse, aura, or Markers which affect Line of Sight. This won't always come up during a game, but it can be a surprise for opponents who think that their models are safe within a cloud of steam or behind a pillar of ice. Hans is also Ruthless, so he is immune to Willpower duels (such as those created by the Terrifying or Manipulative abilities) during his turn.

His Sniper Rifle comes with an assortment of triggers, one for each suit. He can use his Reference the Field Guide tactical action each turn to discard a card, which adds the suit of the discarded card to his duel totals for the rest of his activation. This is a good use for low cards in your hand, ensuring that Hans will hit the triggers you need regardless of the suits of his flipped or cheated cards.

The Kneecap trigger lets Hans discard a card to give the target Slow, the Armor Piercing trigger makes his attack ignore Armor, the Curse Breaker trigger makes his attack ignore Incorporeal, and the Disarm trigger lets Hans discard a card to give a Minion the Disarmed Condition, which prevents them from making Ml actions until the end of the turn.

Hans also possesses the Smile, You Son of a... tactical action, which grants him the Ping! Condition for the rest of his activation. Ping! changes Hans's attacks so that they deal no damage, but instead discard one Upgrade from his target. This very unique ability makes Hans the one model that can knock upgrades off of other models, which can drastically change the course of a game, especially when used against Masters.

However, Hans is also a mercenary in the truest sense of the word, and his To the Highest Bidder ability allows any Master that has been targeted by Hans to discard two cards to make the action immediately fail. Be wary about this, though sometimes forcing the opponent to discard can be useful in its own right.

Resilience

Hans has a high Defense and an average Willpower, though his main defense is that he's a sniper who probably won't move very far from where you deploy him at the start of the game. If the opponent does get close, however, he is also Disguised, making him immune to charges.

Otherwise, he has a low number of wounds for a model of his price, so try to pick a good spot with plenty of firing lanes and some good cover when you deploy him.

Upgrades

As of Ripples of Fate, Hans has his own 0 Soulstone Upgrade, Advanced Sight. This boosts his Wk to 4, and gives him the (0) Advanced Sight Action. It gives Hans Focused +1, but needs a 7 of any suit to succeed. It also competes with Reference The Field Guide for his (0) action.

Oathkeeper is great for Hans in Outcasts, as a turn of Fast is three attacks per turn, or two attacks after a successful Smile, You Son of a... action. That's a potential two upgrades he can shoot off of an enemy model, which is usually a pretty good exchange for your own discarded Oathkeeper.

Scramble is another option for Hans, but given his already slow speed, it's not a good one, as he'll still be slow, only more expensive. If you want a fast model, take something other than Hans.

When working for the Guild, Plant Evidence can be useful for allowing Hans to help out with Power Ritual, if you deploy him near one of your corners. This also has the effect of keeping Power Ritual a secret until later in the game, as you won't be dropping a scheme marker in your own corner at the start of the game and giving it away.

Imbued Energies is useful out of Arcanists, for the same reason that Oathkeeper is good in Outcasts. A Fast Hans is a happy Hans.

Out of Neverborn, Pact can use useful on Hans to ensure that his attacks won't be completely shut down by the Black Joker.

Ten Thunders can give him Recalled Training, which makes Hans very effective for one turn. The +flip to all his actions can help with both Smile, You Son of a... and his Sniper Rifle attacks, making him more accurate when it counts.

Tactics and Tips

The effectiveness of Hans really depends on his board and your deployment zone, as he's great on boards where he can get to a high position and cover wide swathes of the board, but less effective if most of the board is blocked off from his bullets.

Smile, You Son of a... is a scary ability that will cause many opponents to panic, as nobody wants to see the upgrades shot off their Masters. You can use this to your advantage and bluff with Hans to make them discard via his To the Highest Bidder ability, as the opponent has to choose whether or not to discard before you flip any cards for Hans's attack.

Tara has a cute trick that she can do with Hans and Whispers From Darkness (Eternal Journey upgrade). By burying Hans (via a Glimpse the Void trigger from her crew), she can use Whispers From Darkness to use his Smile, You Son of a... action and gain the Ping! Condition. This allows Tara to shoot upgrades off of other models without having to worry about Hans's To the Highest Bidder ability allowing the opponent to cancel her attacks. Her ability to bury him also allows him to rapidly deploy on the battlefield, either via her Faces in the Void action (Obliteration Symbiote upgrade) or just as a natural result of the Glimpse the Void trigger. The latter option, however, tends to bring him closer to the action than he prefers.

Lilith can also help Hans rapidly redeploy via her Tangle Shadows action, which can toss him forward in exchange for tossing one of her (much faster) models back to his prior location. When used in conjunction with sprinting Terror Tots, this enables Hans to get to an advantageous position without having to make what might otherwise be a game-long trudge with his slow speed.

Mah Tucket can also push Hans around with her Horribly Hollerin' action, ensuring that he gets to a better position for his shooting without having to take a Walk action.

Playing Against Hans

He's a sniper, so your best bet is probably to either avoid getting into his line of fire, or close to melee and kill him there.

Be careful of his Smile, You Son of a... action, as it can knock the upgrades off your Master and Henchmen, and save cards to discard to cancel Han's attack if you have upgrades that you simply cannot live without.

name: 5D's Yu-Gi-Oh! Board Game
description:
This board game is based on the anime series Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's.

Players move around the board by rolling a die and attemp to collect Red Cards, collect Purple Cards, and win duels.

On a player's turn, they roll a die and move that many spaces. Each space on the board has an assigned action.
Red spaces: Draw a card from the Red Deck.
Purple spaces: Draw a card from the Purple Deck.
Spinner spaces: Spin the spinner and take the resulting action.
Cover spaces: Turn ends.
Move cover spaces: Move any cover, revealing an open Tunnel.
Tunnel spaces: Roll the die and move as many uncovered Tunnel spaces as the number shown on die.
Duel spaces: If a player's Red Card has a number greater than the Purple Card in the quadrant, then a duel occurs. Duels are resolved by rolling the duel dice.

The first player to accomplish the following four goals wins:

Win 3 Duels
Collect 4 Red Cards
Collect 3 Purple Cards
Competes in the final Turbo Duel and wins
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kooky Carnival
description:
Kooky Carnival is an educational roll and move game for 2-4 players age 6 and up and published by Lakeshore Games. The following is excerpted from the Lakeshore website:
"Who can be the first to collect 6 carnival tickets? Students read fun passages, then use context clues to answer questions about them in this fast-paced reading game. Each correct answer earns the player a ticket—the first one to get 6 tickets wins! Includes game board, 50 question cards, 28 carnival tickets, decoder, 4 pawns and a die. For 2-4 players."

name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2017
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2017'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2017. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

description:

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about numbers. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.
