To start, each player will place his pawn on the starting space. The pawn will only move one space in any direction to an adjacent empty space.

Each player in his turn will make to actions:

- Move his own pawn one space
- Move a counter trying to block your opponent's pawn.

This first to block his opponent's pawn will be the winner.



===========================SPANISH;

El objetivo del juego será inmovilizar al peón contrario.

Al comenzar la partida cada jugador colocará su peón en un lado del tablero. El peón sólo podrá trasladarse a una casilla inmediata, en cualquier dirección, siempre que no esté ocupada.

En cada turno un jugador tendrá que: desplazar el peón una casilla y colocar una ficha tratando de obstaculizar al peón contrario.

El ganador será el primero que consiga bloquear al peón contrario.

name: Chinese Zodiac chess
description:
A 13×13 variant of Chinese chess, originally invented by artist and designer Chen Wei in 1987, then redeveloped and awarded a design patent in 2009. Each player has 12 pieces corresponding to the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac.

Each piece moves in a different way, appropriate to the type of animal, for example, the snake moves in an S-shape. The object of the game is to checkmate the dragon, which is the equivalent to the king or general in Chinese chess.

The name given to this game in Chinese is "中国棋" which literally means "Chinese chess". (The game known in English as Chinese chess is called "象棋", "elephant chess", in Chinese.)

The gameboard for Chinese Zodiac chess is the subject of Chinese utility model patents CN303396390S, CN301049385 and CN87300760.

name: The Beautiful Game: TCG
description:
The Beautiful Game: TCG (Trading Card Game) is a tabletop board game incorporating an optional trading card system to introduce more player cards and tactical 'Event Cards'. It is a 2 player game that can be played for any duration, but it is recommended that players play 60 or 90 minutes, broken down into two halves.

The game starts with players choosing their teams. In the Kick Off Edition, players will draft their teams face-up from the pool of players. The player cards are then assigned to a number which corresponds to a player piece on the pitch. The game is then played using the stats on the player cards and rolls of the D20 against these stats when necessary to perform certain actions such as shooting or tackling. The game is quick and fluid to play and involves no measuring of distances other than counting spaces on the pitch.

Extra tactics and gameplay elements are introduced to the game via 'Event Cards' – a 50 card (minimum) deck of cards that can help you or hinder your opponent. The Kick Off Edition features pre-constructed Event Card decks.

When playing the game, the player in possession of the ball (the attacking player) leads play but the defending player is still heavily involved in influencing how the attacker can play. The defending player chooses to try mark attackers and can play Event cards to hinder their chances in order to try win back possession.

The winner is the player who has scored the most goals at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Boulbing
description:
Use 9 balls to hit 9 characters, the more distance away the more points.

You can remove characters as you go or leave them on the ground for a bit of a challenge

name: STOOPID! The Card Game
description:
"What is STOOPID The Card Game?"

"STOOPID is the glorious absence of common sense."

In STOOPID The Card Game, you the player use (BURN) your common sense to play an array of cards that you draw from your deck and play from your hand. These cards have all kinds of effects that cause damage or hinder the other players in some way. You can even call on your neighbors to come fight at your side.

There are 5 card types in the STOOPID Core Deck; each one does something different.


Accidents
Happenings
Neighbors
Skirmish
Things


The goal of STOOPID is to use your cards to knock the other player(s) health down to zero and out of the game. But are they?!.

When playing STOOPID with 3 or more players, the players that get "knocked out” become ghosts. As ghosts they use their Skirmish (red) cards to haunt the players that are still alive.

—description from the publisher

name: The big MOVIE NIGHT
description:
The big MOVIE NIGHT contains four different games: Charades, Movie Quiz, Soundtrack Quiz and Who Am I?

CHARADES.

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Split the players into even teams and make sure you have a pen and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: Draw a card from the pile. Roll the dice and mime the charade listed next to the number you've rolled. Start the egg timer. Your team must correctly guess the charade you are miming before the egg timer runs out. If they do, your team wins a point. If not, the next team in line can take a guess. If they guess correctly, they take the point.

INDICATING THE CATAGORY:
Films - Pretend you are cranking an old fashioned movie camera.
TV - Draw a rectangle with your index finger.
Books - Pretend to unfold your hands as if they were a book opening.
Songs - Pretend to sing into a microphone.
To indicate how many words are in the charade, hold the correct number of fingers against your opposite arm.

MIMING: To mime is to use only gestures and movements to act out, it does NOT include speaking, mouthing words or verbalising in any form! You may not indicate objects within the place you are playing to help your teammates.

WINNING THE GAME: The first team to reach 15 points wins.

MOVIE AND SOUNDTRACK QUIZZES.

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Split the players into even teams and make sure you have a pen and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: The beginning team draws a card, asks the other team a question and starts the egg timer. The players in the team are allowed to confer and must answer the question before the egg timer runs out. 1 point is awarded for each correct answer.

WINNING THE GAME: The first player or team to reach 15 points is the winner.

WHO AM I?

BEFORE YOU GET STARTED: Make sure you have pens and paper to record your scores.

RULES FOR PLAY: Place the cards face down in a pile. each player picks a card from the pack. Without loking at it, use the headbands provided to secure it so that the other players can clearly see the name on the card. On each card is the name of a famous person, the player becomes that person for the round until they guess their identity. Each player takes turns to ask a question such as, "Am I female?", "Am I alive?", "Did I invent something?", ect. Each player takes turns to ask a question. If the player guesses their identity using 5 question or less, they get 3 points. If they guess using between 6 and 10 questions, they get 2 points. Between 11 and 15 questions gets 1 point and if the player does not guess who they are within 15 questions, they score no points.

WINNING THE GAME: The first player to reach 15 points wins.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Medakor
description:
Medakor is a gyroscope coin battling game like nothing you've ever seen before. It utilizes a unique mechanism in a spinning coin with 3 rings that spin independently. The outcome can unlock additional powers from each of Guardian characters. Support cards will help create strategies to push the battle in your favor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building
publishers: B&B Games Studio, Destiny Horizons, Inc.

name: Flick A' Round: Ghost Town
description:
North Tarrytown hides a ghastly secret: it’s population is being overrun by restless ghosts. It’s one versus all as the Ghost Hunter player battles all other players controlling the green ghouls.

Flick your wooden playing pieces from haunt to haunt in an attempt to either catch the ghastly ghouls or haunt the entire town. Either side can prevail and win the game.

As the Ghost hunter, you have 3 playing pieces. The Dog, The Van and The Hero. Each of these pieces has one action per turn.
The Dog moves to protect the headquarters like a hockey goalie.
The Van is a mobile base that the hero always goes back to.
The Hero is the piece used to trap the ghosts by hitting them.

As the Ghosts, the other players have 6 ghouls. Their goal is to successfully haunt the 10 town locations before the hunter can catch them all. The ghouls can haunt the civilians for extra turns in the game, but they need to be careful: A civilian can only be turned once.

name: Katana Schoolgirls vs Zombie Furries
description:
Katana Schoolgirls vs Zombie Furries is a tabletop minigame for 1-4 players. Players take the role of a katana-wielding schoolgirl, battling the forces of darkness and sometimes
each other.

To play you will need a cardstock figure or traditional miniature for each figure in the game, two or more six-sided dice, a playset (sample tiles included in the game), Character Cards, an Event Deck, Talent Cards, Dark Secret Cards and lots and lots of zombie miniatures.

The objective of the game is to hunt down and destroy the zombies and collect gear. Each opponent and gear has a point cost that is added at the end of the game to determine the winner. Objectives can shift during the game depending on the game scenario you are playing and your character’s Dark Secret motivation.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award
categories: Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Zombies

name: Farm Animals Spin Go Round
description:
Take a spin with barnyard friends in this exciting twist on bingo that’s fun for everyone in the family whether 3 or 93. Match the color, pattern, shape, or farm animal to mark your board. Every player has their own spinner and controls their destiny. That is, until someone lands on “Spin Go Round,” and then everyone switches spinners! You never know when the game will take a turn!

Information provided by publisher

name: Pentrategy
description:
Pentrategy is a strategy board game for two players. It has one 4x4 cell board game and 5 identical pieces for each player, 5 dark colored pieces for one player, 5 light color pieces for the other.
The goal is to arrange 4 of 5 pieces as a certain shape in any part of the board. Game is starting by landing pieces one by one on board, then moving pieces in order to any free neighbor cell until goal achieved.

—description from the designer

name: Four's Vigor
description:
Four's Vigor is a battle simulation board game for two players. It has one 4x4 cells board game and 10 pieces, 5 identical dark colored for one player, and 5 identical light colored for the other.
The goal of game is to kill 2 pieces of opponent, or surround him as he can not move any more.
During the game, when one piece is killed, if other four remaining pieces could make a straight line, the dead one can resurrect by four's vigor.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Sprint 3
description: This is a variant on Staupe's Speed, with three stacks instead of just one. Each stack has its own placement rule.

name: Cake Walk
description:
Anything that can be done with straightforward ease is said to be a "cakewalk." Any action that is "not a cakewalk" is, of course, difficult and complicated. The cakewalk was a pre-Civil War dance originally performed by slaves on plantation grounds. The uniquely American dance was first known as the "prize walk"; the prize was an elaborately decorated cake. Hence, "prize walk" is the original source for the phrases "takes the cake" and "cakewalk."

Racing game simulating the struggle of African-Americans trying to win the race to have the blue-ribbon cake. This game's imagery may be considered as racist, but try to view it as a historical testament to the age in which it was released. Please, if you have any further info on the game (such as the rules), post here or the forums within. Thanx!

Parker Brothers seems to have teamed up on this project with Anglo-American Games.
publishers: Anglo-American Games Co., Anglo-Canadian Games, Parker Brothers

name: The Prize Game of Lands and Nations
description:
This is a miniature card game published as a promotional item in 1875 by Charles Gooch, an American manufacturer of "Noiseless Spring Beds". The deck consists of 56 cards that measure just 2.25" by 1.25". The cards are printed with black ink on plain cardboard, with one side showing the name of a country followed by four geographical features related to that country. The back side is an advertisement for the company's beds.

To begin, players first form a pool of face-up cards equal to the number of players. There are then two rules variations: players either start with a hand of six, leaving a face-down draw deck, or the entire remaining deck is distributed at the outset.

Starting from the dealer's left, a player may first pick up a card from the pool if it completes a "trick" of the four cards related to a country. He then may ask any other player for one of the cards (by name and then feature) from a nation in which he already holds at least one card. If available, the other player must hand over the card, and the asking player may continue. As soon as the asking player fails to win a card, he must add one card from his hand to the pool, and play passes to the left. (If playing with the draw deck, a player takes the top card into his hand before discarding to the pool.)

Whenever a player completes a trick of four, it is set aside, and the winner is the player who completes the most tricks.

name: Paragon's Aerial Campaign Rules 1916-18
description:
Thin-card covered booklet of rules for a campaign game based on the Aerial Dogfight Rules 1916-18 - to be used to follow a campaign for just a single squadron v squadron or involving multiple squadrons or 'airforces'. It uses map movement for aircraft until combat occurs or an objective is reached where individual aircraft (presumes scale models but could use counters) then are placed on a table for tactical play. Most of the rules are concerned with expanding the dogfight game to a multi-day campaign using maps but some are for expanding the play on a table with aircraft to include bombing, AA fire, ground attack and balloon-busting.

11 pages of rules cover squadron types and sizes, pilot experience, wounds, campaign points, heavy bomber campaigns, navigation (optional), map movement, visibility, AA, bombs, ground attack, balloon-busting, replacements and repairs, weather (optional).

Rest of the booklet consists of 24 pages of aircraft charts (one aircraft per page), several sheets for orders, templates for a movement protractor, a wind indicator and counters.

Two map sheets are loose in the centre - one small map with a simplified (made-up) version of the Western Front and a larger one with SE England and Western Germany on opposing sides.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Wimmelspiel
description:
There are two cards face up at the same time, the players look for a certain object on them and then have to decide in a flash whether they see the object on one, two or no card at all.

Who is the quickest to discover the hidden things?

If a player is correct he gets one card. The other cards are discarded.

The first player to collect three cards wins.
—description from the designer

name: Cruxy
description: Cruxy is a stimulating, exciting party game for young and old from 7 years. Game sense: from letters and syllables to form words to any word formations, in which as many words intersect. The winner is the one who has built its field with the most words and cross words at the end.

name: Glow in the Darkness
description:
Ogleis is a dying planet whose surface is covered with a thick layer of ice, in the subsoil remains an extremely hostile biome immersed in the darkness or survival is pushed back into these last entrenches. This planet has only a rare source of energy the phospho-substance and one resource: the mutagen which is the main nutrient and a powerful vector of mutations.

Glow in the darkness is a game halfway between the wargame card driven and the 4x, it's also a semi-cooperative horror game. Players start the game with 12 units, 3 source cities and 7 action cards. Dynamic gameplay: during its turn of play the player makes 2 actions chosen from a variable choice of programmed action

Players embody evolved alien entities whose race is on the verge of extinction. Each player leads one of the 4 alien factions that try to guarantee their survival by plundering the genetic material (material token) of the opposing factions. The first player to acquire 4 material tokens wins the game. At the beginning of the game, the abilities of each faction are symmetrical (which also makes it easier to understand the game). Each player develops his own faction's abilities during the game based on his strategy of adapting and his playing affinities, the game then takes on a highly asymmetrical twist.

Players must conquer energy Source-cities, manage their energetic and opposing networks in order to increase their power. Players must also move their units carefully to guard against hostile reactions from the fauna and flora.

Glow in the darkness has mechanisms and a unique gameplay including:
- a common semi-hidden deckbuilding for the improvement of factions
- a common action system with semi-hidden orders (which favors manipulation between players)
- a controlled "action anomaly"promoting bold strategies
- the morphe system for the specialization of faction capabilities
- a sequential combat resolution system
- a biome with an autonomous and interactive evolution, including a mechanism of procedural generation associated with a comparative and adaptive mechanism of fauna and flora.
- major evolution of the scary game (based on recent scientific studies concerning: fear)
- the original and subtle management of resources through the construction of energy networks

A game for 2-4 players 14+ years old. Category: intermediate - expert
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Wir wandern durch Hessen
description:
One complete game consists of two game rounds. The first round is a hiking tour played with 1 die, the second a bicycle tour with 2 dice. Each player starts with a score of 10 points. On the hiking tour the players have to draw an event card if they get on a "DJH" space. If a player rolls a 1, one point is deducted from his score. On the bicycle tour an event card is drawn after each roll and a point is deducted by the roll of a double.

The first player to finish the bicycle tour gets a Bonus of 5 points, the second player gets 3 points. The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: That's How We Do It!
description:
In That's How We Do It! players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably! If you draw an Always card you will do the wacky thing on your card every time it's your turn. A Whenever card directs you to do what the card says whenever another player does something specific. One wacky thing definitely leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

SET UP

3 players randomly choose a prop card
Shuffle the action cards and put them facedown in a pile within reach of all players
Decide how many rounds to play. With 4-5 players, 8 rounds are recommended. With more players, less rounds. With less players, more rounds. When every player has picked an action card that is one round.


PLAY

On your turn, draw an action card from the top of the deck and place it face up in front of you. Each time you draw an action card, add it to the row of action cards in front of you.
Read the action card aloud to all the players very carefully. Each card has a point value 1-12 based on the zaniness of the action.
There are two types of action cards:
Always-if you draw an always card, do the zany thing immediately. Then repeat that zany thing every time it's your turn.
Whenever-if you draw a whenever card, do nothing right now. However read the card carefully because you will need to do whatever zany thing is on the card whenever another player does a specific zany thing.




Don't forget to read the Prop Cards and pass them around throughout the game. There are 3 different prop cards:
Funny Glasses-when you have this card, wear the glasses until someone stands for any reason. Then pretend you're a teacher and say something really smart. Then pass the glasses and card to the player on your left.
Microphone-when you have this card, hold the microphone until someone sings. Then sing into the microphone along with them. When you're done singing, pass the Microphone and Card to the person on your left.
Engagement Ring-when you have this card, wear the ring until someone kisses anything. Then run over, get down on one knee, and give the kisser the ring.




Once during the game, each player can pick one of his or her action cards and give to another player. But remember that in addition to giving that player something really zany to do, you are also givin g him or her points. And that might cause you to lose the game.
It's ok to remind players if they forget to do one of the things on the action cards in front of them. After all, the whole point of the game is to see everyone act really silly!


WINNING

After the agreed upon number of rounds, players add up the points on the action cards. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Batalha espacial
description:
2 Naves are disputing the dominion of the space and for this they will have to face a Battle in the space.
The game consists of scrolling data and choosing values to rotate the central disc of the Game Board and with this you get benefits that can be: Ammunition (Red World), Fuel (Blue World) and Trading (White World). You can also shoot shots at the opposing ship and avoid space area with asteroids.
The first player to deal 3 damage to the opposing ship will be the winner, with 1 damage occurring when the ship takes 3 shots.
To make the Game, you will use 1 Butter Cover / Margarine that will be the central disc of the Game Board.
Who will be the winner in this dispute?

2 Naves estão disputando o dominio do espaço e para isso terão que enfrentar uma Batalha no espaço.
O jogo consiste na rolagem de dados e escolha de valores para girar o disco central do Tabuleiro de Jogo e com isso conseguir benefícios que pode ser: Munição (Mundo vermelho), Combustível (Mundo azul) e Negociação (Mundo branco). Poderá também dar tiros na Nave adversária e evitar Área do espaço com Asteroides.
O primeiro jogador a causar 3 danos na Nave adversária será o vencedor, sendo que 1 dano ocorre quando a nave leva 3 Tiros.
Para fazer o Jogo, será utilizado 1 Tampa da Manteiga/Margarina que será o disco central do Tabuleiro do Jogo.
Quem será o vencedor nesta disputa ?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grundlovsspillet
description:
A quiz game about the Danish constitution.
There are five categories:

Folketinget,
Regeringen/Kongehuset,
Domstolene,
Frihedsrettighederne,
Dannebrog.


The game was mainly developed for use in education.

name: Tough Luck
description:
A fun, fast-paced combination of strategy and luck for great times with family and friends! You may think you have the upper hand until it happens… Tough Luck! This card game is sure to bring fun to any gathering! For 2 to 4 players or buy 2 decks for up to 8 players!

Object of the Game: Be the first to play all of the cards in your hand and in front of you!

Game Setup: Choose how many players you have and deal the cards according to the directions below.

2 Players: The dealer deals both players 29 cards. Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 8 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just placed face down.

3 Players: The dealer deals all players 19 cards. (Discard any one card.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 6 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

4 Players: The dealer deals all players 14 cards. (Discard any two cards.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 4 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

5 Players: The dealer deals all players 23 cards. (Discard any one card.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 8 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

6 Players: The dealer deals all players 19 cards. (Discard any two cards.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 6 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down .Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

7 Players: The dealer deals all players 16 cards. (Discard any four cards.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 5 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

8 Players: The dealer deals all players 14 cards. (Discard any four cards.) Without looking at your cards (or letting the other players look at them) pick 4 cards out of your hand and place them in front of you face down. Place one card face up on each of the cards you just place face down.

HOW TO PLAY:

First… some simple rules:

Only after a player plays all of the cards in their hand can they play the cards that are face up in front of them on the table.

And…

Only after a player plays all of the cards that are face up in front of them on the table can they play the cards that are faced down on the table. You flip over and play these cards one at a time (no peeking at the other cards!) — Keep these ‘faced-down’ cards face-down until all cards in your hand and the cards facing up in front of you are gone.
In a 2 player game if you flip over a REVERSE card, flip over and play another card… If the card you played after the REVERSE has a lower value the the card played previous to the REVERSE card… “Tough Luck”! You get to pick up all of the cards in the ‘played pile’. If you play a higher value car it is the other players turn.

The first player puts a low-value card from their hand (or any card value they choose) on the table face up on the ‘played pile’. (2 is the lowest value and 12 is the highest value card.)The next player places a card down from their hand that has an equal or higher value than the card previously played on the played pile.

If a player has more than one of the same card they can play as many of those same valued cards during his turn.
Example: If a player has two “5” cards in his hand, they can play both of the cards if they want to at the same time.
When 4 cards of the same value are played consecutively in turn those 4 cards and all cards in the played pile are no longer played in the game and go into the discard pile.
If the next player cannot play an equal or higher valued card onto the played pile from their hand, that player picks up all of the played cards on the played pile and adds them to their hand.
The player that picks up all of the cards from the played pile has “Tough Luck™”! They must play the cards in their hand before they can go back and play from the cards in front of them.

End of Game: The first player that runs of out cards wins the game.

It is possible that your last card may be a RESTART — Play it and win the game, a RESET — Play it and win the game or a REVERSE — Play it and win the game!

Special Play Cards:

REVERSE: The REVERSE cards reverses the play of the game (counter-clockwise to clockwise, etc). If a player plays a REVERSE card the next player has to match or beat the card they just played. If you play a REVERSE card your turn is finished. In a 2-Player game if you play a REVERSE card you get to go again.

RESET: The RESET cards clears the pile of cards that everyone is playing on. These cards are no longer used in the game and go into a discard pile. If you play a RESET card your turn is finished.

RESTART: The RESTART cards resets the deck to whatever value card the player chooses. The player plays the RESTART card and then can play whatever card they want to from their hand.

Game Play Variation:Try playing with less cards in front of you and more cards in your hand or vice-a-versa to add a different challenge!

name: Imperial Century
description:
1815, the world has never been so small. The gears of the Industrial Era are shaping the old English Kingdom into an Empire so big that the sun is always shining on it.

The tempting wealth of the colonies represent a golden opportunity for you to increase your status but if you really want to be ambitious, you must dare to manipulate the political scenario and get the best advantages, otherwise you’ll learn a bitter lesson: one plot is worth more than a million pounds!

Contenders will build ships to reach distant places like Canada, Australia and India. They will establish colonial houses and bring their workers in order to grow in power and wealth. This power assumes the form of influence towards the crown and it is the crown that can best serve all player’s interests.

During three rounds, players will select actions to perform both in England and in the colonies. It is a very demanding scenario, divided in two, with all players splitting their attention and trying to be as sharp and efficient as a context like this obliges.

You’ll need influence to perform actions in England but, to get this influence, money needs to be spent in the colonies. Invest wise, collect more!

Money and status quo combined represent the wealth hold by each player and, in the end of the game, the wealthiest player will be called victorious.

—description from the publisher

name: Isabel
description:
Isabel is a two-player game portraying the War of Castilian Succession (1475-1479). The death of King Enrique IV in 1474 created a domestic crisis in the Kingdom of Castile. The two contenders for the throne were Isabel, Enrique’s half-sister, and Juana, the 13-year-old daughter of the late monarch. Both women counted with powerful allies in their fight for the throne: in 1469 Isabel’s had wed Fernando, heir to the Crown of Aragon, and Juana married King Alfonso V of Portugal during the early stages of the war. In Isabel, the players assume the role of Isabel and Juana and their respective allies as they compete to garnish domestic and international support for their cause. The players face a multifaceted conflict fought as much in the arenas of Spain and the African coast as in the undecided hearts of the Castilian nobility and population at large.

Over four rounds, the players compete by maneuvering troops on the Iberian Peninsula and the Atlantic coast, and by gaining the alliance of various noble houses, public opinion, and international powers. Isabel incorporates streamlined mechanics that are attentive to the historical circumstances of the conflict. Every turn, players face multiple strategic choices which, taken secretly, require tactical reconsideration made in reaction to the opponent’s chosen actions. Isabel forces the players to constantly consider the risk-reward of their choices. With a limited amount of available resources, players have to decide when to sacrifice assets to obtain substantial one-time benefits.
 
—description from the designer
categories: Civil War, Medieval, Political, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation, Tug of War

name: Gears of Glory
description:
Gears of Glory is a game about a group of adventurers racing their automobiles, those incredible new inventions that go faster than a horse and carriage.

To prove their worth, both drivers and their vehicles need to survive the grueling route across mountains, lakes, forests and villages. They will face fuel shortages, overheating motors and exhaustion.

In each turn of the game, a player has two actions and may spend their all-purpose racing cards to move, explore, repair, refuel, or even push, if they must. They must visit villages to refuel, climb mountains to gain fame and reach checkpoints in their quest for glory!

The game ends when one player reaches the final checkpoint, at which point, the other players have a limited number of turns to also reach it. The player who finished first is not necessarily the winner, as players collect fame points through various feats, including reaching the most mountaintops or visiting the most map tiles.

The game contains 8 double-sided modular map tiles, 110 cards, 4 custom-shaped wooden cars and fuel tokens, several player boards and bonus tiles, among other components.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: La Bataille Electorale
description:
La Bataille Electorale ("The Electorale Battle") is a game about an election in the Canadian province of Québec circa 1977 during the rise of separatism. It was independently produced and distributed, made in limited numbers and sold only in Québec. Played on a stylized map of the province with historically named but hypothetical electoral ridings, two to five players battle for votes to get elected in the 100 districts and win the opportunity to form the government.

Players roll dice and move their token on the game track, which can direct them to place their markers (50 apiece) in ridings or get game cards (like “Imponderables”) to effect the game.
Made when the Parti Québécois was coming to power, 1977 was an exciting and contentious year in Canadian politics. To simulate this, the players represent five different hypothetical political parties that are based on their historical counterparts:


Parti de l’Unite Nationale (based on the Union Nationale)
Ralliement Social-National (based on the Ralliement National)
Rassemblement des Travailleurs Quebecois (based on the Rassemblement pour l’Independance Nationale)
Parti de la Souverainete Quebecoise (based on the Parti Quebecois)
Action Federale (based on the Liberal Party of Quebec)


—user summary

name: Die Schlacht bei Leipzig
description:
This 19th-Century game may be the earliest ever based on a specific Napoleonic battle, with the board showing a fairly detailed map of the area around the city. (While undated, it probably pre-dates Parker Bros. 1895 Waterloo.)

The game is for 2 - 7 players, each of whom plays the role of one of the Coalition commanders advancing on Napoleon's central position: Blucher or von Bulow for the Prussians, von Schwartzenberg or von Klenau for the Austrians, Benningsen or Prinz Eugen for the Russians, or Karl Johann Bernadotte of Sweden.

Each player has a unique track toward Leipzig as well as an illustrated player card with a biography on the front and rules governing each of the red-colored points along that player's track. Each turn, a player throws three D6, and if the result is 9 or higher, advances his piece one space. Each red space has an additional requirement that can lead to penalties or bonuses. Each track also has a battle to be won along the way (with the map noting the defending French commander). Moving past the battle requires a roll of 10 or higher on 2D6.

Players put 6 marks in the pot to start, and may lose or win money from the pot along the way. The first player to reach Leipzig (space 14) wins whatever pot remains.

name: Wrath of Kings: House Nasier – Izari Warhounds
description:
It would seem that dogs would be quite out of place amongst the technomantic and steam-fueled horrors commonplace on the battlefields of Arikania, but through long research and dedicated training, the armies of House Nasier do just that. Some of the war masks of the Nasier allow for limited yet powerful telepathic communication, and it is through these masks that the masters are able to bond with the hounds and help them through the binding with their elemental masks, creating a wonderful blend of intelligence, stability, superior senses, and predatory ability.

Wrath of Kings: Izari Warhounds includes two characters and bases and a unit card for use with the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Frontiers
description:
A chess variant with four armies advancing into the board from four directions, but with adjacent pairs of armies allied. Thus White has a so-called "round front" and a "square front", advancing north and west respectively, while Black has a "round front" and a "square front" advancing south and east.

All four armies take turns to play, so each player on their turn first makes a move with one of their square-front pieces, then with one of their round-front pieces.

The object of the game is to capture both enemy kings. When one king is captured, the other pieces of the corresponding army disappear, so the player can play on but with only half their pieces.

From 2007 through 2010 the game was promoted through a website at playfrontiers.com.

name: Boogeynoris Wine
description:
Boogeynoris Wine is a game of chance and light management of resources and actions where you will have to challenge a series of characters in the ability to endure drinking wine. Some characters who shield the Boogeynoris, a man who came from the United States to Spain with the intention of governing the entire wine business. Luck is in ... a 30 side die.

To win in Boogeynoris Wine, in order of turn, each player will show a card from the deck and will have to show that he has more endurance in the challenge of wine through luck in the 30-sided die, which will determine according to luck if win the challenge, draw or lose, and this will cause some consequences with regard to obtaining resources or losing them, win an extra turn, reverse the direction of the turn, earn an extra bonus of punctuation ...

In the end, whoever gets 2 bottle of wine resources and 2 resources of grape clusters, will convert his figure of meeple by the purple meeple, which will award him the winner of Boogeynoris Wine.


Boogeynoris Wine es un juego de azar y gestión ligera de recursos y acciones donde habrá que retar a una serie de personajes en la capacidad de aguante bebiendo vino. Unos personajes que escudan al Boogeynoris, un señor que llegó de Estados Unidos a España con ánimo de gobernar todo el negocio del vino. La suerte está en... un dado de 30 caras.Para ganar en Boogeynoris Wine, por orden de turno, cada jugador irá mostrando una carta del mazo y tendrá que demostrar que tiene más aguante en el reto de vino a través de la suerte en el dado de 30 caras, lo cual determinará según suerte si gana el reto, empata o pierde, y esto provocará unas consecuencias respecto a la obtención de recursos o pérdida de los mismos, ganar un turno extra, invertir el sentido del turno, ganar un bonus extra de puntuación...

Al final, el que consiga obtener 2 recursos de botella de vino y 2 recursos de racimos de uva, convertirá su figura de meeple por el meeple de color morado, el cual, le otorgará ser el ganador de Boogeynoris Wine.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Lab Partners
description:
Lab Partners is a dice & card game for 20-30 minutes of silly, sciencey fun for 2-5 players, ages 12+. Combining card drafting with a splash of risk-taking, Lab Partners adds an element of tension as each roll of the dice could result in a brand new invention or the destruction of your entire experiment.

Players draw chemical cards, combine these into compounds, mix these into solutions to create products, earning them points and special abilities. The first to $1 million in funding wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: World's End
description:
World's End is an apocalyptic horror survival BOARD GAME where deceiving your teammates may either save your life or be the end of you.

Players will be forced to work WITH, and AGAINST each other
to ensure they survive and have the best chance to be the first to the escape helicopter leaving the city.

There are a lot of decisions to make as you try to escape the city. Every choice you make may affect who survives the apocalypse…and who doesn’t.

Helping other players survive is a great way to make friends and may also help you along the way. Be warned: Lying to other players may give you a great advantage, however, it also may come back to bite you; depending on how good other players memories are and whether they desire vengeance!

—description from the designer

name: Redonkulary
description:
Redonkulary® is the hilarious nonsense word game where creativity and persuasion win! This portable game includes 60 spiral-bound word-part cards with over 200,000 possible combinations. Score sheets included. Laughter guaranteed!

Ages: 9-99. Number of Players: 3-8. Play time: 10-45 minutes. MADE IN USA

Redonkulary® is Easy to Play!

One player goes first as the “Donkster” (judge) and invents a word by combining one word part from each of the three randomly chosen cards. The other players then create “definitions” for the made-up word and try to convince the Donkster to pick theirs. The player who persuades the Donkster to choose their definition earns a point. The player with the most points after everyone has had a turn as the Donkster wins! There is no “right” or “wrong” answer—just fun!

Redonkulary® is an original game bound to become a classic!

name: Kalk: The Card Game
description:
Kalk - The Card Game by By Tommy & Jonathan

Fun & educational card game for kids and parents! Time to exercise our brain and reinforce our math skills.

There are 26 cards in total, full of numbers and colors:

0-10 card numbers x 2
One of each magic cards. These are - square, square-root, timer (pauses the opponent for 15 seconds) and scissors (to remove one of the goal numbers).

Deal each player 5 number cards. Deal two cards between the players; this is the goal-number. They use minus, plus, multiply and divide to the get the two-digit goal number. Whoever gets the answer first, wins the game. You can replace two cards but this takes extra time. You can also use the six as a nine.

Unsuccessfully funded on Kickstarter March 2015. However, during the campaign, there was a print and play version available and also a few months after on their official website

name: Speed-Fighters
description:
Speed-Fighters is a motorsports game from Swedish publisher Aristospel.

A traditional roll-and-move dice game in which the players drives four heats of a motorsports contest. The first heat is called Racing, the second Speedway, the third Moto-Cross and the final heat Rally. (English names are of course more or less the same.)

During the four different heats a variety of things may happen - good or bad - depending on what square you're at.

The year 1965 is an approximation given after some correspondence with a relative of the designer and artist.

name: Lunch Swap
description:
Lunch Swap week has been declared! You and your friends gather around the table each day, trade lunches, try avoiding getting the worst lunch each day, while still accomplishing your dessert goals. At the end of the week a Lunch Swap winner is declared!
The game is played over five rounds. On their turn a player plays a single card. Once each player has 5 cards in front of them the game is over. Players then tally their score to determine a winner.

—description from the designer

name: Rund herum: Die lustige Drehscheibe
description: Each player has 6 pawns. The player rolls a die and. As long as he has pawns that are not on the game board, sets a pawn on the space of his color in the inner ring of the turntable. If the space is already occupied, the the first pawn is removed from the game board and has to be placed again. Then he moves the turntable by sticking his finger in the hole of the same number on the outer ring, till his finger is stopped in the indentation of the brown barrier. If one of his pawns lands on a 1 or 2 of his color, by placing the pawn or turning the turntable, the pawn is placed on a destination space. The first player to get all 6 pawns on a destination space wins the game.

name: Attack
description:
Attack is a strategic game very likely related - and very similar too - to famous French game L'Attaque, acquired and sold by Gibsons and nowadays also well known as Stratego by Jumbo. This Swedish version was designed by Count Sigvard Bernadotte (a now deceased uncle of H.M. King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden), and he also did all the artworks. It was published by Swedish Alga during the World War II and the playing pieces is dressed in contemporary bluish grey or light brown uniforms.

It has some differences compared to L'Attaque and Stratego (see its reimplementation Batalj for closer details) but the game play is similar. Place your army the way you wish and the battle commence. Move your pieces and attack the enemy, highest rank wins the many individual skirmishes, with the usual exception of the Spy, who will beat the opposing General. The winner is the player that has managed to either wipe out the opposing force or make the opposer unable to move his/hers pieces further. There is no standard or flag in this game, but both sides has four mines.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Wargame, World War II

name: Infernal Contraption: Frenzy Beam Promo Card
description:
The back of the card specifically says "Infernal Contraption 2nd Edition"

Card text:
"Scrap a card from your parts pile and two cards from your opponent's parts pile."

name: Street Fighter V: Poker Assault
description:
The two-player game Street Fighter V Poker Assault reimagines poker as a game of combat featuring the characters and kinetic action of the hit video game Street Fighter V. Each player uses a themed 52-card poker deck, with several cards in each deck having bonus abilities that can aid them while mounting an assault on an opponent or defending against one. Additionally, players who can craft a straight or better will earn critical arts cards that can provide devastating instant effects or grant them some ongoing tactical advantages.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Master of the Golf rules
description:
Danish quiz game about golf - including the rules for golf.

The board shows a golf course, and there are stacks of questions for fairway, bunkers, green, etc.

name: Color Spiel
description:
In Color Spiel, each turn players roll three special color dice using each one to either claim a color stock card or manipulate a color's score value from a central supply/score track wheel. Each stock card has a color which is always known and a numeric value ranging from 1 to 7 which is often public, but could be claimed secretly. Claiming low value cards grants the player a one-time ability that increases their odds of collecting points. The actual victory point value of each color is determined collectively by all players via trackers on the supply wheel. The values on the wheel rise slowly, crash quickly then cycle back around. The value for each color is tracked independently and is only awarded to the highest shareholders when a supply of stocks runs out. Players attempt to determine which stocks are best to collect, get the highest total of them, and maximize their value at just the right time.

Victory points are only awarded at the end of each each round. After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

Color Spiel was chosen as the winner of the 2017 HABA USA Game Design Contest.

name: Connect with Pieces: The Lone Ranger
description:
The jigsaw puzzle you can play three ways.

In Connect With Pieces, each piece is embossed with one of five special symbols. Match up the symbols to score points! Block your opponent from scoring. Many pieces can fit in more than one place, so the game will always be different. And because the symbols are pressed in, not printed, the final image is never obscured, Which means you can put it together like a regular jigsaw puzzle, too.

The 700-piece puzzle measures 27×20 when complete.

name: Wet Blanket: Soggy Biscuit
description:
The parties just got worse!

This expansion deck to Wet Blanket comes with 54 additional cards that will ensure that no one will ever party ever again! Unless they're at your party of course.

This time you will use your knowledge of people's professions and allergies to make your own party the only one people will ever talk about!

name: Tacticon
description:
A strategy game which aims to be an abstraction of contemporary society in the same way that Chess is an abstraction of feudalism. Each player has ten pieces: a man, woman, and child (people); a wheel, column and bullet (tools); a shield; and three pragmas. People and pragmas cannot attack people, and the child cannot attack tools. Shields cannot be attacked at all except from behind.

The object of the game is to score points by attacking the opponent's people and pragmas, or by occupying special spots on the board known as "origons". The game ends immediately if one player occupies all four origons, or if one player has lost two of their three people. Otherwise the game continues until a predetermined score is reached.

—user summary

name: Contract Conquest
description:
Summary:
In Contract Conquest, you take the role of a wealthy real estate mogul who has decided to build a tower. Unfortunately for you, you are not the only one building towers, and other real estate moguls will do everything in their power to stop you. Can you battle the odds, the elements, and worst of all, the other players to come out on top with the tallest tower?

Game play:
Contract Conquest is a card based tower building game for 2 or more players which can take as little as 30 minutes and can be expanded on to increase the play time up to 2 hours. Players take turns building rooms in their tower, while playing cards to decimate their opponent's tower and improve their own. All players have to watch out for the disaster cards which can be devastating to all players.

Goal:
Be the player with the most Construction Points (CP) when any player completes the top floor of their tower.

—description from the publisher

name: Malifaux: Snow Storm
description:
At the time of the Event, the Tyrant December made a desperate gamble to take control of His Vessel, Rasputina. This attempt failed when she redirected His power to one of the Silent Ones, a woman named Snow. The Tyrant's power manifested in the form of a massive wendigo bound to Snow, which later was named Storm.

At first, the relationship between the two was fractured and hostile. Neither the wendigo nor the Silent One wanted this symbiotic relationship, but Fate is rarely inclined to offer a true choice. As time has moved on, they have developed a respect for each other, moving from animosity to the kinship of pack siblings.

They no longer interact much with the Cult, preferring their own company. While they answer to Rasputina, it is a strained relationship compared to the rest of the Silent Ones. Storm's nature has driven Snow more towards independence, and she is more willful as a result. For now, the two are joined with the Cult's cause.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Beacon of Knowledge – Sandeep Box Set
description:
Sandeep Desai was born in Guild-occupied India. He was one of the many orphans of his city, and he was taken in and raised by a temple. He devoured books on the arcane and soon proved to be a powerful user of magic in his own right, but his peaceful life of learning came to a violent halt the day that the Guild arrested his master for undermining their authority. Sandeep took up his Master’s cursed Gada that day and unleashed the fury of Banasuva for the first time.

Sandeep was personally asked to come to Malifaux by Viktor Ramos in order to help train a new generation of Arcanists in the ways of magic. He holds his classes in secret, instilling in his students a respect for the arcane which he wishes he had on that fateful day back in India. He is an excellent teacher, and Ramos has been pleased with the progress of his students.

The locations of his classes frequently move, staying one step ahead of the Guild. In quiet moments of reflection and meditation, Sandeep often regrets the need for violence and wishes for a peaceful, quiet environment where his students could grow and prosper. He knows the tyranny and cruelty of the Guild all too well, and constant vigilance prevents him from dwelling on his own dark past.

Sandeep’s box set contains six models, including Sandeep himself. Kudra, Sandeep’s loyal student, is his right-hand-woman, and she defends her teacher with arcane skill and physical prowess. Sandeep can summon his Totem, Banasuva, to present a large, flaming threat for his opponent. Finally, the Poison Gamin are versatile Minions which Sandeep is also capable of summoning.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Matemaatika on lihtne
description:
Math is simple.

Educational board game to learn mathematics.
10x10 grid game board has numbers 1-100. Roll the dice with "+" and "-" or other mathematical symbols and move forward or backward accordingly. Who reaches on square "100" first is the winner.

name: Einmal haut's hin
description:
2 or 4 players play the soccer game. All other players are betting on the outcome of the game, using the Toto-slip.

The pawns are placed on the spaces marked with an "A". Movement is only forward and is determined by the roll of a die. No pawn may land on a red space. A goal is achieved by entering the opposite goal with a pawn. If a pawn gets on a space that is occupied by an opposite pawn, the opposite pawn is taken from the board. It may reenter the game on an "A"-space by the roll of a 6. If a 6 isn't used to bring back a pawn, it can be used to move a pawn and roll again.

The game ends, when there is no pawn left on the playing field. The team with the most pawns in the opposite goal wins the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reise durch die Alpen
description:
The players start at München. Movement is determined by one or two dice. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to arrive at space 102 (Rheinfall) wins the game.

The game was published about 1912.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue
description:
1. Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue
Each player gets 10 game token and a car to place on the starting-space. A quiz-card is placed on each grey space and a event-card on each red space. The movement of the cars is determined by a die. If a car lands on a pace neighbouring an event-card, the player has to follow the instructions printed on the card. If a car lands on a space besides a quiz-card the player has to answer the question on the card. If the answer is correct, he collects the card. All used cards are imediatly replaced by new ones.

The first player to reach the finish space receives 6 game token, the second gets 3 token. The game ends, when the second player reaches the finsh. All token and quiz-cards count for 1 point each. The player with the most points wins the game.

2. Quiz-Karussell (backside of the game board)

a) 6er-Karussell: The quiz master takes 40 quiz-cards and 10 event-cards from the deck and places 1 card on each colored space. The player rolls a die and has to answer the question on the quiz-card or follow the instruction on the event-card beside the rolled number. The player may chose betweent two permissible cards because there are two spaces for each number. The game ends, when all 50 cards have been used. Points are awarded for token and collected quiz-cards same as in the game "Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue"

b) 12er-Karussell: In this game the player rolls a die (1-6) and can't chose between two cards. If he don't knows the answer to a quiz-card he has to pay a token and roll a second time. The second result is added to the first one to determine a second card. If he can't answer the question on the second card, there is no penality involved and his turn ends.

Many of the quiz- and event-cards are traffic related.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sverige-loppet
description:
Sverige-loppet is a bicycle racing game played in segments (or heats) from Haparanda in northern Sweden to Ystad in the south, via Stockholm and Huskvarna and a few other places. There is also penalty rounds in the form of diversions. During the race things will happen, and they are delivered in rhymes. Winner is calculated on somewhat complicated mathematical grounds. It must be considered modern for its age.

The game actually has a real life original race as inspiration, from which it also borrowed its name, Sverigeloppet. (Note that Aristospel calls the game Sverige-loppet (with an hyphen) while in real life (see Community Wiki section) the name was Sverigeloppet (in one word). Both means "The Sweden Race".
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Bland Blommor och Blad
description:
Bland Blommor och Blad ("Among Flowers and Leafs") is an educational game that via dice rolls and set collecting intends to teach the latin names of domestic Swedish flowers. Collecting flowers and learning their names was a compulsory school subject (and considered very important) on the national curriculum in Sweden up to about the 1960's.

This fact, and also that the name of the artist - I-L Biltman - appears on the box makes it fairly safe to date the game to about 1955.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pussla i kapp
description:
Pussla i kapp ("Jigsaw Puzzle Contest") is a very simple game from Swedish publisher Aristospel, but the idea was probably not theirs originally. The idea is to be first to complete your puzzle. There is four different motifs to choose from.

From the simple components (only paper) and some of the puzzle motifs and the make of the Aristospel logotype it is safe to assume that this is a war era game.

The persons on the lid might very well be real life persons, but they have not been identified.

name: Silhouette: Das Würfel
description:
Another branch in the Silhouette-Family of Games. This time the cards are substituted with dice, which shows different silhouettes on their faces.
Six Variants to play with them. Common denominator is that you try to come up with a word that combine sthe images of two dice thrown.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Real-time

name: Auktionsspelet
description:
Auktionsspelet ("The Auction Game") from Swedish publisher Aristospel is a WWII era game in which the players is given some money and then participates in an auction.

The winner is the player with the most numbers of complete sets of bought items. The auction items is a deck of cards. The game also includes rules, money and a small, very handsome, auctioneer's gavel. All in a small box, that together with the old Aristospel logotype and the absence of expensive or complicated components, makes it fairly easy to date the game to the war years.

Designer and artist is, sadly, not known.

name: Saxtorpsloppet
description:
Saxtorpsloppet ("The Saxtorp Race") is a motorcycle racing and betting game from Swedish publisher Alga. It is one of Alga's first games ever.

It has an unusual mechanic since one person handles all six motorcycles and an infinite number of participants can take part and place bets. (It is also possible to be only sex players, each with one motorcycle and in that case it is a normal racing game.)

The game consists of six small wooden motorcycles (with drivers), each mounted on a small sheet of carton, some playing card-size pieces to lay out as the track, and the rules. The track pieces have numbers on both sides, 1 to 6 in different random orders.

When playing the track pieces is laid out in a straight fashion in a random order (which makes the number of possible tracks very high) and one playing piece (motorcycle) is choosen to start. That piece will, when placed on the side of the first track piece, point towards one of the sex numbers (digits) and that motorcycle is then moved along the first. Now the second motorcycle will point towards a number, and so a third motorcycle is moved forward (pointing to a number). And so it goes on.

Eventually one of the already moved motorcycles will be moved a track piece ahead and point to another number on that track piece. In a few moves' time all six motorcycles will be engaged in the race, "promoting" another (or ocassionally itself) to further pieces on the track. Winner is the playing piece (motorcycle) that reaches the last track piece first. The track pieces are double-sided so the race takes place along 24 track sections.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Enclose
description: Enclose is played on a 19by19 toroidal Go board with Go stones. If a player encloses an area with their stones they capture all the enemy stones in that area. Players may not place their stones onto intersections on area that is enclosed by their opponent. In order for a stone formation to enclose area, the stone formation must be able to have imagined a string with the shape of a polygon connecting the centers of all of its stones so that each center is connected by the string to exactly two other centers of adjacent enclosing formation stones, and that string must divide the toroid into exactly two regions so that it is not possible to move from one region to the other without going through the string. Of these two regions of the toroid that are divided by the string, the one that is enclosed is the one which has a combined value of the measures of the angles of its side (its side being at all points adjacent to the string), that is smaller than that of the other region. Players may pass their turn without placing a stone, if both players pass this way consecutively, the game ends, and the winner is the player who has the most empty intersections enclosed.

name: Håndboldquiz
description: A quiz game about handball.

name: I'll Take the Case
description:
In I'll Take the Case you are an attorney and take cards into your hand trying to gather clients, evidence, witnesses and paperwork to solve cases available to all players at the table. The more difficult the case you solve, the more reputation you gain. When all the cases are solved, the attorney with the highest reputation wins!

Each card in the player's hands has law related trivia or facts based relevant to Bar Exam questions. Great as a learning-break for law students or kids interested in the law.

Players are given a starting hand and a selection of cases are available on the table for anyone to solve. By taking a single action during rotating turns, players either take a card, perform an action card, or solve a case. With a hand limit, and ability to take cards from the discard, there is strategy in what card you may or may not want to discard.

Cases require a mix of evidence, paperwork and witness cards to solve. Collect the correct mix in your hand and you can solve the case and gain the reputation. When all the cases are solved, the player with the most reputation wins!

-description from designer

name: It's a Struggle
description:
Be the last one in the game with this ever changing game of colors. As you give and take colors be careful not too collect to many or you are out of the game.

—description from the designer

name: The Human Experiment
description:
The Human Experiment is a strategic card drafting game for 4-8 players in which a deadly extraterrestrial virus has invaded earth threatening to end all human life as we know it. Players take on the role of scientists working in an underground biosafety level 4 laboratory desperately trying to create a cure in this hidden team vs team game of social deduction.

A select number of players will be playing as Hosts, vessels for the virus, who are secretly trying to sabotage the mission and facilitate the spread of the virus on earth. The human players must use wits and cunning in order to deduce who is a Host and who they can trust before it is too late.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: What's Cooking?
description: A dexterity game where you balance your frying pan on top of your 'grill' and then try to complete recipes by scooping food items into your pan without toppling it.

name: S&G Dungeon
description:
In 2009, Avalon Games released it first Mini-Game, Graveyard Dash, and since then we have released a new Mini-Game every month. Mini-Games can be anything—a simple dice game, card game, or print-to-play board game. Avalon has always published these simple but fun games to explorer different types of games and genre, often allowing us, the game designers, the opportunity to develop a game without the hassle of dealing with a full-blown game of complicated rules and components.

This month, Avalon is releasing our 200th Mini-Game and, as a reward for all the loyal fans, we are offering it for free.

S&G Dungeon is a simple but fun game of dungeon exploration. Using the powerful S&G game engine, you can play several heroes as they delve into a dungeon full of danger and rewards.

Full expandable, and every few months this year we will offer new dungeon to explore and new heroes to play.

So, gather up your gear, get your sword and a few fools…um, friends, and go explore a dangerous hole in the ground.

User Extras:

This consists of three PDFs, the main, 68 page rulebook, the 38 page Book of Monsters and a sample adventure, Goblin Tower.

Inside Book:

Steel & Glory Dungeon is an expansion to the S&G system, allowing you to, as a group or through solo play, run through a random dungeon-like adventure. This RPG-light add-on to the system allows for you to advance your characters to higher levels and thus experience more dangerous adventures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaukopartio
description:
Kaukopartio is a competitive 2-4 player game based on the war between the Finns and the Soviets in World War 2.

In this game, the players control their Finnish squad in the Soviet territory. The game objective is to complete five missions (sabotage, capture a prisoner etc).

The players have to gather squad members and look for equipment. Each soldier has their individual skills. The skills and the equipment help to accomplish the specific missions. Missions are accomplished with dice.

During the search of the resources the players may confront random Soviet units. The enemy units force the players to do a diversion before they can continue their objectives.

The game ends when one of the players completes five missions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Synopsis
description: A storytelling party game that encourages creative writing, inside jokes and laughter. Each player starts with a blank game sheet. Everyone completes the first starter sentence and folds over the top section to hide their response. Once all players have finished the game sheets are passed to the left. Once all sections have been completed, players take it in turns to read their unique story. There are no winners or losers. It's a fun game anyone can play.

name: From The Sea
description:
From The Sea is a pirate themed board game for 2 to 5 players set at the very end of the Golden Age of Piracy in the first quarter of the 18th century. You take on the role of some of the most famous pirates in history, Bartholomew “Black Bart” Roberts, Henry Avery, Anne Bonney, and of course Edward “Blackbeard” Teach to name a few. Recruit your crew, take down merchant ships and their escorts, sell your plunder, build your fleet, and survive the British Navy as they attempt to exterminate the free brotherhood of pirates.

Act I Recruit Your Crew
Recruit a hearty crew of hardened sailors to help you become the greatest pirate in history. Be careful though, each crew member will have a specialty, gunnery, navigation, and morale. You’ll need their help to succeed, and when you take more ships, they are the ones you’ll depend on to captain them.
You’ll need to keep your crew active to prevent a mutiny while you build your strength, and your fleet. Capture merchant ships or use your wealth to purchase ships and add them to your fleet or capture and sell cargo to keep them busy. Too long idle at sea and they’ll mutiny!

Act II Build Your Fleet
You can build your fleet by building your wealth and purchasing new ships, or the tried and true Pirate way, take them. You’ll need a strong fleet to fend of the Navy. You can have up to three ships under your control that you can send on missions to sell your goods, capture ships, visits ports to find treasure, or harass your enemies. You can even send them in search of a Letter Of Marque, just in case you want to hedge your bets and maybe switch sides when convenient of course.

Act III Survive The British Navy
As the sun sets on the Golden Age of Piracy, the British Navy comes to exterminate the pirate scourge. Are you and your band of fellow pirates enough to fight them off? Who will be the last pirate standing? Did you uncover the Letter Of Marque and will you switch sides and fight for the Crown at the very end to save your skin? The game concludes with an epic battle to see who will survive to the end!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: BTS: Bid,Trade,Sell – Ancient Weapons
description:
BTS is a Buy & Sell Item Game where each player will have an opportunity to auction and bid a chest with an item inside that you can sell. Some items can be sold on a higher price and some items are hoax and can be sold less than the biding prize. The goal is to be the player with the highest profit.

Features:

Play with 3 to 4 of your friends
Have Fun reading each players face, actions, and words.
Use your own techniques in Auctioning the chest.
Test you luck when you have to draw a luck card
Collect more Gold!!!!


—description from the designer

name: Haoz
description:
An abstract strategy game played on an octagonal board (10x10 squares with corners removed). The object of the game is to capture the opponent's four Vital Element pieces.

Each player starts with four different Vital Element pieces (circle, triangle, rectangle, square) on their back rank and six identical Warrior pieces on their second rank. On their turn each player moves one of their Warriors one square, or one of their Vital Elements up to two squares. They can capture an opposing piece by landing on its square, although a Vital Element cannot capture an opposing Vital Element unless it is the same shape.

When a player captures a Vital Element they may make a special bonus move, such as teleporting a piece across the board or resurrecting a captured Warrior, according to what shape of Element was captured. If a player captures all four opposing Vital Elements they win the game.

name: Sustainable development geek
description:
Sustainable development geek is a trivia/debate game based on questions about the United Nations sustainable development goals (SDGs). Question cards are associated with one of the 17 SDGs and provide 2 possible answers (A/B). The correct answer is listed on the back of the card with an explanation.

Two game modes are available:

Achieve them all (2-4 players)
The great debate (5-10 players)


Two additional "animation" modes are described:

General assembly (10-70 people)
Facilitation (any group events)


In the "achieve them all" game mode, each player takes a turn answering as many questions about SDGs as they want. They receive each card they answered correctly, but the card is only saved once the player decides to stop. Whenever a player gives a wrong answer, all is/her unsaved cards are discarded and his/her turn ends. The next player then takes his/her turn. The first player to collect cards for all 17 SDGs wins the game.

In the "great debate" game mode, 2 players (debaters A and B) are picked to argue for 30 seconds in favour of answer A or B. Other players (deciders) then vote on which answer is correct. The debater who got the most votes keeps the card (counts as 1 point). Deciders who found the right answer score 1 point. The game ends after a set number of turns.

—user summary
publishers: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation

name: Up the Boot: Italy 1943-1945
description:
“This campaign is a hard row to hoe. It is the most difficult country in Europe, and yet we always get troops and equipment taken away from us for elsewhere. We have done all the fighting on a very narrow margin of relative strengths.” - Oliver Leese, Commander 8th Army

Up the Boot is an operational simulation of the Italian campaign from the invasion of Sicily to the collapse of German and Fascist Italian forces in 1945. The game uses hexes and division scale units, supported by assets including naval, air, and small elite forces.

One can play the entire campaign or a scenario.

Scenarios include...

The Invasion of Sicily: Kicking in the Door
The Invasion of Italy: The Allied Avalanche
The Volturno Line: The Long Slog Up the Boot
Anzio and Cassino: Breaking the Gustav Line
The Gothic Line: Bloody Stalemate
The Po Valley: Blitzkrieg Comes to Italy

“No amount of artillery fire or aerial bombardment could force them to withdraw. That was for the infantry to do employing those weapons that find and destroy life in narrow trenches, caves, and fighting holes. It was up to the man with the rifle. The man under fire from all weapons. Them whose way all our weapons land, air, and sea serve only to prepare. It was up to the foot soldier to attack a hidden enemy over ground that was sown with mines. The anti-personnel mines that fly up the footfall to explode beneath the groin.” – John Huston, The Battle of San Pietro (1944)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: PORN: The Game! – CENSORED
description:
Porn: The Game! (CENSORED)
COCK-BLOCKED EDITION
This edition of Porn: The Game! gives you all the cards without ANY of the balls.

INCLUDES: The Original Deck & Extreme Drunkard Expansion with Fully Censored-Art

...censorship comes at a price
Nobody likes a Cock-Block

-description from the designer

name: Game-of-6
description:
Game-of-6 is an abstract strategy game for two players that can be played on a grid paper sheet, using pens of two different colors. (it's an evolution of classic Connect6). Rules:
1. The player that opens the game places one dot of his/her color in a cell. In all the following moves, each player places consecutevely two dots in any empty cell of the grid.
2. A player that aligns (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) six (or more) of his/her dots wins the game.
3. Each time a player completes a closed polygonal with his/her marks, all the internal cells take that color. A closed polygonal is any closed path connecting dots of the same color, each adjacent horizontally, vertically or diagonally to next one
4. The grid cells, once colored, are blocked. They cannot change their color even when they are enclosed in a new polygonal of the opposite color and do not take part to any alignment of dots. If a move generates both a closed polygonal and a winning alignment, the latter is prevailing and the game is over.
4.2. A player turn is made of two separate moves: if the first one closes a polygonal, the internal cells must be colored before the second move is performed.
4.3. A player can always enlarge an existing polygonal by adding new dots
5. A player that colors six (or more) cells wins the game. It's not necessary that the six cells are enclosed by the same polygonal: the winning number can be made adding up spatially separated colored cells.
When the game is over, the winner gains six points and the loser one point for each cell he/she was able to color.
A match is composed by six games, to be started alternately by the players. The winner of the match is the player with the most game victories, and in case of a tie, the one who scored the most points.

name: Serial Thriller
description:
The Murder Management Card Game.

A horror-themed world where YOU play as the killers. Bid against your opponents to catch, scare, and kill your victims. Become the most lethal lunatic around!

You start with a killer, a lair, and a 30-card deck filled with various items to catch, scare, and kill your victims. Each player draws 5 cards and turns over 2 victim cards in the center of the table. Each card from the deck has two uses. Either players use their hand to bid on the best victims available to be their target, or they can use them to match a catch, scare, and kill a victim and attempt to end them for good. Each victim has a value of one to five so bid wisely! Already have your two victims? You can spend your money at the creep shop, a deck full of weird item cards and actions to mess with your opponents.

A two-player game can take around 30 minutes, but supports up to five players. The more players in the game, the more victims to bid on. The first player to kill 15-points worth of victims wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Tank Battle
description:
Tank Battle is a two-player game of hypothetical land battle between North Country and South Country, Wargames Research Centre's first game.
Each player commands various units: heavy tank, light tank, armored car, infantry, special force, airborne and artillery. The map includes various terrain: plain, forest, mountain, river and lake. Each player aims at occupying the opponent's capital.

name: Galactic Battle
description:
Galactic Battle is a two-player strategic sci-fi game of space war between Red Planet and Green Planet, Wargames Research Centre's second game.
Each player commands various space fleet to destroy enemy fleet and occupy enemy planet.

name: Kunterbunt
description: Each player has to get his six pawns from his starting positions to the starting positions of his opposite player. The first to do so wins the Game. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a directional die. The possible directions are straight ahead (G), diagonally left ahead (SL) and diagonally right ahead (SR).
