Cesare Borgia. We are in the Renaissance period in Italy. You are a hired hand of Cesare Borgia, the fearsome Commander of the Papal troops, and son of Pope Alexander VI. The Borgia clan gained power due to bribery, murder and intrigue which resulted in a lot of enemies. To keep them under the thumb, more bribery, murder and intrigue is required. All these actions are, of course, performed in the interests of the Holy Church and to protect the salvation of the poor Christian souls.
Religion is not your concern. You’re hired for the money.

Cesare Borgia a board game of skills management and determination for 2-5 players set in the Renaissance period in Italy.

GAME IDEA:
Players try to perform missions in Italy and move therefore from city to city. To perform the missions, players require a mix of different skills: sabotage, theft, assassin and intrigue, represented by colored tokens. Money can be useful to acquire missing skills. Finally, to move, travel tokens are required.

On your turn, you draw 2 tiles out of a bag and place them on the corresponded grid. The purpose is to form series of similar tiles. When this is done, you can exchange the tiles for tokens. With the right tokens, you can move and perform the missions in order to gain victory points (VP).

GAME SET-UP:
Place the game-board in the middle of the table.
Each player gets a player board. Select one randomly or choose one. Make the choice by common agreement. Each player places his player board in front of him.
Each player gets 6 tokens, one in each color. Three tokens are selected and placed on space 1 of the player board. The other three form a reserve and are placed on space 0. Each player takes his Heroic Exploit card which is placed next to the player board.
Each player places the pawn of his color in Rome
Shuffle the Mission cards and pile them in a facedown stack next to the game-board. Draw a first Mission card and place it face-up on Firenze (city n°1). Then, draw a second Mission card and place it on Napoli (city n°2). Draw a 3rd and 4th Mission card and place it respectively on Siena (city n°3) and Ravenna (city n°4).
Put all the tiles in the cloth bag.
Shuffle the Event and Upgrade cards separately and pile them in 2 facedown stacks next to the game-board.
Place the Reference sheet next to the game-board. Keep the tokens and markers in a reserve aside of the game-board.
Select a Start player randomly, which starts playing his turn.

HOW TO PLAY?
Starting with the Start player, each player completes his turn in clockwise order.

A turn consists of:

drawing and placing tiles
scoring lines
exchanging tokens
moving around the map
executing a mission.

You can mix up all these actions and perform them in any order. However, after executing a mission, your turn is immediately finished.

EVENTS:
Some mission cards mention “Event”. After placing a new Mission card, the player at the left of the active player draws an Event card and places it face-up upon an available Mission of his choice. Place the card in this way that all important info remains visible.

Events mostly make the achievement of the missions more difficult by increasing the number of required tokens. Sometimes events yield an extra reward. In this case, keep the card among your fulfilled mission cards as a reminder. Other events are discarded when the corresponding mission is fulfilled.

Some events show the roadblock icon. In this case, place or displace the roadblock marker on a path leading from one city to another. A path with a roadblock marker cannot be used. There is only one roadblock marker which must always be displaced, once it is put in the game. Discard the Event card after placing or displacing the roadblock.

When the stack of Event cards is depleted, shuffle all discarded cards again and form a new Event stack.

END OF THE GAME:
The game is nearly finished when a player has reached or exceeded a certain number of victory points. Finish the ongoing round in order to give each player the same number of playing turns:

Two players: 12 victory points required
Three players: 11 victory points required
Four players: 10 victory points required
Five players: 9 victory points required

The winner of the game is the player who has the most victory points. Occasionally, check the following tie-breakers in descending order: number of fulfilled missions, number of upgrades in hand, number of yellow tokens in stock or number of other tokens in stock.

-description from the publisher's website

name: Stierkampf
description: There are 6 cards, illustrated with a bullfight scene und numbered from 1 to 6, that are used as game boards. Each player has his own card. Each time the number of a card is rolled, the player of this card moves his pawn one space ahead. The first player whose pawn reaches the last space, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die lustigen Frösche
description:
Each player has 3 frogs, he has to get from the starting spaces of their color at the bottom of the game board to the destinations of the same color at the top. Movement is determined with one die.

On the roll of a "1", a frog may advance from it's colored starting space to the firs green space of his race track. From there the frogs advance according to the numbers rolled. If a player rolls a "6" he may roll a second time. If a frog moves over one of the three picture strips the player may roll again, and has to move the same frog a second time.

If a frog lands on the 1st or 3rd picture strip it may only advance again at the roll of a "5". A frog that lands on the 2nd picture strip has to return to the green space at the beginning of its race track.

The first player to get his 3 frogs to his destination spaces wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Graffiti Gammon 2
description:
Graffiti Gammon 2 (グラギャモンにゃん) plays like traditional backgammon, but the game board is designed for easy set-up and playing for those new to the game, with numbers circling both directions on the board to making counting off easier. The player pieces are wooden cat heads, and the idea is that you're moving cats off the edge of the board to catch the fish that await for you.

Each player has a pair of "do over" cards that allow you to roll the dice again. Use them wisely since you have only two!

Publisher's summary
Based on the concept of Graffiti x Backgammon, we have arranged the traditional gammon-board wildly, incorporating some beginner-friendly designs.


Cute cat characters!
Variant rules with additional cards!
Compact package! Foldable fabric game board!
Beginner friendly design with initial setup marks, and distance to the goal (pips)!


With variant rules, you have two reroll cards at the beginning of the game. During your turn, you may spend one to reroll the dice you have just rolled.

GRAFFITI（らくがき）×BACKGAMMON（バックギャモン）をコンセプトに
、伝統的な図案が中心のゲームボードを大胆にアレンジしながら、 初心者にもわかりやすい工夫をプラスしたゲームです。
・かわいい猫のキャラクターが魅力！
・特殊カードを使ったオリジナルルールも追加！！
・コンパクトなパッケージ！ 折りたためる布製ゲーム盤！
・初心者にもわかりやすい初期配置表示、ゴールまでの距離がわかる《ピップ》表示つき！
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crossing the Atlantic
description:
A “ Counter and Dice ” Game for up to Five Players
Each player chooses a coloured counter, as in LUDO, and when he throws the dice moves the counter to the number that turns up. An extra turn is given to the player who throws a six. The first player to reach the end of the journey is, of course, the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Smiggle Dice Stories
description:
Roll the Dice and Create a Story. Similar to Rory's Story Cubes

A great game to keep kids entertained. It now contains 10 story dice, 1 pencil and note pad. Throw the dice and create hilarious stories from the pictures. 150mm x 110mm

name: Whims: A Game of Royal Butt-Kissing
description:
Gameplay revolves around a central play area called “The Kingdom.” At any given time, the kingdom may be filled with rich natural resources ripe for the taking; however, vicious, marauding monsters also roam the kingdom, bringing even more chaos to the tumultuous landscape.

Catch the Eye of the King!

Much to the benefit of the many lords and ladies vying for the throne, a contact within the castle keeps them apprised of the king’s current state-of-mind. This is represented by the yellow “whims” cards. There’s always a whim in play, ensuring that the lords and ladies have a definite goal to accomplish, but King Rolphius, the Jester-King, the Fickle, the Whimsical, is aptly named. The king’s whims change constantly, and the courtiers must be ready to adjust their goals and tactics at a moment’s notice.

While some of the king’s whims are fulfilled by the use of shrewd planning and cunning gameplay, others rely on a distinctly different set of skills...

Gather Your Allies!

Because taking over lands and combating monsters can be dirty, dangerous work, the lords and ladies of the kingdom rely upon their houses’ faithful followers to do their bidding. These “units,” as we call them, are sent forth to bring glory and attention to their lord or lady. Each turn, the lords and ladies draw cards from the player deck in hopes of recruiting the right kind of unit for the job at hand. Since a unit can only interact with other cards of the same color, the lords and ladies must exhibit much cunning when ordering their units about.

Since the turmoil in the kingdom has caused the lords and ladies to become a bit more territorial, it has also become important for the courtiers to carefully guard their lands. That’s why all lords and ladies are wise to assign some of their bold units as guards. You wouldn’t want anyone making off with that nice little piece of forest, would you?

Units, at least those with the mettle to do so, can also venture forth to do battle with the menagerie of prowling monsters that roam the kingdom...

In Whims, units are used for multiple purposes. As the kingdom is explored and new lands appear, enterprising units can claim territory for their lord or lady. If things in the kingdom begin to feel a bit too chummy (or a particular lord or lady feels particularly churlish), units can also be used to attack enemy guards and capture the lands of opposing courtiers.

Send Forth the Hordes!

In Whims, monsters defeated by plucky units are captured and become part of the lord or lady’s “horde.” Each type of monster has a special knack for mischief, and throughout the course of the game, the lords and ladies will send their hordes forth to cause mayhem to inconvenience and hamper their opponents. Much different from standard units, the monsters in a lord or lady’s horde add a new layer of strategy and chaos to the game.

Simple, Engaging Gameplay

We feel that you should spend more time playing a game than referring to a rulebook, so Whims gameplay revolves around simple, intuitive mechanics.

Each turn, a player plays up to two cards from a hand of four. These cards, usually units like peasants, soldiers, and knights, offer several interesting gameplay choices. As mentioned above, players can use their units to capture land from the kingdom, battle monsters, assault enemy units, or capture unguarded land from opponents. Interactions between cards are simply resolved by comparing colors (there are four of them) and numbers.

The game also includes some special units whose abilities affect the game in other ways, adding depth and surprise to the game.

Additionally, during a player’s turn, he or she can choose to discard a monster or monsters from his or her horde to activate their abilities.

Certain cards, like the Shield, can be played out-of-turn. These cards allow cunning (or mean-spirited) players to throw surprise wrenches into their opponents’ plans.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: BlockChain: The Dice Game
description:
The blockchain (also known as "the trust protocol") is a technology that aims at decentralization as a security measure. It is "an open, distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and verifiably and permanently". For use as a distributed ledger, a blockchain is typically managed by a peer-to-peer network collectively adhering to a protocol for inter-node communication and validating new blocks. Once recorded, the data in any given block cannot be altered retroactively without the alteration of all subsequent blocks, which requires collusion of the network majority.

In BlockChain: The Dice Game, players will use cards to represent fundamental processes for calculating and validating a BlockChain block. Cards, for example, allow you to move dice from the stack (main dice queue) to its board; or increment or decrement one of the dice you are using. Each block has a value to be validated, where subsequent blocks have values ​related to the previous blocks.

In some situations, players will use the cards to participate in the validation of a block made by another player. To do this, they needed to spend part of their tokens (representing the cost of processing that data) and became part of the validation pool of that block. One of the most common examples is the use of the PUSH card, where the player can "push" his dice to the board of another player.

For each block validated, players are given tokens for validating the block or for having helped validate it. At the end of the fourth block validation, the player with the most tokens wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Crossword Challenge
description:
Game Type: Word Scramble + Crossword Puzzle = The world's fastest Word Race game with over 10,000+ possibilities to expand your vocabulary!

How to Play: Spin either of the word category spinners, then roll the die to determine the letter count, range 3-8 letters. If you roll a 1 or 2, those points are awarded to roller. If a 3 or higher is rolled, flip the 30 second sand timer and the race is on for all players to see which player is first to spell a word meeting the criteria! Next one up rolls.


Categories: personal friend, actor/actress, places, emotions, military, compliments, actions, history, animals, anatomy, music, clothing, food, cartoon characters, work professions and slang words.


Game Objective: First player with the correct word spelled is awarded the points based on the number of letters (ex// 3 points for 3 letter word), first player to 25 points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Battle Armor: Alien Incursion
description: This is the first of several alien additions to the Battle Armor game system. Now you can play the crab like Too-Nai in their battles with the forces of the human race.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Movies
description:
Movies is a card game for 2 to 4 players in which you take control of a film producing company, competing with each other to produce the best releases and the most awarded movies.

Will you risk your money on that particular starring couple or will you rely on more versatile secondary actors? It’s for you to choose how you will be remembered.

—description from the designer



Playing the gameTen years are simulated during the game, one year per round, which are then divided in trimesters or turns.

Every trimester players may:

Buy an Actor or a Director card on the table, paying a variable cost that depends on few factors.
Buy or sell a Studio, which allows the player to produce more movies.
Buy or sell Screenplays, to a maximum of five at a time.


When a player has two Actors and one Director he finds suitable for a particular Screenplay he may produce a movie, which can last between 1 and 3 years. When the end of the year comes, players may premiere the movies that finished production. Players calculate the income of each premiered movie and the number of awards it receives.

Winning the game is a combination of how many credits a player has at the end and the awards he received for his premiered movies.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Animals
description:
To win a round of Animals (アニマルズ), you need to get rid of all your cards in hand; if you do, you score points for the cards that others still have in hand, and whoever scores fifty points first wins.

The deck in Animals has cards in red, yellow, and blue, and in each color there are three 3, 5 and 6; two 2 and 4; six +2 and +4; and nine 1 (stop) cards. The deck also contains six multicolored cards from 1-6.

After the cards are dealt out, the first player in the game lays down one or more cards; if they play more than one card, then the cards must be all the same color and they must either match in number or be in sequential order. The next player can play something higher than what was played initially with higher numbers outranking lower ones, and red outranking yellow, which outranks blue. A multicolor card played first on its own is worse than blue; played after a single card, it's considered to be the same color as what it's following.

The 1s can be played on 6s without needing to play more cards to outrank the current hand, so a blue 1 beats a red 6.

On a turn, a player either plays or passes. Once everyone passes, the last player to have played leads something new, and play continues until someone empties their hand of cards, thereby scoring points equal to what other players still have in hand. These rounds are repeated until someone scores at least 50 points.

name: Destination Tokyo
description: Roll-and-move board game with a large cartoon-illustrated poster-sized board, probably produced by the crew of HMAS Warrego (U73), a Grimsby class sloop of the Royal Australian Navy, built in Sydney in 1939 and commissioned in August 1940. In October 1940 Warrego assumed duty as Senior Officer, 20th Minesweeping Flotilla and in July 1944 she was transferred to the US Seventh Fleet Survey Group (TG 70.5) for survey duties in New Guinea waters. The game depicts numerous incidents and events that the Warrego and crew experienced during 1941-1945, events that are well-documented at http://www.navy.gov.au/hmas-warrego-ii.

name: Animal Kingdom: African Edition
description:
Animal Kingdom is an educational, fun and challenging game, built for the whole family to enjoy. There are easy and intermediate questions, so every member will be able to participate and learn something new. Players can even get rich by building up their own game farm while learning about the bush. Animal Kingdom was developed to get families and friends to interact and to show everyone how wonderful African wildlife is and how important it is for us to preserve and nurture what we have.

Players move along several intersecting tracks on a map of Africa, taking actions depending on which type of location they land on. Various actions spots allow player to answer trivia questions about African wildlife, gain or lose money (themed as various types of wildlife for their own game farm), or encounter unexpected events. The interior of Africa holds several off-road paths which are high risk roads that may lead to disaster or to riches. As players correctly answer certain questions, they earn pieces for their individual jigsaw puzzle. The first to complete his or her puzzle wins the game.

Wildlife trivia includes not only traditional question formats, but also tracking cards (with pawprints and other spoor that must be identified) and picture cards.

name: Bike Race
description:
Description
Bike Race is a fast-paced road bicycle racing game for 2 to 4 players where each of them controls a team made up of three cyclists: the Peloton, the Duo, and the Sprinter. The goal is to cross the finish line with your cyclists before your opponents to get the highest amount of points.

Gameplay
Each player controls a team composed of one Sprinter, one Duo, and one Peloton. The starting player chooses 3 Movement Tokens, shakes them up in hands and and then drops them on the table. The visible sides show the actions which can be taken. The player then selects 2 Movement Tokens to move 2 cyclists. The next player does the same, this is repeated until all players have completed their moves. The end of the game is reached when all the cyclists have passed the finish line (red flags). At the end of the game the points obtained by the cyclists are summed up to establish the winner.

Tracks
A total of 11 double side track cards may be assembled to form various tacks. The game come with 2 standard tracks but the players may use the cards to build new tracks. A card with an Intermediate Line is available too.

Features
The Cyclists do not only have standard movements, each cyclist type features a special movement: Sprint, Catch up and Slipstream.

Game Official Website

name: Innkeepers
description:
Innkeeper Brewers is a quick 2-player game where players are two opposing Inn landlords, racing to be the best inn-keepers in the village by providing the villagers with beer as quickly as possible, and have the nicest Inn in the village too, by upgrading it with fancy nick-nacks. Harvest barley, brew it into beer, sell that beer to villagers, then invest your well-earned money for Victory Points (VPs), and/or buy Inn upgrades to improve your Inn!

On your turn, you move your pawn along its assigned row/column of a 4x4 action grid, to activate the action on the card in the grid that is the cross-reference of your pawn and your opponent's pawn. Wherever you move to on your turn will influence which actions your opponent has available on their next turn!

Actions include gaining barley, brewing barley into beer, selling beer to the villagers at various sale rates, exchanging money for VPs, or spending money on upgrades for your Inn. Inn Upgrades provide the player with special unique powers they can then use for the rest of the game.

The game ends once one player reaches 20 VPs, or all the Inn upgrade cards are bought; the other player takes a final turn, then the player with the most VPs is the winner!

-description from designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bing
description:
Combines cards strategy and Bingo luck.

Each player takes his turn in a clockwise rotation.
The player next in turn to the dealer plays first. He discards a card from his hand and places it on the table beside the deck face up for everyone to see. He should also name it to the other players...
As in Bingo, the winner is the first one to cover his BING card with the markers, in wich case he says "BING"

—user summary

name: Ninja Pooper: On The Beach
description:
Shield your butts, get other poopers in trouble, occupy a secret space and keep your dignity as a human being until the end against an incoming poop.

Ninja Pooper: On The Beach is a really stupid, but funny card game. You and your friends compete to be the first ninja pooper who poop without getting caught. The deck is made up of cards that forcing your opponent to put down multiple cards by attack cards, detecting other pooper's secret space or skipping the next player's turn. shield your butts using cork stopper or seek a secret space, else if you'll be forced to poop at a public place.

The "Ninja Pooper" core deck is 72 cards; the "Real Ninja" expansion pack is 36 cards. The gameplay is designed for up to five players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Les Vacances de Mouk
description:
Mouk and his friends had a nice vacation together on a sunny island but it's time for everybody to go back home.

Each player starts by picking randomly a friend token and searches for his home on the board. The goal is to be the first player to bring 4 of them back home by rolling the die and landing on the right spot.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le Jeu Qui Rend Super Happy
description:
In order to reach the cloud of happiness and discover your gift from the other players, you have to climb the ladder of happiness as fast as you can.

Participate in several challenges to climb the ladder faster than your opponents:

- Qui es-tu ? : Vote on which player is better defined by the adjective and guess who the other players have voted for.
- Happy faces : Be the first to identify two cards with identical faces.
- Situations pourries : Find the best solution to a bad situation you might encounter in life!
- Bonheur général : Enjoy a break in the competition to just be nice to the other players, by complimenting them or giving free hugs.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Novel-based, Party Game

name: Comment je m'habille ?
description:
Teach your kid how to dress according to the weather by associating pieces of clothing.

After picking a character card, the player has to find the three cards representing the clothes worn by the character and put them in the wardrobe. The wardrobe is then closed and the door on the back is open to reveal a character wearing the conbination of the three pieces of clothing. If it matches the character card, the player scores.
The game ends when all the character cards have been used.

For older kids (3+), the back of the character cards is used, showing only the background. Players have to find the correct pieces of clothing based on the weather.

name: The Pyramid
description: Each player receives 24 stones in one color, of which 3 are to be used as blockers, and 2 dice each and a dice to increase during the game. The playing field consists of 2 pyramids and a cube area. In a pyramid are 21 boxes for inserting individual stones. The aim of the game is that each player uses his 21 stones in the pyramid of the playing field by throwing dice and then dices out of it. The insertion is done with two dice, with one stone each in the corresponding floor of the pyramid (from above) is used. The withdrawal must begin with a 1. Thereafter, the stones with the appropriate number out of the row can be diced or moved up. The blocker can be used with a rolled 1 in the top of the opposing pyramid. The opponent must not throw any more stones out until he can eliminate the blocker with a 1.

name: Windsurf-Spiel
description:
Each player takes one surfer and places him in his Windsurfing School (Start). The dice are then thrown in turn. Each player moves his surfer forwards according to the number of spots on the dice. When a player stops on a particular picture space, he has to follow the instructions on that space (for example, miss a turn). If two surfers stop on the same space, the surfer who is already on the space has to move six spaces back. He need not follow the instructions on the space on which he finally stops!
The winner is the Player who is the first to get back to the Surf School (Finish).

—user summary

name: Milujeme Slovensko
description:
The board game Milujeme Slovensko (we love Slovakia) brings you fun and examines your knowledge.

There are interesting tasks awaiting players in Slovakia. By buying a cave, a mine, a harbor, or cableways, you will become a great investor who, however, has to deal efficiently with his property and money to make his profit grow and create a reserve of money for the tasks that are awaiting him during the game.

Buying real estate will ensure you some revenue from your opponents. The "number plate" cards will check your knowledge of numberplates in all of Slovakia's districts. Those cards are also given spice to by a bit of bet and risk. Your knowledge and finances can as well be boosted through quiz questions about Slovakia.

The game teaches you to invest and reasonably deal with finance, expands your knowledge of the country, while offering you the opportunity to spend time with your family and friends.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mr. Natural
description:
Mr. Natural is a Push Your Luck dice game for as many players as can sit around a table, played with six six-sided dice, in which the object is being the first player to score 10,000 points. Different single dice or dice combinations are worth from 50 to 1,500 points, depending on the combination. The name of the game comes from the highest-scoring combination, a natural 1 to 6 flush, called "a Mr. Natural" in the game.

The game was published in the issue 23 of The Thing Quarterly, an art periodical in form of an object. It consists of six ceramic six-sided dice and a fabric pouch, plus game instructions, contained in a cardboard box.

name: Wij zijn de beste!
description: A team of boys takes on a team of girls in five different trivia rounds. The team with the highest number of correct answers wins.

name: Sonic The Hedgehog: The Card Game
description:
50 Large Cards featuring your favorite Sonic the Hedgehog characters!

Great fun and easy to play! The first to get rid of all their cards is the winner. Beware though, in this game of thrills and spills, you won't be able to win quite as easily as you suspect!

—description from the back of the box

In this variation on UNO, the deck of cards is dealt evenly out to all players. Each player places his or her deck face down in front of them. The player who is to the left of the dealer turns over the top card of his or her deck. If it is a ring card they place it next to their deck. If it is a character card, they can play it to the center of the table.

Players can play an enemy character card on an opponents hero character card to engage in a battle. Players will use one of their ring cards to 'boost' their character in the battle. However, this card is chosen in secret and revealed simultaneously. The player with the smaller ring card is the loser of the battle and takes all cards from the battle and places them in his or her discard pile.

Play continues until one player runs out of cards and is declared the winner.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Video Game Theme

name: Quest!
description:
Quest! is a tableau-building game in which your charter hires adventurers, equips them, and sends them out on quests in order to gain glory for your charter!

Each player is dealt a random charter which gives starting gold, a starting adventurer, and has a unique way to end the game.

On your turn you take to actions from among Acquire Cards, Activate a Card, Amass Wealth, Embark on a Quest, Mend Your Party, Reset a Row, or Retire Cards.

You can acquire adventurers or items for your adventurers by spending the gold gained from amassing wealth or from completing quests. Once embarked on a quest, a player must complete a series of tasks as stated on the quest card by rolling dice and checking for success. If a player succeeds at a majority of the tasks, that player retains the quest and gains its reward. Fail too many tasks and suffer the consequences.

Once a player has retained enough quests to fulfill the charter's end game condition, the game ends. Each player counts the number of glory points on each quest they have retained they have won for their charter and the person with the most wins the game!

-description from designer

name: Neverland: The Lost Memories
description:
In Neverland: The Lost Memories players are grumpy old men who are trying to use the magic of Neverland to become younger and to recollect the lost memories of their youth. They do this with a unique blend of pick up and delivery and action drafting in a race to become the youngest player.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Outbreak: Contingency Plan
description:
vIn Outbreak: Contingency Plan you are responsible for a colony trying to survive during a epidemic; this virus has a death toll that is rising by the minute.

Each player is the leader of a colony of people that are in danger of becoming extinct at almost any moment. Players will roll a die to determine their fate from the chance tokens that will cure, contaminate or cut-down your colony before you know it. Be the last remaining leader with a colony to win this fast-paced game of survival.

Will your colony survive to the end? We shall see…

—description from the publisher

name: Sol 3: Starfighter Mech Tactics Card Game
description:
In Sol 3, two players face off in tactical combat, using a combination of constructed decks and selected cards, collectively known as a player’s “List”. Players create a map using a grid of map tiles, and then play proceeds in alternating turns. Each turn, the active player draws cards from their deck, moves their Capital and launches units, then activates their Units one at a time. Playing Pilots and Tactics cards is done by spending Command, which is generated each turn by a player’s Crew cards.

Each player brings a selection of Missions to the game. Each mission, when completed, grants it’s owner Victory Points. The first player to succeed in reaching the set number of Victory Points (12 in a standard “Cruiser Clash” game) wins the game. Alternatively, if a player is required to draw or discard a card from their deck, but no longer has any cards in their deck, they immediately lose the game, and their opponent wins via a “morale” victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Beat This Book!
description:
Beat This Book! is an exciting solo player game in a spiral-bound book format, where you (the player) take on a series of clever casino-style challenges using a deck of standard playing cards. To win the game, you MUST get to the last page in the book before running out of cards. But it won't be easy...

The challenges are woven into a continuous narrative that propels you forward in the story. You have been sent an urgent Royal Invitation from The King and Queen of Monaco -- and must set sail immediately to the Grand Hotel Victoria & Casino. But why??

Beat This Book! encompasses the elements that players most enjoy at the gaming tables: The thrill of the hard fought win, the luck of the draw, the crucial decision making, the push to keep going even in the face of diminishing odds, the flip of the cards, and of course the downright fun.

It is recommended for players aged 10 and up. The ability to read and handle a deck of cards is all that’s needed to play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Patrimonium
description:
In Patrimonium, players set out to discover the Walloon heritage. Through a series of 9 "families" of monuments and sites, the players get a broad view of the richness and diversity of this regional heritage.

Patrimonium looks very much like a mix between Happy Families and Mille Bornes, with cards representing castles, churches, gardens and other sites of the Walloon heritage.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Ziggurat: The mythical ascension of the desert rose, the waking sun and the scholar princess
description:
Ziggurat is an artistic and immersive solitaire board game set in fantasy desert tower, in a world ruled by manipulators of substance.

In order to climb to the top of the tower Ziggurat, players will have to chose their path room by room, each time triggering one of 7 mini-games.

To help them in their quest, the characters will use metals they find to craft alchemical recipes in the labs they find in the tower.

While the full climb can take many hours to complete, the game can be broken into sessions of approximately 15 minutes and easily saved, to be recovered later, thanks to the game's quick setup.

—description from the designer

name: Quest for Esmeralda
description:
Introduction:
Quest for Esmeralda is a strategy-based, Simultaneous Action Selection battle game with medieval theme. Players each take a role as an adventurer on a quest to retrieve the treasure called Esmeralda. It’s every man for himself, and players must defeat everyone else before reaching Esmeralda. However, Esmeralda is heavily guarded by the Dragon... How will you defeat all opponents, slain the Dragon and retrieve Esmeralda?

Gameplay:
Each player is dealt a hand from a small deck of 12 cards. The deck is designed to be exhaustive, and players can deduce what other players have, based on what's been played.
Players battle each other in multiple Battles, each consisting of Turns.
At the beginning of every Turn, each player secretly chooses an action and their target. All cards are revealed at once, and the actions are resolved accordingly. If you accumulate enough damage, you are out for that Battle and cannot join until the next Battle. Don't worry, Battles typically only last 3 Turns.
After every turn, surviving players get to move their pawn down the world map towards Esmeralda. Each point on the map, however, has a location card which may be beneficial or detrimental to the players. The last point on the world map is Esmeralda, defended by the Dragon. When fighting the Dragon, his health never heals. This means that sneaky players can swoop in and deal the last hit to win the game!

Frequently Asked Questions:

Is this a player elimination game?
Yes, however the elimination is temporary. Players always come back to life after every Battle. It's no fun when players get eliminated and they have to sit around for the rest of the game!

Will it be hard for losing players to win the game?
Nope! The game is designed for quick battles with balancing mechanisms everywhere.

What will I need to play the PnP version?
You will need 4 pairs of matching pawns, and 1 unique pawn.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ascent: The Game of Rocketry
description:
Ascent The Game of Rocketry is a competitive card game that sets two to four players into the world of rocket building. The game takes heavy inspiration from the Space Race and every rocket, card and patch is steeped with history.

Players take turns testing one of their systems, while the other players try to play Fail cards to damage the system and can keep it from passing. Players, however, can repair their own systems mid-test by playing OK cards, based on Mission Control Officers and Engineers. The first player to have all 4 of his or her systems survive testing, completes a rocket, earns a Mission Patch and ends the round.

Players can collect Mission Patches along the way for various in-game achievements (including completing a Rocket) and the player with the most patches at the end of 3 rounds wins the game! Mission Patches are used as a scoring mechanism as well as granting special rules to the players that hold them, creating a dynamic system that adds an ever-shifting asymmetrical gameplay landscape, keeping players on their toes and deepening the strategy further.

name: Jester's Court, Suit Thyself!
description:
Jester’s Court, Suit Thyself! is a 2 to 4 player game for ages 9 and up. It has unique movement and competitive mechanics with subtle degrees of luck and strategy. Using cards, players maneuver their Mage on a grid and attack other players to weaken their avatars and eventually cause them to lose some of the suits they’ve collected. Blocking stones may also be placed, and players may also take steps to heal their Mage.

The print version of Jester’s Court, Suit Thyself! includes the following components:


4 Wooden Pawns in 4 colors (Mages)
4 Wooden Columns in 4 colors (Menhir Blocking Stones)
20 Health & Suit Tokens in 4 colors
4 Mage Reference cards
4 Six-sided dice in 4 colors
1 18” x 18” Quad-Fold Game Board
Rule Booklet


The 4 colors are Red, Green, Blue, and Yellow.

In addition to the included components, you will need two standard decks of playing cards. These are standard poker decks including two jokers per deck of cards. For 2 player games, use 1 deck of cards with 2 jokers. For 3-4 player games, use 2 decks of cards with 4 jokers.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Caperucita Roja
description:
Each player takes the role of a Caperucita Roja (Little Red Riding Hood) that must deliver three different items (flower, medicine, cake) to their grandma. In their turn, the players must roll a dice and then decide which path to take.
The winner is the player who arrives first to the grandma house with the three items.

name: Lords of Xibalba
description:
Lords of Xibalba is a game where you take the role of one mischievous god of the underworld know as Xibalba and your goal is to increase your reputation by putting to test all the people that come by.

During the game you could allocate people in the different caves available in which you will send your messengers to apply the corresponding test, mess with others gods to avoid them to get a good reputation and above all avoid the people to escape.

Lords of Xibalba is a 2 to 4 players game where you're gonna test your abilities to strategize your movements and to use your hand to try to increase at maximum your reputation and become one of the legendary Lords in Mayan history.

—description from the publisher

name: Stalin Assassin
description:
In Stalin Assassin, each player is randomly assigned a role.

4 possible roles at the start: Stalin, Commis, Capitalists and The Bolshevik. The Capitalists always have a majority, the Commis know who they are the Capitalists and Commis do not know who is Stalin or The Bolshevik.

Stalin and The Bolshevik are always in incognito and also do not know who they are.

5 to 11 players:

5 players - 2 Capitalists, 1 Commi, 1 Stalin and 1 Bolshevik

6 and 7 players - 3 or 4 Capitalists, 1 Commi, 1 Stalin and 1 Bolshevik

8 to 11 players - 3 Commi, 1 Stalin, 1 Bolshevik and all other Capitalists

HAMMER OF POWER passes from a player to the other and all players have to put their thumbs up or down to accept the HAMMER of POWER (POWER TOOL OR PT) given to the player selected. If the player gets most okays he picks 2 cards and places his chosen one on the board.

There is 1 board where actions are taken. 11 action in total. 1

Each time the HAMMER OF POWER is passed to a player. That player takes 2 TOOL Cards and places 1 on the BOARD (COMMI POWER TOOL or FREEDOM CARD). Then he places the one not chosen back in the pile of cards *at the bottom).

If at action 3 and 4 there is a COMMI POWER TOOL - TIME FOR WILD GUESS - where all will guess who is a Commi The "appointed" Commi gets an UNDERCOVER COMMI card and is suspected to be a Commi.

The board is called Mother Russia.

—description from the publisher

name: Garden in Time and Space
description:
Garden in Time and Space is a real time co-operative roll and write PNP game. Players need to irrigate all their flowers in very limited time.
But please notice, there will be portals appear in your garden and disturb your plan.
In the game, simultaneously, players repeatly roll their dice to determint which type of waterpipe they can draw on their own board.They have to connect pipe to other exist pipe.But if they roll a portal then connect it to a pipe, one of other players will have to draw a portal in same coordinate on his board.Now pipe will grow out from the portal, which may disturb his original drawing plan or may help him connect pipe to their flowers more easily.
The object of game is to irrigate all players' flowers in 3 minutes. Otherwise, all players lose.

—description from the publisher

name: La Petite Guerre: 17th-19th Century Skirmish Wargames Rules
description:
These rules are designed for re-creating small scale skirmishes with miniature figures. Although designed primarily for conflict in North America in the 17th -19th centuries, they can be used to re-create actions in various times and places.

Scale:
These rules can be used with figures ranging from 15mm to 54mm. Each model figure represents between one and five men. Time and distance scales have been deliberately distorted in the interests of practicality and playability.

All measurements are given in multiples of ‘10 paces’. Ten paces is 3cm if using 25/28 mm figures. Adjust up or down for larger or smaller figures

These rules are available as a free download on the publisher's website
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Micro Miners: A Micro Deck Builder
description:
Micro Miners: A micro deck builder takes a full size deck building experience and compacts it down to the size of about a standard deck of cards. The game shifts the focus from collecting many cards to collecting the right cards at the right time for deck optimization. Every time you shuffle your deck you will bring your deck size down to the your current limit keep your deck dedicated to the actions you care about. Players need to choose the cards they take from the Tunnel carefully if they want to load the final gem into a cart and score a point.

Micro Miners is played like many deck builders and can be played by taking turns gaining cards and using them to score points. However in Micro Miners each player starts their turn with 3 Effort which allows them to take actions. They can spend a number of effort indicated to acquire an available card from the tunnel or use it to play a Cart in front of them. It can also be used to load gems into any suitable cart in play controlled by any player, but any player can block the gem from being loaded if they have a gem that matches the targeted cart.

Players have a hand limit size of just 2 cards and will draw a new hand at the the end of each turn. If they ever need to draw cards but their draw pile does not have enough they will shuffle their discard pile to form a new draw deck. Each time they do this they will count the number of cards in their deck, not including any carts in play or gems loaded into them, and will choose which cards to discard down to their deck limit. All discarded cards will be Tossed face down into the Shaft.

The first player to score 3 points will win this micro deckbuilder.

Plays in 20-30 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Too Many Heroes
description:
In Too Many Heroes, players take on the role of rival corporations, racing to be the first to build their super-team of heroes. But you’re not building a team to fight crime and injustice...you’re in it for the money. Movie rights, book deals, sponsorships...you name it!

It’s a fast paced card game for 2-6 players. The massive deck contains 216 cards, featuring 100 fully-realized heroes. Fighting alongside them are villains, action cards, upgrades, downgrades, and the coveted License Cards. Yes, License cards. Your heroes must be licensed to count. Otherwise they’re classified as illegals, operating under the law, vigilantes, and most importantly for the government, untaxable.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Sinu tee piimaärisse
description:
Board game about milk-producing.

in his turn player rolls die and moves around the board.
After each turn he draws one card with same color what is the space he landed. Each time if somebody has moved all round he may exchange the cards with other players. Players may not show the color-side of the cards to each other.
If any player has collected all 9 cards in one and the same color during the game he is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Disneyland Electric Tours
description:
This electric game is based on Walt Disney's Disneyland theme park in Anaheim, California and weekly television show of the same name.

A playing board sheet is laid over the base and the players move along the trail. The base has a circuit selector, wire connector with a metal tip that is touched to spots on the board and red light that allows or hinders the player's progress; underneath the base is a place for a battery to be installed to power the light.

Each game has a trail going over the points of interest and the player reaching the goal first wins the game.

After the traveler and opponent are decided, the traveler spins the spinner to determine how many steps to travel along the trail. The traveler determines whether to continue his trip by placing the contact tip on the station. If the light signal goes on, he continues traveling, otherwise he places his Disney character on the station as a marker and remains there and waits for his next turn

The opponent can confuse and obstruct the traveler by operating the rotary switch occasionally, to change the circuit so that the signal light will not light up and delay the traveler's progress.

If a traveler is not careful and picks the trail up wrong and heads back towards the starting point, he loses all previous plays and starts his travel all over again. The winner of the game is the first traveler reaching the goal

Game consists of 4 playing boards in full color (Fantasyland, Tomorrowland, Frontierland, & Adventureland), 4 character players, spinner, electric circuit complete with flashlight-type battery (Requires 1 D battery for the light).

Produced sometime in the 1950s
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Walt Disney's Casey Jr. Game
description:
Help your Favorite Walt Disney characters board the Casey Jr Express.

Spin the three arrow spinner and choose only one of the three moves indicated:

Take any car (as indicated by the short arrow).
Take any ticket (as indicated by the long arrow) however you can't do this unless you have an empty car.
Take any rider (as indicated by the medium arrow) however you can't do this until you have the proper car to put him in and you must return a ticket for ever rider you put in a proper car.

Place the cars and riders as you get them in their corresponding slots on the track in front of you.

The first player to get all of his characters aboard is the winner

name: Ladronia: The Dark Dungeon
description:
Ladronia is a fun and dynamic board game. Five adventurers must enter the dark lord's dungeon in search of treasures. But this will be full of enemies, traps, obstacles and dangerous events. Each player must advance and explore through the dungeon, even steal their own companions to obtain the immense treasure.

Game components:
- 1 board
- 135 cards
- 1 rules
- 11 dices (1 black, 5 red and 5 blue)
- 5 colored chips
- 1 box

The turn of each player:
- Move: each player in turn must advance through the board to reach the treasure room.
- Explore or steal: the player can explore the zones to find treasures and useful objects or steal cards from other players.
- Playing cards: the player can play cards from his hand (skills, objects, actions ...).

The objective of the game is to accumulate the maximum of treasure cards (steal, explore or get to the treasure room). The game ends in three ways:
1. When a player arrives at the treasure room.
2. When there are no more treasures.
3. When there are no more events.
The player with the most treasures wins the game.

-description from designer

Ladronia es un divertido y dinámico juego de mesa. Cinco aventureros deberán adentrarse en la mazmorra del señor oscuro en busca de tesoros. Pero esta se encontrará repleta de enemigos, trampas, obstáculos y sucesos peligrosos. Cada jugador deberá avanzar y explorar por la mazmorra llegando incluso a robar a los propios compañeros con tal de conseguir el inmenso tesoro".

Componentes del juego:
- 1 tablero
- 135 cartas
- 1 reglas
- 11 dados (1 negro, 5 rojo y 5 azul)
- 5 fichas de colores
- 1 caja

El turno de cada jugador:
- Avanzar: cada jugador a su vez debe avanzar a través del tablero para llegar a la sala del tesoro.
- Explorar o robar: el jugador puede explorar las zonas para encontrar tesoros y objetos útiles o robar cartas de otros jugadores.
- Jugar cartas: el jugador puede jugar cartas de su mano (habilidades, objetos, acciones ...).

El objetivo del juego es acumular el máximo de cartas del tesoro (robar, explorar o llegar a la sala del tesoro). El juego termina de tres maneras:
1. Cuando un jugador llega a la sala del tesoro.
2. Cuando no hay más tesoros.
3. Cuando no hay más eventos.
El jugador con más tesoros gana el juego.

name: Rechen-Domino
description:
Educational twist on dominoes, issued in the DDR.
Each Domino has a sum on it. In order to add to the line you must have a domino that features the correct answer to that sum. The box lid gives a good example of the game
First to get rid of all their dominoes wins.

name: EndStream
description:
EndStream is an adults-only, strategic card game for 2 players (30-60 min).

Each player has a stream of 6 random turnpoints, placed apart (each card represents a century), thus creating a board of 6x2 upon which the operators can move.

Each player has a hand of 7 cards, and a set of resource cards face down in front of them. On their turn, using the resources available, you will pay the cost of your cards, activate abilities, move your team across the timeline and work towards defeating your opponent.

Our universe is a stream of time. There are many streams, and the tech which allows to travel in and between them has fallen into the wrong hands. It is being used for drug trade, enslavement, human experimentation, and other atrocities. You will be playing a gang of dark and twisted outlaws, manipulating history to eradicate the competition.

Like rocks in a stream, major events in history have the power to redirect the flow of time. Those events are called turnpoints, and their outcome can strengthen or weaken each player’s operators.

There are 3 types of outcomes, each advances a type of agenda : military, political or scientific. In short: Want to make a soldier stronger? Undermine peace talks and start a war. At your disposal are six operators and a hideout. Your goal is to either eliminate all rival operators or destroy their hideout.

name: Impact Financial Jr.
description:
Welcome to Impact Financial! As newly hired junior financial analysts, the company has sent you promote awareness of global social impact initiatives doing well in the stock market. You’ll be given a monthly budget to invest in the stock market. Do well and the organization leaders will approve your application to become a full fledged financial analyst!

Impact Financial Jr. is a version of the full game Impact Financial designed to cater classroom type settings with large number of players. These teacher’s components can be printed out or pre-rolled into a presentation. The students simply need the worksheet and a pen to play.

The game is played in eight rounds. In each round there is a target behavior of the market which can swing depending on the token drawn by the facilitator.

After the stocks go up and down, players then look at their player sheet and write down their purchases and sales in their appropriate stock boxes. Their buying power is not carried over per round so they must make sound investments throughout the eight rounds of the game.

When the game ends whoever has the highest value wins! Tie-breaks for the most diverse portfolio.

name: React!
description:
React! is meant for 2 - 4 players. Players buy and trade chemicals, discover and perform reactions, and create special molecules, all while learning organic chemistry.

You start with drawing cards, either chemicals or events. Then combine substrate and reagent cards to discover a reaction card. Mix reagent and reaction cards to discover your lab bench molecule. Events allow you to do something more, perhaps steal, sabotage, protect or more. Be the first to get all the reactions on your lab bench to win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Owl Solve That!
description:
Owl Solve That! challenges players to use any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division to create equations that equal a solution card in their hand. The first player to create an equation earns points. One point is earned for each number card used from the board to create the equation. The speed element of creating your equations before your opponents add an extra layer of challenge and competition to the game
-description from publisher's website

Five number cards are placed face-up next to one another on the game board. In turn order, a player chooses one of the three solution cards in her hand and uses the number cards to make an equation that totals to the number on the solution card. She receives a point for each number card used in her solution. Opponents can score two bonus points for finding a solution before she does. Number cards and solution cards are replenished, turn passes to the next player, and the game ends when a player reaches 25 points.
-user summary

name: Mind Your Numbers
description: Each player has an identical set of tiles numbered 0 through 9, along with three division, subtraction, and addition tiles and two multiplication tiles. On a turn, each player chooses a math symbol, and then each player chooses a number. Each player then performs a mathematical operation using his number, his symbol, and his opponent’s number. Results are compared. The player with the higher result gets a cube. If any result is between 0 and 9, a cube is placed onto the matching number on a game board. Used tiles are discarded. Play continues until all the number tiles are gone (nine rounds). Each player then collects all the cubes on the board that cover either of the two mystery numbers that he selected at the beginning of the game. The player with the most cubes wins.

name: CrossBlitz
description: Two category cards are revealed. Players have three minutes to write answers that fit either category onto a Scrabble-like grid in crossword fashion. Players get one point for each word formed. A few squares in the grid, if covered by a letter, will provide additional points or other benefits. The winner is the player with the most points after five rounds.

name: Babel: The Weird Word Game
description: The Babel deck consists of 56 cards, namely, two complete alphabets and the numbers 2,3,4, and 8. Seven cards are dealt to each player. Players simultaneously use some or all of their cards to create one babel each. A babel is a shorthand form of a word or phrase. (The idea is reminiscent of the game Inklings.) Then, players take turns guessing one another’s babels. Both the babeler and the first correct guesser receive the same score, which is the number of letters in the babel’s meaning. For example, GDR, meaning German Democratic Republic, is worth 24 points. 3 GD LYR, meaning “three good liars,” is worth 14 points. Play an agreed-upon number of rounds.

name: コトノハ探偵 (Kotonoha tantei)
description:
User summary
コトノハ探偵 (Kotonoha tantei) is a Japanese game about being a Word Detective.

This is a guess-the-word game where one player will choose a topic related to the words that are lined up and will give hints of the topic, and the other players will have to guess it. You will have to use not only the hint of the person who set the theme, but also other players' answers.

The player who set the topic will get more points if the other players take longer to solve the word, conversely answering player will get more point if they solve the word faster.
Each player will take a turn to set a topic and at the end the player with the most VP will become the winner.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーの一人が選んだお題との関係性で並べられた言葉をヒントにお題となった言葉を他のプレイヤーが推理するワードゲームです。
出題者（お題を出した人）の最初のヒントだけでなく他の人の回答もヒントとして並んでいきます。
出題者はより遅く正解が出ることで、また回答者はより早く正解することで得られる得点が高くなります。

全員が1回ずつ出題をして最も得点の高い人が勝者となります

name: 榎コロ (Eno Koro)
description: 榎コロ (Eno Koro) is a worker placement game with a single type of resource in which player researchers grow a mushroom-like species.

name: Uncertainty Principle
description:
Uncertainty Principle is a quick-playing original abstract game played on an 8x8 grid board. The starting position is an empty board. The objective is to end the game with the most stones or markers of the player's color. The uncertainty principle demonstrated by game play is that a player may choose the location of their next move but not the type of piece played. To play, players take turns designating a square they wish to occupy and rolling a die to determine if their color or that of their opponent is placed.

Additionally, players may place their marker on a square that is surrounded by enough of their color to "convert" spaces without rolling. An empty square adjacent both diagonally and orthogonally to three spaces of one color is in a "critical state" and if a fourth piece is placed adjacent, automatically converts to that color.

Successfully placing a piece may allow a series of neighboring spaces to be claimed. Strategy and risk are combined as players attempt to shape the board in their favor, while at risk of seeing their opponent benefit instead.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Square Grid

name: Keeper of the Zoo
description:
Go on safari with a challenging and fun game of chance using one die and animal cards. The object of the game is to go on Safari and brig 4 animals from their start location (origin) to your finish location (zoo) and have the 4 corresponding animal cards placed in front of you and do so before your opponents.

—description from the box
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le jeu des familles Gargouille en bandes dessinées
description:
This card game is based on the popular Quebec French-language comic "Gargouille."

The goal of the game is to collect the largest number of families (each family is composed of four cards).

All 32 cards are shuffled and distributed as evenly as possible between all players.

The first player picks a card in his hand, and asks any opponent if they have a card in the same family. When requesting a card from an opponent, players must specify both the family name and the number of the card. For example, a player might request the third card from the éclairs family (the éclairs with three symbols on it). If the opponent has that card, they must give it to the player.

As long as the player gets the cards they asks for, they can continue. For each new card, they request a card from the opponent of their choice.

However, if the player does not get the requested card, their turn is over.

The opponent who did not have the requested card becomes the new active player. Play continues until all families have been assembled.

For a two player game:
Distribute 10 cards to each player. The remaining cards constitute a stack on the table. If your opponent does not have the card you want, you draw a card from the stack.

name: FootballFans: Welcome to Russia
description:
Hilarious board game and real World Cup simulator for true football lovers, their friends, family members and anyone, who wants to feel the thrill of the fight !
This Game will tell you about the adventures of football fans in Russia. Funny caricatures, lots of humor, fighting spirit of football fans and excitement of a great sporting are waiting for you in this Game!
Travel around Russian cities, rent airports, stadiums, hotels, bars and gyms, play football matches. Win a World Cup!

This Game is a Football World Cup tournament simulator. As in real football, your success depends not only on the skills of your players but also on your managing, financial abilities and on how lucky you are. The World Cup 2018 is held in Russia, so all game events take place in Russian cities.

First, you choose your teams: there are 32 national football teams in the game; each team possesses its own unique skill and level of such features as: Team Power, Fans Power, Mood, Luck.
Then you decide what real property would you like to rent before the game starts.
Initially, each player has 200 football rubles. A player can rent an Airport, a Hotel, a Stadium, a Bar or a Gym on this money. All these objects may bring money to their owners as well as increase their team’s chances on winning matches. The prices of the property may vary, depending on the city. The game will start as soon as all players decide they have purchased enough.
Further on, purchases can be made after EACH round, in EACH group and after EACH play-off match.

The tournament schedule is the same as in real football:

32 teams distribute in 8 groups and play 3 tours each vs each in the group.
In group matches: victory – 3 points, tie – 1 point, defeat – 0 points.
Two teams scored the highest number of points qualify
The next step is the play-off tournament for those 16 teams who qualified. There cannot be ties on this stage. If a game is tied at the end of regulation time, penalty shootouts are used to decide the winner.
At the end there are only two teams left, who play the final match. The winner gets the World Cup.

Matches are played according to team’s features: Team Power, Fans Power, Mood, Luck. Each of the four features is compared. If a team has a higher level of a particular feature – this team scores a goal. If the level is the same, nobody scores. During the game players will have many chances to increase levels of these features, and they should use them wisely.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Sports, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: 激論勇者 (Bravado)
description:
In 激論勇者 (Bravado), players represent a penniless band of adventurers who nevertheless have been tasked with killing an evil spirit. Can you defeat this devil with only a razor, a shovel, and random other equipment?

The twist is that whoever has the highest value of equipment is a demon king as well and in league with the devil you're trying to defeat. Can the party overcome this bad spirit?

name: Fronton Miami: 1973
description:
In this 2P-3p sport & logistical simulation board game, players go head-to-head managing a hustling Jai Alai Fronton battling to satisfy the peculiar demands of jet set guests & claim the coveted BLUE CHIP LEADS!

Players use the staff & resources of the casino to manipulate a series of critical micro-economic instruments dynamically linked to the amount of control players are able to exert in the conduct & outcome of a detailed simulation of the sport of Jai Alai. The relative intensity of the shared economy in the game expands control, utilities & opportunity while exposing players to increasingly severe penalties for mismanagement.

MAIN GAME MECHANISMS:

Commodity Speculation:
FM73 features a multi-variable commodity marketplace dynamically correlated to the sport of Jai Alai in which the players accumulate & exchange both labor value & resource value.

Dice Rolling:
3 dice are featured in the game. The unique CESTA dice, a modified backgammon doubling cube, brings the game of Jai Alai to life. The 2 standard d6 are used to represent value indexes.

Simulation:
Statistical ranges & tendencies for Pro Jai Alai in the 1970-1975 period have been used to create a simple tactical version of the sport which allows players to make a series of decisions in order to resolve dice rolls rather than using dice rolls to resolve a fixed set of decisions. The influence of gambling on the sport, in the unique environment of a Casino Fronton, is taken into account

Worker Placement (Action Drafting):
On the strategic level, players collect needed actions in each phase of a round by controlling the position of Jai Alai players (pelotari), the Jai Alai ball (pelota) & player tokens on the fronton board.

Hand Management:
Players collect and manage cards and tiles representing the casino guests, staff (including Jai Alai players) & cash resources.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Frederick County: A Historic Trivia Game
description: Answer trivia questions about Frederick and gain property.

name: Grand Slam Baseball VCR Game
description: This is a 2-player baseball simulation game where dice rolls, card draws, and plays on a videocassette determine the outcome of batter/pitcher matchups.

name: La Vuelta: una clásica mundial
description:
La Vuelta is a game about cycling races. Players have to race four times in different countries with the most successful player becoming the overall winner.
The game is a roll and move game in which you have to disctribute the results of three dice between your two cyclists and your support vehicle.

name: Invisible Enemy
description:
This is a game of combat in the realm of miniaturized warfare, which re-creates the struggle between hunter-killer groups of tiny fighting vehicles called MGVs. In MGV, the heavy fighting is over or far away. On this battlefield, there are only a few units and they must hunt each other down and clear the field; targets must be secured, gauntlets run or a final swipe at launching a surgical strike. No matter what the original mission was, things have surely changed and now the remaining units must finish things. Despite their microscopic size, it is the MGVs that always end up doing the heavy lifting.

A dedicated line of miniatures are produced for the game by the War Times Journal.

name: Das Krieges-Spiel
description:
Full title was "Das Krieges-Spiel, oder Versuch, dem Kampf zweier gegeneinander Krieg fuhrenden Armeen in einem Brett-Spiele nachzuahmen".

The game is played on a hexagon-shaped board divided into triangular areas, divided down the center by a border river. Two players each set up 52 different circular paper markers representing different military units and officers. Different types of units can move and fire in different patterns around them. Each turn a player can move or attack with up to five units and five officers.

Combat is deterministic based on the combat power of different units in close combat or when firing at enemy units at a distance. If one side is strong enough in a battle an attacked unit can be either eliminated or captured. If an attack is not strong enough the difference in combat power is recorded, per unit type, so that the next battle against a unit of the same time becomes easier. The remaining strength of individual units are not tracked, only an abstract counter per type of unit.

Units in a player's capital city, located at two opposite sides of the board, can be covered and moved without revealing its type to the other player, providing some fog of war and introducing some uncertainty into the otherwise deterministic combats. Each player is allowed to have 10 covered units or officers.

A player wins by eliminating the highest ranked officer of the other player, the king.

—user summmary

name: The Ultimate Adventures of The ULTIMATE ALLIANCE
description:
THE CITY IS UNDER ATTACK! Super Villains, space aliens, killer robots and more. The Ultimate Alliance must spring in to action. Unfortunately, they don't have the best organizational skills and a lot of random junk is mixed in with their super hero gear. But there's no time to make excuses or search for the perfect gear. All they can do is use the first thing they grab to save the day.

The Ultimate Adventures of The ULTIMATE ALLIANCE, is a fun, semi-co-operative card game for 3+ players. Where each player takes on the role of a Super Hero in an attempt to save the town from the latest threat. Each round the "Mayor" or judge creates a villain by drawing a Villain card, and then powers them up with 2 "Bad-er" cards (enhancement cards that make the bad guy bad-er), and a location card to set the scene.

Players then each receive a gear card, some helpful some not, and must come up with a plan to defeat the villain. Each player then pitches their idea to the Mayor, who picks which hero to hire based off of their plans. The winning hero receives points based off of the threat level of the Bad-er cards (1-3). Heroes also have the option of teaming up with other players and their gear to win and split the points, or push their luck and go solo and claim them all for themselves. The Mayor role then rotates each round.

The game ends at a preset point limit, decided before the game starts. The player with the most points wins!

Based off of the characters and world of The ULTIMATE ALLIANCE comic books by JH Comics. The game doesn't require any knowledge of the characters to play, but will provide some recognizable gear, bad guys and locations to fans of the comic.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Guerrilla War: Simulation '60's
description:
Guerrilla War is a hypothetical insurgency simulation game bearing similarities to the Vietnam War. There are rules for ambushes, infiltration, and airmobile assaults.

This was an independently produced game with Spartan components. The artwork for the mounted map has a rough, hand-drawn appearance. It uses rows of offset rectangles that permit six-way movement, similar to that allowed by a hex grid. The counter art also has a hand-drawn appearance. The counters are printed on colored stock and need to be cut out. The rules are simply bound by a stapled corner. The combat results table card has a mix of typewritten and handwritten info. The advertised selling price was $5.00.

Martin Campion's "guide to conflict simulations," an article published in Moves magazine issue number 4, listed a playing time of 20 hours!

—user summary'

name: Reisen til fjellets indre
description: Use a dice to move forward. When standing on a square marked 'L', you must move backwards to the next 'L'. 'L' stands for lava stream. You win when standing on the center square.

name: Fancy
description:
Free game published in the February 2018 (GTM #216) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Professor Elemental Deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Background:
You and your friends are attending a
series of parties, where you want to be seen with the
fanciest people. “Fancy” was designed with the Professor
Elemental Pairs Deck, but is compatible with them all.

Equipment:
A PAIRS deck and a way to keep score.

Summary:
The game is played in several rounds.
Each is composed of eight tricks, or “parties.” The
role of dealer passes to the left after each round.
A full game is one round for each dealer.

Each Round:
Shuffle and deal a hand of eight cards
to each player. Players look at their hands, and then
pass two cards
to the player on their left. The player
on the dealer’s left will lead the first trick.

Each Trick:
Each trick is a party. To score points,
you can try to be the fanciest person, or to be seen
with someone much fancier than yourself.

Starting with the leader and proceeding to the left,
each player plays one card face up. The card you play
represents a party guest.

Important Rule:
A guest can’t appear twice at the same party. You may play a duplicate of a card that was already played, but it will be discarded, scoring no points.

Scoring the Trick:
After each player has played (or discarded) a card, the trick is scored as follows:

The Center of Attention:
The lowest card played is the most fabulous in the room. This card scores its face value for the player who played
it. This player will also lead the next trick.

The Hangers-On:
All other cards score points equal to the difference between themselves and
the next-lowest card. For example, if the cards are 3-4-6-10, they score 3, 1, 2, and 4 points.

Discards:
Copies of earlier cards are discarded. These score zero points.

After scoring, discard all the cards from this trick and play another, starting with the player who just played the lowest card. A full round is eight tricks, and a full game is one round for each player.

Game End:
The game ends after each player has dealt one round. Then, the player with the most points wins!

name: Kohlenklau Quartett
description:
This German card deck produced in 1944 was aimed at hammering home the importance of every German in saving energy to support the war effort. The 33-card deck includes lavish colour illustrations of the many vital uses of coal during WWII, especially in producing coal gas and plastics vital for the military.

While it is labelled as a "Quartett" game (Happy Families variant), it is designed to allow play of Schwarzer Peter (Old Maid variant) as well. For the former, 32 cards are divided into eight sets of four, and the player who collects the most sets wins. For the latter, the 33rd Kohlenklau card is added, and each set of four is divided into two pairs, one with red dots and the other with black dots. Players try to collect pairs while avoiding being stuck with the Kohlenklau card at the end of play.

The eight themes illustrated are: Coal for Fighting; Coal Plastics; Coal Extraction; Coal Processing; Coal Burning; Coal in Industry; Coal Conversion; and "Wonders from Coal", other uses including medicines, propellants, dyes, candles and soap.

The game includes a calendar card showing the date 1944, with days of the week and dates correct for that year.
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, World War II

name: ドレスル (DRESSURU)
description:
User summary
ドレスル (DRESSURU) is a card game using the 'butting' method where equal values cancel out (rules vary with player numbers).

Choose a dress and get fashion points! But careful not to be the only one to wear a specific dress but also not to have the same one as too many others! So, ready to dress up?

'Dressuru' is a play on words, which can translate roughly as 'put on a dress'. In Japan, being fashionable is tricky, as you should never 'be the only one'!

Publisher's summary
ドレスを選んでファッションポイントをゲット！
でも人と被らなくても被りすぎてもダメなバッティングゲーム！
さあ、ドレスル？

name: ドッペル言語 (Doppel-Gengo)
description:
User summary
ドッペル言語 (Doppel-Gengo) is a word memo card game, published in Japanese. Players are trying to find matching pairs of homonyms by reading texts on the backs of the cards. The title Doppel-Gengo means 'double words' but is a pun on doppelganger.

In this game, there are 50 word cards, making 25 pairs of homonyms. On each card face is a picture and a word in Japanese, along with a guide to its proninciation. The deck is shuffled and the cards spread out face-down.

On each card back is a short piece of text explaining the meaning of the word hidden on the card's face. Players read the texts, try to discern the hidden words, and then identify matching homonyms to claim pairs.

The game is very language dependent and cannot be played without knowing a good range of common Japanese words. However, the gameplay is open to translated editions using other homonyms to fit.

Publisher's summary
(このゲームは日本語に強く依存しています)
このゲームに含まれるカードは同音異義語25組のペア50枚です。
カードの表に単語と発音が、裏に単語の意味が書かれています。
裏に書かれた意味をヒントにして、同じ発音のペアを探しましょう。

name: Donkey Chase
description:
An Old West race game, with donkeys! You and a handful of your fellow characters in boom town "Dead Man's Creek" are bored and looking for something to do. You decide to have a donkey race!
